<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH400-686c0942--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="3dbad43da8644c67b8a51abab7947973"><span data-offset-key="3dbad43da8644c67b8a51abab7947973:0">Problem:</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="d8f89098cda74a918fc073fabe94f90d"><span data-offset-key="d8f89098cda74a918fc073fabe94f90d:0">You are given two non-empty linked lists representing two non-negative integers. The digits are stored in reverse order and each of their nodes contain a single digit. Add the two numbers and return it as a linked list.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="06fd90de02474dd0804654d5c5a756c4"><span data-offset-key="06fd90de02474dd0804654d5c5a756c4:0">You may assume the two numbers do not contain any leading zero, except the number 0 itself.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="c47bb18673cb4f7b8ac3a96c12b560cb"><span data-offset-key="c47bb18673cb4f7b8ac3a96c12b560cb:0">Example</span></span></span>

    Input: (2 -> 4 -> 3) + (5 -> 6 -> 4)Output: 7 -> 0 -> 8Explanation: 342 + 465 = 807.

###

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH400-686c0942--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="1455dad53c1047b2afa488cd694b28a6"><span data-offset-key="1455dad53c1047b2afa488cd694b28a6:0">Solution:</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="80d89a504cb24957915068a316be0523"><span data-offset-key="80d89a504cb24957915068a316be0523:0">Mind the last carry.</span></span></span>

    /** * Definition for singly-linked list. * function ListNode(val) { *     this.val = val; *     this.next = null; * } *//** * @param {ListNode} l1 * @param {ListNode} l2 * @return {ListNode} */let addTwoNumbers = function(l1, l2) {  const prehead = new ListNode()  let p = prehead  let carry = 0    for (let p1 = l1, p2 = l2: p1 || p2 || carry > 0; p = p.next) {    let sum = carry    if (p1) {      sum += p1.val      p1 = p1.next    }    if (p2) {      sum += p2.val      p2 = p2.next    }    carry = sum / 10 | 0    p.next = new ListNode(sum % 10)  }    return prehead.next};

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="2b1f27663dfb4253811c2606b037b0cd"><span data-offset-key="2b1f27663dfb4253811c2606b037b0cd:0">_Template generated via_ </span></span><a href="https://github.com/crimx/crx-leetmark" class="link-a079aa82--primary-53a25e66--link-faf6c434"><span data-key="07e3012eb80f40f596afbd6b108c88e0"><span data-offset-key="07e3012eb80f40f596afbd6b108c88e0:0"><em>Leetmark</em></span></span></a><span data-key="c363bf90cb4c4b46b0cc7715c41224d3"><span data-offset-key="c363bf90cb4c4b46b0cc7715c41224d3:0">_._</span></span></span>

Median of Two Sorted Arrays</span></span></a><span data-key="b1f5cd0bf4a449fc9a9ebbeb77e74974"><span data-offset-key="b1f5cd0bf4a449fc9a9ebbeb77e74974:0"><span data-slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span></span>

###

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH400-686c0942--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="58c16a49bc544ac5a2cab6e1432afee8"><span data-offset-key="58c16a49bc544ac5a2cab6e1432afee8:0">Problem:</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="dde1117e8566407f883e3373d3fb2501"><span data-offset-key="dde1117e8566407f883e3373d3fb2501:0">There are two sorted arrays nums1 and nums2 of size m and n respectively.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="63196c93828f4654a898b64395732d5d"><span data-offset-key="63196c93828f4654a898b64395732d5d:0">Find the median of the two sorted arrays. The overall run time complexity should be O(log (m+n)).</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="7c1060ad317d4ac9a4013ff386b7ce1d"><span data-offset-key="7c1060ad317d4ac9a4013ff386b7ce1d:0">Example 1:</span></span></span>

    nums1 = [1, 3]nums2 = [2]​The median is 2.0

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="6af78f5d2d17413583331eb6f7a45e84"><span data-offset-key="6af78f5d2d17413583331eb6f7a45e84:0">Example 2:</span></span></span>

    nums1 = [1, 2]nums2 = [3, 4]​The median is (2 + 3)/2 = 2.5

###

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH400-686c0942--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="15dd07fca46a4f98a01d1ace293cab45"><span data-offset-key="15dd07fca46a4f98a01d1ace293cab45:0">Solution:</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="d21cd7a891ce4c1a9bc92c68fb3633ba"><span data-offset-key="d21cd7a891ce4c1a9bc92c68fb3633ba:0">O(log (m+n)) means half of the sequence is ruled out on each loop. So obviously we need binary search.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="c1ecf4079c5740c6966ab489d5a7e3a1"><span data-offset-key="c1ecf4079c5740c6966ab489d5a7e3a1:0">To do it on two sorted arrays, we need a formula to guide division.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="ef10f0ec17a64dbb8b2b4a6505ca009e"><span data-offset-key="ef10f0ec17a64dbb8b2b4a6505ca009e:0">Let </span><span data-offset-key="ef10f0ec17a64dbb8b2b4a6505ca009e:1">`nums3`</span><span data-offset-key="ef10f0ec17a64dbb8b2b4a6505ca009e:2"> be the sorted array combining all the items in </span><span data-offset-key="ef10f0ec17a64dbb8b2b4a6505ca009e:3">`nums1`</span><span data-offset-key="ef10f0ec17a64dbb8b2b4a6505ca009e:4"> and </span><span data-offset-key="ef10f0ec17a64dbb8b2b4a6505ca009e:5">`nums2`</span><span data-offset-key="ef10f0ec17a64dbb8b2b4a6505ca009e:6">.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="9fd59f5d54d84458a9dd1329b18e1900"><span data-offset-key="9fd59f5d54d84458a9dd1329b18e1900:0">If </span><span data-offset-key="9fd59f5d54d84458a9dd1329b18e1900:1">`nums2[j-1] <= nums1[i] <= nums2[j]`</span><span data-offset-key="9fd59f5d54d84458a9dd1329b18e1900:2">, then we know </span><span data-offset-key="9fd59f5d54d84458a9dd1329b18e1900:3">`nums1[i]`</span><span data-offset-key="9fd59f5d54d84458a9dd1329b18e1900:4"> is at </span><span data-offset-key="9fd59f5d54d84458a9dd1329b18e1900:5">`num3[i+j]`</span><span data-offset-key="9fd59f5d54d84458a9dd1329b18e1900:6">. Same goes </span><span data-offset-key="9fd59f5d54d84458a9dd1329b18e1900:7">`nums1[i-1] <= nums2[j] <= nums1[i]`</span><span data-offset-key="9fd59f5d54d84458a9dd1329b18e1900:8">.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="c0720d701c994ddeacffdf2911e005e0"><span data-offset-key="c0720d701c994ddeacffdf2911e005e0:0">Let </span><span data-offset-key="c0720d701c994ddeacffdf2911e005e0:1">`k`</span><span data-offset-key="c0720d701c994ddeacffdf2911e005e0:2"> be </span><span data-offset-key="c0720d701c994ddeacffdf2911e005e0:3">`⌊(m+n-1)/2⌋`</span><span data-offset-key="c0720d701c994ddeacffdf2911e005e0:4">. We need to find </span><span data-offset-key="c0720d701c994ddeacffdf2911e005e0:5">`nums3[k]`</span><span data-offset-key="c0720d701c994ddeacffdf2911e005e0:6"> (and also </span><span data-offset-key="c0720d701c994ddeacffdf2911e005e0:7">`nums3[k+1]`</span><span data-offset-key="c0720d701c994ddeacffdf2911e005e0:8"> if m+n is even).</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="a05851f7260b4d57aa1d4946e754beac"><span data-offset-key="a05851f7260b4d57aa1d4946e754beac:0">Let </span><span data-offset-key="a05851f7260b4d57aa1d4946e754beac:1">`i + j = k`</span><span data-offset-key="a05851f7260b4d57aa1d4946e754beac:2">, if we find </span><span data-offset-key="a05851f7260b4d57aa1d4946e754beac:3">`nums2[j-1] <= nums1[i] <= nums2[j]`</span><span data-offset-key="a05851f7260b4d57aa1d4946e754beac:4"> or </span><span data-offset-key="a05851f7260b4d57aa1d4946e754beac:5">`nums1[i-1] <= nums2[j] <= nums1[i]`</span><span data-offset-key="a05851f7260b4d57aa1d4946e754beac:6">, then we got </span><span data-offset-key="a05851f7260b4d57aa1d4946e754beac:7">`k`</span><span data-offset-key="a05851f7260b4d57aa1d4946e754beac:8">.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="c63b69f966384b91aa440c754aa14925"><span data-offset-key="c63b69f966384b91aa440c754aa14925:0">Otherwise, if </span><span data-offset-key="c63b69f966384b91aa440c754aa14925:1">`nums1[i] <= nums2[j]`</span><span data-offset-key="c63b69f966384b91aa440c754aa14925:2"> then we know </span><span data-offset-key="c63b69f966384b91aa440c754aa14925:3">`nums1[i] < nums2[j-1]`</span><span data-offset-key="c63b69f966384b91aa440c754aa14925:4"> (because we did not find </span><span data-offset-key="c63b69f966384b91aa440c754aa14925:5">`k`</span><span data-offset-key="c63b69f966384b91aa440c754aa14925:6">).</span></span></span>

- <span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="47e033d2bb904baea74c2b60cbfb418c"><span data-offset-key="47e033d2bb904baea74c2b60cbfb418c:0">There are </span><span data-offset-key="47e033d2bb904baea74c2b60cbfb418c:1">`i`</span><span data-offset-key="47e033d2bb904baea74c2b60cbfb418c:2"> items before </span><span data-offset-key="47e033d2bb904baea74c2b60cbfb418c:3">`nums1[i]`</span><span data-offset-key="47e033d2bb904baea74c2b60cbfb418c:4">, and </span><span data-offset-key="47e033d2bb904baea74c2b60cbfb418c:5">`j-1`</span><span data-offset-key="47e033d2bb904baea74c2b60cbfb418c:6"> items brefor </span><span data-offset-key="47e033d2bb904baea74c2b60cbfb418c:7">`nums2[j-1]`</span><span data-offset-key="47e033d2bb904baea74c2b60cbfb418c:8">, which means </span><span data-offset-key="47e033d2bb904baea74c2b60cbfb418c:9">`nums1[0...i]`</span><span data-offset-key="47e033d2bb904baea74c2b60cbfb418c:10"> are before </span><span data-offset-key="47e033d2bb904baea74c2b60cbfb418c:11">`nums3[i+j-1]`</span><span data-offset-key="47e033d2bb904baea74c2b60cbfb418c:12">. So we now know </span><span data-offset-key="47e033d2bb904baea74c2b60cbfb418c:13">`nums1[0...i] < nums3[k]`</span><span data-offset-key="47e033d2bb904baea74c2b60cbfb418c:14">. They can be safely discarded.</span></span></span>

- <span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="b1df89c18a024eb98181f7c4aa886b40"><span data-offset-key="b1df89c18a024eb98181f7c4aa886b40:0">We Also have </span><span data-offset-key="b1df89c18a024eb98181f7c4aa886b40:1">`nums1[i] < nums2[j]`</span><span data-offset-key="b1df89c18a024eb98181f7c4aa886b40:2">, which means </span><span data-offset-key="b1df89c18a024eb98181f7c4aa886b40:3">`nums2[j...n)`</span><span data-offset-key="b1df89c18a024eb98181f7c4aa886b40:4"> are after </span><span data-offset-key="b1df89c18a024eb98181f7c4aa886b40:5">`nums3[i+j]`</span><span data-offset-key="b1df89c18a024eb98181f7c4aa886b40:6">. So </span><span data-offset-key="b1df89c18a024eb98181f7c4aa886b40:7">`nums2[j...n) > nums3[k]`</span><span data-offset-key="b1df89c18a024eb98181f7c4aa886b40:8">.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="14de759562164fe19943de895555ff2e"><span data-offset-key="14de759562164fe19943de895555ff2e:0">Same goes </span><span data-offset-key="14de759562164fe19943de895555ff2e:1">`nums1[i-1] <= nums2[j] <= nums1[i]`</span><span data-offset-key="14de759562164fe19943de895555ff2e:2">.</span></span></span>

    /** * @param {number[]} nums1 * @param {number[]} nums2 * @return {number} */let findMedianSortedArrays = function (nums1, nums2) {  const mid = (nums1.length + nums2.length - 1) / 2 | 0​  if ((nums1.length + nums2.length) % 2 === 0) {    return (_find(nums1, nums2, mid) + _find(nums1, nums2, mid + 1)) / 2  }​  return _find(nums1, nums2, mid)}​​function _find (nums1, nums2, k) {  if (nums1.length > nums2.length) {    // So that the `i` below is always smalller than k,    // which makes `j` always non-negative    [nums1, nums2] = [nums2, nums1]  }  let s1 = 0  let s2 = 0  let e1 = nums1.length  let e2 = nums2.length​  while (s1 < e1 || s2 < e2) {    const i = s1 + ((e1 - s1) / 2 | 0)    const j = k - i    const ni = i >= e1 ? Infinity : nums1[i]    const nj = j >= e2 ? Infinity : nums2[j]    const ni_1 = i <= 0 ? -Infinity : nums1[i-1]    const nj_1 = j <= 0 ? -Infinity : nums2[j-1]​    if (nj_1 <= ni && ni <= nj) {      return ni    }​    if (ni_1 <= nj && nj <= ni) {      return nj    }​    if (ni <= nj) {      s1 = i + 1      e2 = j    } else {      s2 = j + 1      e1 = i    }  }};

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="a24bf25533a64bb3a24a201915cb5b22"><span data-offset-key="a24bf25533a64bb3a24a201915cb5b22:0">_Template generated via_ </span></span><a href="https://github.com/crimx/crx-leetmark" class="link-a079aa82--primary-53a25e66--link-faf6c434"><span data-key="c8e02c56595e41f9825a706e50e89665"><span data-offset-key="c8e02c56595e41f9825a706e50e89665:0"><em>Leetmark</em></span></span></a><span data-key="734b6d32c4724c87aafc21f41eaf56f7"><span data-offset-key="734b6d32c4724c87aafc21f41eaf56f7:0">_._</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH600-23f228db--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="9f2b1c3cdbdb4764aa9ac701597ce344"><span data-offset-key="9f2b1c3cdbdb4764aa9ac701597ce344:0"><span data-slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><a href="https://leetcode.com/problems/zigzag-conversion/description/" class="link-a079aa82--primary-53a25e66--link-faf6c434"><span data-key="5a86eae002b042f2b64081a8eab26120"><span data-offset-key="5a86eae002b042f2b64081a8eab26120:0">6. ZigZag Conversion</span></span></a><span data-key="84e8b2507e5b411c9fbe6e16b1a68d4c"><span data-offset-key="84e8b2507e5b411c9fbe6e16b1a68d4c:0"><span data-slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH400-686c0942--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="669a7ebbccf3434597518df9c10f383a"><span data-offset-key="669a7ebbccf3434597518df9c10f383a:0">Problem:</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="bd43957091db4c70b1d3c038074d41f0"><span data-offset-key="bd43957091db4c70b1d3c038074d41f0:0">The string </span><span data-offset-key="bd43957091db4c70b1d3c038074d41f0:1">`"PAYPALISHIRING"`</span><span data-offset-key="bd43957091db4c70b1d3c038074d41f0:2"> is written in a zigzag pattern on a given number of rows like this: (you may want to display this pattern in a fixed font for better legibility)</span></span></span>

    P   A   H   NA P L S I I GY   I   R

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="ab1828f83d9b4a149e5bb6dc5cb34a16"><span data-offset-key="ab1828f83d9b4a149e5bb6dc5cb34a16:0">And then read line by line: </span><span data-offset-key="ab1828f83d9b4a149e5bb6dc5cb34a16:1">`"PAHNAPLSIIGYIR"`</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="084b724d156d443dbea01172f793a77a"><span data-offset-key="084b724d156d443dbea01172f793a77a:0">Write the code that will take a string and make this conversion given a number of rows:</span></span></span>

    string convert(string s, int numRows);

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="10b712cb927e4968bd46ae0be0702414"><span data-offset-key="10b712cb927e4968bd46ae0be0702414:0">**Example 1:**</span></span></span>

    Input: s = "PAYPALISHIRING", numRows = 3Output: "PAHNAPLSIIGYIR"

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="06a2abd9cdc0492c9f5ffc60e6a09350"><span data-offset-key="06a2abd9cdc0492c9f5ffc60e6a09350:0">**Example 2:**</span></span></span>

    Input: s = "PAYPALISHIRING", numRows = 4Output: "PINALSIGYAHRPI"Explanation:​P     I    NA   L S  I GY A   H RP     I

###

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH400-686c0942--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="44d3167d92cc4351b1ba589b14726a31"><span data-offset-key="44d3167d92cc4351b1ba589b14726a31:0">Solution:</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="75694b340a214e049bb617e12845b5c8"><span data-offset-key="75694b340a214e049bb617e12845b5c8:0">Squeeze the zigzag pattern horizontally to form a matrix. Now deal with the odd and even columns respectively.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="465324b813f740ce85a81509bea959a7"><span data-offset-key="465324b813f740ce85a81509bea959a7:0">For example let numRows be 5, if we list out the indecies:</span></span></span>

    row 1    00    08    16 2    01 07 09 15 17 3    02 06 10 14 18 4    03 05 11 13 19 5    04    12    20

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="9234c6a69b7541a6954f6c430ca169b3"><span data-offset-key="9234c6a69b7541a6954f6c430ca169b3:0">First calculate the matrix width:</span></span></span>

    pairs = floor( len(s) / (numRows + numRows - 2) )width = pairs * 2 + ceil( (len(s) - pairs * (numRows + numRows - 2)) / numRows )

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="92599e5808be45bd9bac2b423641875d"><span data-offset-key="92599e5808be45bd9bac2b423641875d:0">We can easily make a observation that the direction of odd and even columns and different.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="e08a2c839b344743ac7e8e18a5126108"><span data-offset-key="e08a2c839b344743ac7e8e18a5126108:0">Let the first column be index 0 and let i be the current position at column col.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="648ae8fd0675411592c76f13df76ce25"><span data-offset-key="648ae8fd0675411592c76f13df76ce25:0">We need to count the items between matrix\[row\]\[col\] and matrix\[row\]\[col+1\], exclusive.</span></span></span>

    next_i = i + (numRows - row) + (numRows - row), if col is even && 1 < row < numRowsnext_i = i + row - 2 + row, if col is odd && 1 < row < numRows

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="def9ff0b31264f2aa7cb8eb3915edbaf"><span data-offset-key="def9ff0b31264f2aa7cb8eb3915edbaf:0">If row == 1 or row == numRows, skip the odd columns.</span></span></span>

    next_i = i + numRows + (numRows - 2), if col is even && (row == 1 || row == numRows)

    /** * @param {string} s * @param {number} numRows * @return {string} */let convert = function(s, numRows) {  if (numRows <= 1) { return s }​  const pairs = Math.floor(s.length / (numRows + numRows - 2))  const width = pairs * 2 + Math.ceil((s.length - pairs * (numRows + numRows - 2)) / numRows)​  let result = ''​  for (let row = 1; row <= numRows; row++) {    let i = row - 1    result += s[i] || ''    for (let col = 0; col < width; col++) {      if (row === 1 || row === numRows) {        if (col % 2 === 0) {          i += numRows + (numRows - 2)        } else {          continue        }      } else {        if (col % 2 === 0) {          i += (numRows - row) + (numRows - row)        } else {          i += row - 2 + row        }      }      result += s[i] || ''    }  }​  return result};

Reverse Integer</span></span></a><span data-key="76276e0000a0400ea215acc9e9bdbdc5"><span data-offset-key="76276e0000a0400ea215acc9e9bdbdc5:0"><span data-slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH400-686c0942--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="18baaf33394e4649af5df4509f91450c"><span data-offset-key="18baaf33394e4649af5df4509f91450c:0">Problem:</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="dbe317d905ca4956bbba0009e880ee8d"><span data-offset-key="dbe317d905ca4956bbba0009e880ee8d:0">Given a 32-bit signed integer, reverse digits of an integer.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="9304b0d0d9e64112b4549d2ad96e127c"><span data-offset-key="9304b0d0d9e64112b4549d2ad96e127c:0">**Example 1:**</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="206dc5c0061841fd81bd01622f9493f7"><span data-offset-key="206dc5c0061841fd81bd01622f9493f7:0">**Example 2:**</span></span></span>

    Input: -123Output: -321

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="ea8251f08d5949c6881045c9dc105d0a"><span data-offset-key="ea8251f08d5949c6881045c9dc105d0a:0">**Example 3:**</span></span></span>

    Input: 120Output: 21

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="83291a393a8441268c917e1cf958ee28"><span data-offset-key="83291a393a8441268c917e1cf958ee28:0">**Note:**</span><span data-offset-key="83291a393a8441268c917e1cf958ee28:1"> Assume we are dealing with an environment which could only store integers within the 32-bit signed integer range: \[−231, 231 − 1\]. For the purpose of this problem, assume that your function returns 0 when the reversed integer overflows.</span></span></span>

###

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH400-686c0942--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="902c8825964c4857946b4e3a33670a4b"><span data-offset-key="902c8825964c4857946b4e3a33670a4b:0">Solution:</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="e3b2bba32738469ebb3b37472d19630c"><span data-offset-key="e3b2bba32738469ebb3b37472d19630c:0">**ONE**</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="6bc4282bef8b4ab9ab5de3adc0e78ce8"><span data-offset-key="6bc4282bef8b4ab9ab5de3adc0e78ce8:0">This is a JavaScript specific solution. It is esay to write but slow to run because it generates O(n) space. This could end up a huge array.</span></span></span>

    /** * @param {number} x * @return {number} */let reverse = function(x) {  let n = Math.abs(x).toString().split('').reverse().join('')  if (n > 2147483647) { return 0 }  return (x < 0? -1: 1) * n};

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="9f8aba24732f417eb45de4876041c7ee"><span data-offset-key="9f8aba24732f417eb45de4876041c7ee:0">**TWO**</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="b6fefd855a2445f39f98c1617efbde41"><span data-offset-key="b6fefd855a2445f39f98c1617efbde41:0">Pure mathamatical solution.</span></span></span>

    /** * @param {number} x * @return {number} */let reverse = function(x) {  let result = 0  while (x) {    result = result * 10 + x % 10    x = x / 10 | 0  }  return Math.abs(result) > 2147483647 ? 0 : result};

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="265bd2236cbd4f59b29b7b35cb2d9ad2"><span data-offset-key="265bd2236cbd4f59b29b7b35cb2d9ad2:0">_Template generated via_ </span></span><a href="https://github.com/crimx/crx-leetmark" class="link-a079aa82--primary-53a25e66--link-faf6c434"><span data-key="0df534fbb67a4e1184650eb624d34b46"><span data-offset-key="0df534fbb67a4e1184650eb624d34b46:0"><em>Leetmark</em></span></span></a><span data-key="9b5ac18b6e3243818bbe867be7b9eaed"><span data-offset-key="9b5ac18b6e3243818bbe867be7b9eaed:0">_._</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH600-23f228db--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="85e1ad7a0bbc4f21b23c4c54a972c661"><span data-offset-key="85e1ad7a0bbc4f21b23c4c54a972c661:0">Difficulty: Medium Related Topics: "Math": </span></span><a href="https://leetcode.com/tag/math" class="link-a079aa82--primary-53a25e66--link-faf6c434"><span data-key="48b5f5545588486eb75f2c5dcf5432e2"><span data-offset-key="48b5f5545588486eb75f2c5dcf5432e2:0">https://leetcode.com/tag/math</span></span></a><span data-key="31fcd98ef7644fcdbea2cbce6bda7356"><span data-offset-key="31fcd98ef7644fcdbea2cbce6bda7356:0"> "String": </span></span><a href="https://leetcode.com/tag/string" class="link-a079aa82--primary-53a25e66--link-faf6c434"><span data-key="5fe7a9926d184f24b6084c7a8c68856d"><span data-offset-key="5fe7a9926d184f24b6084c7a8c68856d:0">https://leetcode.com/tag/string</span></span></a><span data-key="ba91b238aefb47b89b8efd0b1923a8df"><span data-offset-key="ba91b238aefb47b89b8efd0b1923a8df:0"> Similar Questions: "Reverse Integer": </span></span><a href="https://leetcode.com/problems/reverse-integer" class="link-a079aa82--primary-53a25e66--link-faf6c434"><span data-key="ad9c3dfe97e647d5b72dcdb25a52f60a"><span data-offset-key="ad9c3dfe97e647d5b72dcdb25a52f60a:0">https://leetcode.com/problems/reverse-integer</span></span></a><span data-key="dbe6049b559643dcb19fd3b3c29533ed"><span data-offset-key="dbe6049b559643dcb19fd3b3c29533ed:0"> "Valid Number": </span></span><a href="https://leetcode.com/problems/valid-number" class="link-a079aa82--primary-53a25e66--link-faf6c434"><span data-key="7ea4356206ba4b9f9ac1944b9f1dcb10"><span data-offset-key="7ea4356206ba4b9f9ac1944b9f1dcb10:0">https://leetcode.com/problems/valid-number</span></span></a><span data-key="20933bccd87a48029b41f1c25d15ef25"><span data-offset-key="20933bccd87a48029b41f1c25d15ef25:0"><span data-slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span></span>

String to Integer (atoi)</span></span></a><span data-key="d62157c863944cf7a1601bf137115028"><span data-offset-key="d62157c863944cf7a1601bf137115028:0"><span data-slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span></span>

###

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH400-686c0942--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="85a93de065534cfaa907683e48f99108"><span data-offset-key="85a93de065534cfaa907683e48f99108:0">Problem:</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="d3f7ae81c8bf4625b137d4e54c7fc6b1"><span data-offset-key="d3f7ae81c8bf4625b137d4e54c7fc6b1:0">Implement </span><span data-offset-key="d3f7ae81c8bf4625b137d4e54c7fc6b1:1">`atoi`</span><span data-offset-key="d3f7ae81c8bf4625b137d4e54c7fc6b1:2"> which converts a string to an integer.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="adb3e776ab3344cdac1fc77714769d31"><span data-offset-key="adb3e776ab3344cdac1fc77714769d31:0">The function first discards as many whitespace characters as necessary until the first non-whitespace character is found. Then, starting from this character, takes an optional initial plus or minus sign followed by as many numerical digits as possible, and interprets them as a numerical value.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="df929b162f9f4107bcd9b74660bdccb8"><span data-offset-key="df929b162f9f4107bcd9b74660bdccb8:0">The string can contain additional characters after those that form the integral number, which are ignored and have no effect on the behavior of this function.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="b63976170eaf49949672922634ab180c"><span data-offset-key="b63976170eaf49949672922634ab180c:0">If the first sequence of non-whitespace characters in str is not a valid integral number, or if no such sequence exists because either str is empty or it contains only whitespace characters, no conversion is performed.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="665980c5b273400e8d6516493429a553"><span data-offset-key="665980c5b273400e8d6516493429a553:0">If no valid conversion could be performed, a zero value is returned.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="870648c638214390ac4ebee7e70d8a3c"><span data-offset-key="870648c638214390ac4ebee7e70d8a3c:0">**Note:**</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="7ceb9e7dbe5d42758ca26fb09e119fc9"><span data-offset-key="7ceb9e7dbe5d42758ca26fb09e119fc9:0">Only the space character </span><span data-offset-key="7ceb9e7dbe5d42758ca26fb09e119fc9:1">`' '`</span><span data-offset-key="7ceb9e7dbe5d42758ca26fb09e119fc9:2"> is considered as whitespace character. Assume we are dealing with an environment which could only store integers within the 32-bit signed integer range: \[−231, 231 − 1\]. If the numerical value is out of the range of representable values, INT_MAX (231 − 1) or INT_MIN (−231) is returned.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="e5d9820b021b434fbd0ee23bdb7076cc"><span data-offset-key="e5d9820b021b434fbd0ee23bdb7076cc:0">**Example 1:**</span></span></span>

    Input: "42"Output: 42

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="09f66dbfc6b5409693bbc2226c5e68b1"><span data-offset-key="09f66dbfc6b5409693bbc2226c5e68b1:0">**Example 2:**</span></span></span>

    Input: "   -42"Output: -42Explanation: The first non-whitespace character is '-', which is the minus sign.             Then take as many numerical digits as possible, which gets 42.

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="efa851586976463f92090374d73afd88"><span data-offset-key="efa851586976463f92090374d73afd88:0">**Example 3:**</span></span></span>

    Input: "4193 with words"Output: 4193Explanation: Conversion stops at digit '3' as the next character is not a numerical digit.

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="85aa41cc41ac4c60985c49d7f7533bbf"><span data-offset-key="85aa41cc41ac4c60985c49d7f7533bbf:0">**Example 4:**</span></span></span>

    Input: "words and 987"Output: 0Explanation: The first non-whitespace character is 'w', which is not a numerical              digit or a +/- sign. Therefore no valid conversion could be performed.

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="206e2d3ce42b47edb4688cf4823350fa"><span data-offset-key="206e2d3ce42b47edb4688cf4823350fa:0">**Example 5:**</span></span></span>

    Input: "-91283472332"Output: -2147483648Explanation: The number "-91283472332" is out of the range of a 32-bit signed integer.             Thefore INT_MIN (−231) is returned.

###

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH400-686c0942--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="174e0303dcff4846aea735bcd61b96fc"><span data-offset-key="174e0303dcff4846aea735bcd61b96fc:0">Solution:</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="85cccb11e2bb497f89979232c33c2229"><span data-offset-key="85cccb11e2bb497f89979232c33c2229:0">**ONE**</span></span></span>

    /** * @param {string} str * @return {number} */let myAtoi = function (str) {  return Math.min(2147483647, Math.max(-2147483648, parseInt(str))) || 0};

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="ff09e508e464489dbc9eefb473866fb1"><span data-offset-key="ff09e508e464489dbc9eefb473866fb1:0">**TWO**</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="db28e504879d44ebad359cb959532044"><span data-offset-key="db28e504879d44ebad359cb959532044:0">Looks like </span><span data-offset-key="db28e504879d44ebad359cb959532044:1">`Number()`</span><span data-offset-key="db28e504879d44ebad359cb959532044:2"> is faster than </span><span data-offset-key="db28e504879d44ebad359cb959532044:3">`parseInt()`</span><span data-offset-key="db28e504879d44ebad359cb959532044:4">.</span></span></span>

    /** * @param {string} str * @return {number} */let myAtoi = function (str) {  return Math.min(2147483647, Math.max(-2147483648, (/^ *[-+]?\d+/.exec(str) || [0])[0]))};

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="49389fc773e5439ab8357be59f8c73f8"><span data-offset-key="49389fc773e5439ab8357be59f8c73f8:0">**THREE**</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="94da463f4838405294fee8c036081fc6"><span data-offset-key="94da463f4838405294fee8c036081fc6:0">General solution.</span></span></span>

    /** * @param {string} str * @return {number} */let myAtoi = function (str) {  let sign = 1  let i = 0​  while (i < str.length) {    const cc = str.charCodeAt(i++)    if (cc === 45) { // -      sign = -1      break    } else if (cc === 43) { // +      break    } else if (cc >= 48 && cc <= 57) { // 0-9      i--      break    } else if (cc !== 32) { // space      return 0    }  }​  let result = 0  while (i < str.length) {    const digit = str.charCodeAt(i++) - 48    if (digit < 0 || digit > 9) {      break    }    result = result * 10 + digit  }​  return Math.min(2147483647, Math.max(-2147483648, result * sign))};

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="1fa7177c8d204d47a3f7fb8e5706fbdf"><span data-offset-key="1fa7177c8d204d47a3f7fb8e5706fbdf:0">_Template generated via_ </span></span><a href="https://github.com/crimx/crx-leetmark" class="link-a079aa82--primary-53a25e66--link-faf6c434"><span data-key="0acbe297f00e4291b415c8dac2e29bf5"><span data-offset-key="0acbe297f00e4291b415c8dac2e29bf5:0"><em>Leetmark</em></span></span></a><span data-key="e92f6e6cea024548a3d6f5d030f32536"><span data-offset-key="e92f6e6cea024548a3d6f5d030f32536:0">_._</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH600-23f228db--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="1c174cb2cf0c4d17bff211e6a505cbb7"><span data-offset-key="1c174cb2cf0c4d17bff211e6a505cbb7:0">Difficulty: Easy Related Topics: "Math": </span></span><a href="https://leetcode.com/tag/math" class="link-a079aa82--primary-53a25e66--link-faf6c434"><span data-key="fc4e38bd0db44a2f8b18e3238fd2963c"><span data-offset-key="fc4e38bd0db44a2f8b18e3238fd2963c:0">https://leetcode.com/tag/math</span></span></a><span data-key="b3a98c16442b43af8d42ac8440340fe8"><span data-offset-key="b3a98c16442b43af8d42ac8440340fe8:0"> Similar Questions: "Palindrome Linked List": </span></span><a href="https://leetcode.com/problems/palindrome-linked-list" class="link-a079aa82--primary-53a25e66--link-faf6c434"><span data-key="189329456cb74658bd01e29abb07fd3b"><span data-offset-key="189329456cb74658bd01e29abb07fd3b:0">https://leetcode.com/problems/palindrome-linked-list</span></span></a><span data-key="30793cc4142d4b83973d4f0ad3496dc1"><span data-offset-key="30793cc4142d4b83973d4f0ad3496dc1:0"><span data-slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH600-23f228db--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="41edc262664d4b0eaccb569927a74d5b"><span data-offset-key="41edc262664d4b0eaccb569927a74d5b:0"><span data-slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><a href="https://leetcode.com/problems/palindrome-number/description/" class="link-a079aa82--primary-53a25e66--link-faf6c434"><span data-key="2e119ae0f29b41a9801dbd3bafea185e"><span data-offset-key="2e119ae0f29b41a9801dbd3bafea185e:0">9. Palindrome Number</span></span></a><span data-key="117908d455734507b521c22867ffd16d"><span data-offset-key="117908d455734507b521c22867ffd16d:0"><span data-slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span></span>

###

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH400-686c0942--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="a6ae01cb80ba4223a8b8c338e292d467"><span data-offset-key="a6ae01cb80ba4223a8b8c338e292d467:0">Problem:</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="22f8a130569643e8b27895036f814893"><span data-offset-key="22f8a130569643e8b27895036f814893:0">Determine whether an integer is a palindrome. An integer is a palindrome when it reads the same backward as forward.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="fb6bbe6b2130402bb6b208e621b70f04"><span data-offset-key="fb6bbe6b2130402bb6b208e621b70f04:0">**Example 1:**</span></span></span>

    Input: 121Output: true

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="997f402205264068a35bd8203aab935e"><span data-offset-key="997f402205264068a35bd8203aab935e:0">**Example 2:**</span></span></span>

    Input: -121Output: falseExplanation: From left to right, it reads -121. From right to left, it becomes 121-. Therefore it is not a palindrome.

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="e99535003f5140189f68ed5717c14798"><span data-offset-key="e99535003f5140189f68ed5717c14798:0">**Example 3:**</span></span></span>

    Input: 10Output: falseExplanation: Reads 01 from right to left. Therefore it is not a palindrome.

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="3c6a7d8b2da049cc9a1ff7684f290b55"><span data-offset-key="3c6a7d8b2da049cc9a1ff7684f290b55:0">**Follow up:**</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="6d5971885eaf41c7b0a10f1506b015b7"><span data-offset-key="6d5971885eaf41c7b0a10f1506b015b7:0">Coud you solve it without converting the integer to a string?</span></span></span>

###

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH400-686c0942--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="1e7380a9703e4b079f4da1172429276c"><span data-offset-key="1e7380a9703e4b079f4da1172429276c:0">Solution:</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="469126d8bb5a4d24b6cea9a45c55e79b"><span data-offset-key="469126d8bb5a4d24b6cea9a45c55e79b:0">**ONE**</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="b3d2e6facd8c4026a5bbb318a3645496"><span data-offset-key="b3d2e6facd8c4026a5bbb318a3645496:0">Easy to write but slow since it generates an array.</span></span></span>

    /** * @param {number} x * @return {boolean} */let isPalindrome = function(x) {  return x == String(x).split('').reverse().join('')};

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="0b015de5f3d14a07ac687dff756a38b6"><span data-offset-key="0b015de5f3d14a07ac687dff756a38b6:0">**TWO**</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="ef1b7748dfaa4292be94d4686be40838"><span data-offset-key="ef1b7748dfaa4292be94d4686be40838:0">A bit faster.</span></span></span>

    /** * @param {number} x * @return {boolean} */let isPalindrome = function(x) {  const s = String(x)  for (let i = 0, j = s.length -1; i < j; i++, j--) {    if (s[i] !== s[j]) {      return false    }  }  return true};

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="3ab92e40b6b94ad298a4fe454fa675ae"><span data-offset-key="3ab92e40b6b94ad298a4fe454fa675ae:0">**THREE**</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="8d55bf7c55e441f4986acda1fde14600"><span data-offset-key="8d55bf7c55e441f4986acda1fde14600:0">General solution. Combining </span></span><a href="file:///C:/MY-WEB-DEV/06-DS-ALGO-OUTTER/06-DS-ALGO/main/CONTENT/DS-n-Algos/SANDBOX/007.%20Reverse%20Integer.md" class="link-a079aa82--primary-53a25e66--link-faf6c434"><span data-key="004856d7c530417082fff31f9564428c"><span data-offset-key="004856d7c530417082fff31f9564428c:0">7. Reverse Integer</span></span></a><span data-key="c73d4ec11bec4209a6d2eb5e979bfad0"><span data-offset-key="c73d4ec11bec4209a6d2eb5e979bfad0:0">.</span></span></span>

    /** * @param {number} x * @return {boolean} */let isPalindrome = function(x) {  if (x < 0) { return false }  return x === reverse(x)};​/** * @param {number} x * @return {number} */function reverse (x) {  let result = 0  while (x) {    result = result * 10 + x % 10    x = x / 10 | 0  }  return result};

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="6741d2b7467847339cdaeb92b50ab401"><span data-offset-key="6741d2b7467847339cdaeb92b50ab401:0">_Template generated via_ </span></span><a href="https://github.com/crimx/crx-leetmark" class="link-a079aa82--primary-53a25e66--link-faf6c434"><span data-key="02370e8872a04e9c83da63422c81ca50"><span data-offset-key="02370e8872a04e9c83da63422c81ca50:0"><em>Leetmark</em></span></span></a><span data-key="bd24026b093a4404be6ef7a157c68a32"><span data-offset-key="bd24026b093a4404be6ef7a157c68a32:0">_._</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH600-23f228db--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="799bcd5101bd4ce0884dd1f916b555fc"><span data-offset-key="799bcd5101bd4ce0884dd1f916b555fc:0">Difficulty: Hard Related Topics: "String": </span></span><a href="https://leetcode.com/tag/string" class="link-a079aa82--primary-53a25e66--link-faf6c434"><span data-key="d8a820e9ec934e56b2795e981de2890f"><span data-offset-key="d8a820e9ec934e56b2795e981de2890f:0">https://leetcode.com/tag/string</span></span></a><span data-key="dcab81322f9a4baaaf321cbd5753a1e6"><span data-offset-key="dcab81322f9a4baaaf321cbd5753a1e6:0"> "Dynamic Programming": </span></span><a href="https://leetcode.com/tag/dynamic-programming" class="link-a079aa82--primary-53a25e66--link-faf6c434"><span data-key="962bd5ef2f6d49448a9bfff13d3327c4"><span data-offset-key="962bd5ef2f6d49448a9bfff13d3327c4:0">https://leetcode.com/tag/dynamic-programming</span></span></a><span data-key="974caf67283648b2b71d6fde430823b4"><span data-offset-key="974caf67283648b2b71d6fde430823b4:0"> "Backtracking": </span></span><a href="https://leetcode.com/tag/backtracking" class="link-a079aa82--primary-53a25e66--link-faf6c434"><span data-key="ee8af3cdfc324d059191c621305d87fe"><span data-offset-key="ee8af3cdfc324d059191c621305d87fe:0">https://leetcode.com/tag/backtracking</span></span></a><span data-key="158ca2ec16ea431bb286ce842d08fbe9"><span data-offset-key="158ca2ec16ea431bb286ce842d08fbe9:0"> Similar Questions: "Wildcard Matching": </span></span><a href="https://leetcode.com/problems/wildcard-matching" class="link-a079aa82--primary-53a25e66--link-faf6c434"><span data-key="7494af49c8d14612a980519f3e17dfb8"><span data-offset-key="7494af49c8d14612a980519f3e17dfb8:0">https://leetcode.com/problems/wildcard-matching</span></span></a><span data-key="861f06e3d21345ab801758ebdd0d0640"><span data-offset-key="861f06e3d21345ab801758ebdd0d0640:0"><span data-slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH600-23f228db--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="ec5f1d3b09104023a7d598f8b0735dfa"><span data-offset-key="ec5f1d3b09104023a7d598f8b0735dfa:0"><span data-slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><a href="https://leetcode.com/problems/regular-expression-matching/description/" class="link-a079aa82--primary-53a25e66--link-faf6c434"><span data-key="3975eb1d907041f99ce6974dc23d37ff"><span data-offset-key="3975eb1d907041f99ce6974dc23d37ff:0">10. Regular Expression Matching</span></span></a><span data-key="61f4191413904cac92ebb77e8fb69a26"><span data-offset-key="61f4191413904cac92ebb77e8fb69a26:0"><span data-slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span></span>

###

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH400-686c0942--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="e7c7e2890e5c4d7f849511781cc6eb9c"><span data-offset-key="e7c7e2890e5c4d7f849511781cc6eb9c:0">Problem:</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="09cc3a4b9e23467bbd886941fee58f59"><span data-offset-key="09cc3a4b9e23467bbd886941fee58f59:0">Given an input string (</span><span data-offset-key="09cc3a4b9e23467bbd886941fee58f59:1">`s`</span><span data-offset-key="09cc3a4b9e23467bbd886941fee58f59:2">) and a pattern (</span><span data-offset-key="09cc3a4b9e23467bbd886941fee58f59:3">`p`</span><span data-offset-key="09cc3a4b9e23467bbd886941fee58f59:4">), implement regular expression matching with support for </span><span data-offset-key="09cc3a4b9e23467bbd886941fee58f59:5">`'.'`</span><span data-offset-key="09cc3a4b9e23467bbd886941fee58f59:6"> and </span><span data-offset-key="09cc3a4b9e23467bbd886941fee58f59:7">`'*'`</span><span data-offset-key="09cc3a4b9e23467bbd886941fee58f59:8">.</span></span></span>

    '.' Matches any single character.'*' Matches zero or more of the preceding element.

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="3981530ad112412fb8800c79ff071c8d"><span data-offset-key="3981530ad112412fb8800c79ff071c8d:0">The matching should cover the </span><span data-offset-key="3981530ad112412fb8800c79ff071c8d:1">**entire**</span><span data-offset-key="3981530ad112412fb8800c79ff071c8d:2"> input string (not partial).</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="0438e1a034b34bd3b62c5c90ab847dd6"><span data-offset-key="0438e1a034b34bd3b62c5c90ab847dd6:0">**Note:**</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="ad5c7243df254d0d973698fb13490c67"><span data-offset-key="ad5c7243df254d0d973698fb13490c67:0">`s`</span><span data-offset-key="ad5c7243df254d0d973698fb13490c67:1"> could be empty and contains only lowercase letters </span><span data-offset-key="ad5c7243df254d0d973698fb13490c67:2">`a-z`</span><span data-offset-key="ad5c7243df254d0d973698fb13490c67:3">. </span><span data-offset-key="ad5c7243df254d0d973698fb13490c67:4">`p`</span><span data-offset-key="ad5c7243df254d0d973698fb13490c67:5"> could be empty and contains only lowercase letters </span><span data-offset-key="ad5c7243df254d0d973698fb13490c67:6">`a-z`</span><span data-offset-key="ad5c7243df254d0d973698fb13490c67:7">, and characters like </span><span data-offset-key="ad5c7243df254d0d973698fb13490c67:8">`.`</span><span data-offset-key="ad5c7243df254d0d973698fb13490c67:9"> or </span><span data-offset-key="ad5c7243df254d0d973698fb13490c67:10">`*`</span><span data-offset-key="ad5c7243df254d0d973698fb13490c67:11">.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="f120dec1d4d94bd9af707788d55ee624"><span data-offset-key="f120dec1d4d94bd9af707788d55ee624:0">**Example 1:**</span></span></span>

    Input:s = "aa"p = "a"Output: falseExplanation: "a" does not match the entire string "aa".

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="241c8b9ad38842c7b18b1747d1e57e32"><span data-offset-key="241c8b9ad38842c7b18b1747d1e57e32:0">**Example 2:**</span></span></span>

    Input:s = "aa"p = "a*"Output: trueExplanation: '*' means zero or more of the precedeng element, 'a'. Therefore, by repeating 'a' once, it becomes "aa".

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="2debdaf3c4e245d8b9384267b73d79f3"><span data-offset-key="2debdaf3c4e245d8b9384267b73d79f3:0">**Example 3:**</span></span></span>

    Input:s = "ab"p = ".*"Output: trueExplanation: ".*" means "zero or more (*) of any character (.)".

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="c3b71f4e3bb549758a732dd2f5ee5b90"><span data-offset-key="c3b71f4e3bb549758a732dd2f5ee5b90:0">**Example 4:**</span></span></span>

    Input:s = "aab"p = "c*a*b"Output: trueExplanation: c can be repeated 0 times, a can be repeated 1 time. Therefore it matches "aab".

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="864600eea3d44e77ba77f8bcd05a29e0"><span data-offset-key="864600eea3d44e77ba77f8bcd05a29e0:0">**Example 5:**</span></span></span>

    Input:s = "mississippi"p = "mis*is*p*."Output: false

###

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH400-686c0942--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="17ad5e50eeed4bf492a43422b257de13"><span data-offset-key="17ad5e50eeed4bf492a43422b257de13:0">Solution:</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="88fd334d997d412599e27dbb37ecd4a8"><span data-offset-key="88fd334d997d412599e27dbb37ecd4a8:0">**ONE**</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="241eace696d94cc8a7d78122cd9a8acc"><span data-offset-key="241eace696d94cc8a7d78122cd9a8acc:0">Cheating with real RegExp matching.</span></span></span>

    /** * @param {string} s * @param {string} p * @return {boolean} */let isMatch = function(s, p) {  if (p[0] === '*') { return false }  return new RegExp(`^${p}$`).test(s)};

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="68919c3b37694b7e95c4808ea388e608"><span data-offset-key="68919c3b37694b7e95c4808ea388e608:0">**TWO**</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="933f6060ecad4b9c928dcbaf5f4111c3"><span data-offset-key="933f6060ecad4b9c928dcbaf5f4111c3:0">Let f(i, j) be the matching result of s\[0...i) and p\[0...j).</span></span></span>

    f(0, j) =    j == 0 || // empty    p[j-1] == '*' && f(i, j-2) // matches 0 time, which matches empty string    f(i, 0) = false // pattern must cover the entire input string​f(i, j) =     if p[j-1] == '.'        f(i-1, j-1)    else if p[j-1] == '*'        f(i, j-2) || // matches 0 time        f(i-1, j) && (s[i-1] == p[j-2] || p[j-2] == '.') // matches 1 or multiple times    else        f(i-1, j-1) && s[i-1] == p[j-1]

    /** * @param {string} s * @param {string} p * @return {boolean} */let isMatch = function(s, p) {  if (p[0] === '*') {    return false  }​  const dp = [[true]]​  for (let j = 2; j <= p.length; j++) {    dp[0][j] = p[j-1] === '*' && dp[0][j-2]  }      for (let i = 1; i <= s.length; i++) {    dp[i] = []    for (let j = 1; j <= p.length; j++) {      switch (p[j-1]) {        case '.':          dp[i][j] = dp[i-1][j-1]          break        case '*':          dp[i][j] = dp[i][j-2] ||            dp[i-1][j] && (p[j-2] === '.' || s[i-1] === p[j-2])          break        default:          dp[i][j] = dp[i-1][j-1] && s[i-1] === p[j-1]      }    }  }​  return !!dp[s.length][p.length]}

Container With Most Water</span></span></a><span data-key="1d3668de6b2a412a80ce9eba39383023"><span data-offset-key="1d3668de6b2a412a80ce9eba39383023:0"><span data-slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span></span>

###

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH400-686c0942--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="584dd8566522432b99eb7267580a13d9"><span data-offset-key="584dd8566522432b99eb7267580a13d9:0">Problem:</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="de1a598651994cf185f0a58465b0d435"><span data-offset-key="de1a598651994cf185f0a58465b0d435:0">Given n non-negative integers a1, a2, ..., an, where each represents a point at coordinate (i, ai). n vertical lines are drawn such that the two endpoints of line i is at (i, ai) and (i, 0). Find two lines, which together with x-axis forms a container, such that the container contains the most water.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="da59d99f4c0f4f7da6bfc1b9abdd676f"><span data-offset-key="da59d99f4c0f4f7da6bfc1b9abdd676f:0">Note: You may not slant the container and n is at least 2.</span></span></span>

###

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH400-686c0942--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="2d818602a43942758192d1a752e81265"><span data-offset-key="2d818602a43942758192d1a752e81265:0">Solution:</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="1f765c3ca8424e199ebc8d922334b62c"><span data-offset-key="1f765c3ca8424e199ebc8d922334b62c:0">Greedy Algorithm.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="d1eb1d5e0ec94041b5ef30cc3583a86e"><span data-offset-key="d1eb1d5e0ec94041b5ef30cc3583a86e:0">If we look at the simple brute force approach, where we choose one point at a time and calculate all the possible areas with other points on the right, it is easy to make a observation that we are narrowing down the horizontal distance.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="e63b8f8b27da40f4a5177b8554e5997e"><span data-offset-key="e63b8f8b27da40f4a5177b8554e5997e:0">Greedy Algorithm can help us skip some of the conditions. It is base on a fact that the area between two columns are determined by the shorter one.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="ec0c2f426f684db4b87f097ec294afb8"><span data-offset-key="ec0c2f426f684db4b87f097ec294afb8:0">Let's say we have pointer </span><span data-offset-key="ec0c2f426f684db4b87f097ec294afb8:1">`l`</span><span data-offset-key="ec0c2f426f684db4b87f097ec294afb8:2"> and </span><span data-offset-key="ec0c2f426f684db4b87f097ec294afb8:3">`r`</span><span data-offset-key="ec0c2f426f684db4b87f097ec294afb8:4"> at the begin and end of a distance, and the area is </span><span data-offset-key="ec0c2f426f684db4b87f097ec294afb8:5">`area(l, r)`</span><span data-offset-key="ec0c2f426f684db4b87f097ec294afb8:6">, how should we narrow down the distance?</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="20ba5a9ff1d540848f690def50582980"><span data-offset-key="20ba5a9ff1d540848f690def50582980:0">If </span><span data-offset-key="20ba5a9ff1d540848f690def50582980:1">`height[l] < height[r]`</span><span data-offset-key="20ba5a9ff1d540848f690def50582980:2">, we know that the height of the area will never be greater than </span><span data-offset-key="20ba5a9ff1d540848f690def50582980:3">`height[l]`</span><span data-offset-key="20ba5a9ff1d540848f690def50582980:4"> if we keep </span><span data-offset-key="20ba5a9ff1d540848f690def50582980:5">`l`</span><span data-offset-key="20ba5a9ff1d540848f690def50582980:6">. Now if we get rid of </span><span data-offset-key="20ba5a9ff1d540848f690def50582980:7">`r`</span><span data-offset-key="20ba5a9ff1d540848f690def50582980:8">, the area can only get smaller since the distance is shorter, and the height is at most </span><span data-offset-key="20ba5a9ff1d540848f690def50582980:9">`height[l]`</span><span data-offset-key="20ba5a9ff1d540848f690def50582980:10">.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="dde44de3904343828f3480c9e83447f0"><span data-offset-key="dde44de3904343828f3480c9e83447f0:0">Here we conclude rule NO.1: Get rid of the smaller one.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="605175f560cf4e388333108e2a46ca83"><span data-offset-key="605175f560cf4e388333108e2a46ca83:0">What if </span><span data-offset-key="605175f560cf4e388333108e2a46ca83:1">`height[l] == height[r]`</span><span data-offset-key="605175f560cf4e388333108e2a46ca83:2">? It is safe to get rid of both. We do not need any of them to constrain the max height of the rest points.</span></span></span>

    /** * @param {number[]} height * @return {number} */let maxArea = function (height) {  let max = 0  for (let l = 0, r = height.length - 1; l < r; l++, r--) {    max = Math.max(max, (r - l) * Math.min(height[l], height[r]))    if (height[l] < height[r]) {      r++    } else {      l--    }  }  return max};

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="931cb2a38ecf4a9ea9996c51b80c7226"><span data-offset-key="931cb2a38ecf4a9ea9996c51b80c7226:0">_Template generated via_ </span></span><a href="https://github.com/crimx/crx-leetmark" class="link-a079aa82--primary-53a25e66--link-faf6c434"><span data-key="7a982d11d884430fb56b99b8383822bb"><span data-offset-key="7a982d11d884430fb56b99b8383822bb:0"><em>Leetmark</em></span></span></a><span data-key="a17934c12d9a4deeae768138a367d683"><span data-offset-key="a17934c12d9a4deeae768138a367d683:0">_._</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH600-23f228db--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="9bb9d2e33dee4ef38104938c9a9498d1"><span data-offset-key="9bb9d2e33dee4ef38104938c9a9498d1:0">Difficulty: Medium Related Topics: "Math": </span></span><a href="https://leetcode.com/tag/math" class="link-a079aa82--primary-53a25e66--link-faf6c434"><span data-key="3744263d1eb5434883cbb061eb9e3f7d"><span data-offset-key="3744263d1eb5434883cbb061eb9e3f7d:0">https://leetcode.com/tag/math</span></span></a><span data-key="8bbd02dde0cf431fa6769323e8e1df64"><span data-offset-key="8bbd02dde0cf431fa6769323e8e1df64:0"> "String": </span></span><a href="https://leetcode.com/tag/string" class="link-a079aa82--primary-53a25e66--link-faf6c434"><span data-key="fae6878f2d6c4d95a151397d8134a43c"><span data-offset-key="fae6878f2d6c4d95a151397d8134a43c:0">https://leetcode.com/tag/string</span></span></a><span data-key="d1f7546e897d4ecebd922e3e0931d126"><span data-offset-key="d1f7546e897d4ecebd922e3e0931d126:0"> Similar Questions: "Roman to Integer": </span></span><a href="https://leetcode.com/problems/roman-to-integer" class="link-a079aa82--primary-53a25e66--link-faf6c434"><span data-key="b7cca13a993842268a896dfc189dcda0"><span data-offset-key="b7cca13a993842268a896dfc189dcda0:0">https://leetcode.com/problems/roman-to-integer</span></span></a><span data-key="69e66e0405544ea8b33304f298c42c7c"><span data-offset-key="69e66e0405544ea8b33304f298c42c7c:0"> "Integer to English Words": </span></span><a href="https://leetcode.com/problems/integer-to-english-words" class="link-a079aa82--primary-53a25e66--link-faf6c434"><span data-key="f5ad35967db447339061b8217e993709"><span data-offset-key="f5ad35967db447339061b8217e993709:0">https://leetcode.com/problems/integer-to-english-words</span></span></a><span data-key="65aa8eda22de4eceb587ab3042af6923"><span data-offset-key="65aa8eda22de4eceb587ab3042af6923:0"><span data-slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH600-23f228db--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="a1c359f701d6494c90cc10e2055c399f"><span data-offset-key="a1c359f701d6494c90cc10e2055c399f:0"><span data-slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><a href="https://leetcode.com/problems/integer-to-roman/description/" class="link-a079aa82--primary-53a25e66--link-faf6c434"><span data-key="c53491bef0b94c9c952e2d2443bdee64"><span data-offset-key="c53491bef0b94c9c952e2d2443bdee64:0">12. Integer to Roman</span></span></a><span data-key="7420acb982dc40209113987ecf7d3181"><span data-offset-key="7420acb982dc40209113987ecf7d3181:0"><span data-slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span></span>

###

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH400-686c0942--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="78fe068f18754fa18d46d60c9b999a09"><span data-offset-key="78fe068f18754fa18d46d60c9b999a09:0">Problem:</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="15c08a07f9324060b3af69d418b4e1e7"><span data-offset-key="15c08a07f9324060b3af69d418b4e1e7:0">Roman numerals are represented by seven different symbols: </span><span data-offset-key="15c08a07f9324060b3af69d418b4e1e7:1">`I`</span><span data-offset-key="15c08a07f9324060b3af69d418b4e1e7:2">, </span><span data-offset-key="15c08a07f9324060b3af69d418b4e1e7:3">`V`</span><span data-offset-key="15c08a07f9324060b3af69d418b4e1e7:4">, </span><span data-offset-key="15c08a07f9324060b3af69d418b4e1e7:5">`X`</span><span data-offset-key="15c08a07f9324060b3af69d418b4e1e7:6">, </span><span data-offset-key="15c08a07f9324060b3af69d418b4e1e7:7">`L`</span><span data-offset-key="15c08a07f9324060b3af69d418b4e1e7:8">, </span><span data-offset-key="15c08a07f9324060b3af69d418b4e1e7:9">`C`</span><span data-offset-key="15c08a07f9324060b3af69d418b4e1e7:10">, </span><span data-offset-key="15c08a07f9324060b3af69d418b4e1e7:11">`D`</span><span data-offset-key="15c08a07f9324060b3af69d418b4e1e7:12"> and </span><span data-offset-key="15c08a07f9324060b3af69d418b4e1e7:13">`M`</span><span data-offset-key="15c08a07f9324060b3af69d418b4e1e7:14">.</span></span></span>

    Symbol       ValueI             1V             5X             10L             50C             100D             500M             1000

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="8e504ee25fad41b99c5d0c17e64db0ee"><span data-offset-key="8e504ee25fad41b99c5d0c17e64db0ee:0">For example, two is written as </span><span data-offset-key="8e504ee25fad41b99c5d0c17e64db0ee:1">`II`</span><span data-offset-key="8e504ee25fad41b99c5d0c17e64db0ee:2"> in Roman numeral, just two one's added together. Twelve is written as, </span><span data-offset-key="8e504ee25fad41b99c5d0c17e64db0ee:3">`XII`</span><span data-offset-key="8e504ee25fad41b99c5d0c17e64db0ee:4">, which is simply </span><span data-offset-key="8e504ee25fad41b99c5d0c17e64db0ee:5">`X`</span><span data-offset-key="8e504ee25fad41b99c5d0c17e64db0ee:6"> + </span><span data-offset-key="8e504ee25fad41b99c5d0c17e64db0ee:7">`II`</span><span data-offset-key="8e504ee25fad41b99c5d0c17e64db0ee:8">. The number twenty seven is written as </span><span data-offset-key="8e504ee25fad41b99c5d0c17e64db0ee:9">`XXVII`</span><span data-offset-key="8e504ee25fad41b99c5d0c17e64db0ee:10">, which is </span><span data-offset-key="8e504ee25fad41b99c5d0c17e64db0ee:11">`XX`</span><span data-offset-key="8e504ee25fad41b99c5d0c17e64db0ee:12"> + </span><span data-offset-key="8e504ee25fad41b99c5d0c17e64db0ee:13">`V`</span><span data-offset-key="8e504ee25fad41b99c5d0c17e64db0ee:14"> + </span><span data-offset-key="8e504ee25fad41b99c5d0c17e64db0ee:15">`II`</span><span data-offset-key="8e504ee25fad41b99c5d0c17e64db0ee:16">.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="d002675e260549b086516fc7c5bc4cce"><span data-offset-key="d002675e260549b086516fc7c5bc4cce:0">Roman numerals are usually written largest to smallest from left to right. However, the numeral for four is not </span><span data-offset-key="d002675e260549b086516fc7c5bc4cce:1">`IIII`</span><span data-offset-key="d002675e260549b086516fc7c5bc4cce:2">. Instead, the number four is written as </span><span data-offset-key="d002675e260549b086516fc7c5bc4cce:3">`IV`</span><span data-offset-key="d002675e260549b086516fc7c5bc4cce:4">. Because the one is before the five we subtract it making four. The same principle applies to the number nine, which is written as </span><span data-offset-key="d002675e260549b086516fc7c5bc4cce:5">`IX`</span><span data-offset-key="d002675e260549b086516fc7c5bc4cce:6">. There are six instances where subtraction is used:</span></span></span>

- <span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="dd2f34d6588445a4a59d570d221207bb"><span data-offset-key="dd2f34d6588445a4a59d570d221207bb:0">`I`</span><span data-offset-key="dd2f34d6588445a4a59d570d221207bb:1"> can be placed before </span><span data-offset-key="dd2f34d6588445a4a59d570d221207bb:2">`V`</span><span data-offset-key="dd2f34d6588445a4a59d570d221207bb:3"> (5) and </span><span data-offset-key="dd2f34d6588445a4a59d570d221207bb:4">`X`</span><span data-offset-key="dd2f34d6588445a4a59d570d221207bb:5"> (10) to make 4 and 9.</span></span></span>

- <span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="90aead1bc01144b6b37ad63557e5246d"><span data-offset-key="90aead1bc01144b6b37ad63557e5246d:0">`X`</span><span data-offset-key="90aead1bc01144b6b37ad63557e5246d:1"> can be placed before </span><span data-offset-key="90aead1bc01144b6b37ad63557e5246d:2">`L`</span><span data-offset-key="90aead1bc01144b6b37ad63557e5246d:3"> (50) and </span><span data-offset-key="90aead1bc01144b6b37ad63557e5246d:4">`C`</span><span data-offset-key="90aead1bc01144b6b37ad63557e5246d:5"> (100) to make 40 and 90.</span></span></span>

- <span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="49ffd6fa73df41708d0bdebd32fb086c"><span data-offset-key="49ffd6fa73df41708d0bdebd32fb086c:0">`C`</span><span data-offset-key="49ffd6fa73df41708d0bdebd32fb086c:1"> can be placed before </span><span data-offset-key="49ffd6fa73df41708d0bdebd32fb086c:2">`D`</span><span data-offset-key="49ffd6fa73df41708d0bdebd32fb086c:3"> (500) and </span><span data-offset-key="49ffd6fa73df41708d0bdebd32fb086c:4">`M`</span><span data-offset-key="49ffd6fa73df41708d0bdebd32fb086c:5"> (1000) to make 400 and 900.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH400-686c0942--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="84a078d7a01e439f98844ffdbf291ff2"><span data-offset-key="84a078d7a01e439f98844ffdbf291ff2:0">Solution:</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="f82cdb85aff74247b4c9da46ce81b889"><span data-offset-key="f82cdb85aff74247b4c9da46ce81b889:0">Treat 4, 40, 400 and 9, 90, 900 specially.</span></span></span>

    /** * @param {number} num * @return {string} */let intToRoman = function(num) {  const e = [1000, 900,  500, 400,  100, 90,   50,  40,   10,  9,    5,   4,    1  ]  const s = ["M",  "CM", "D", "CD", "C", "XC", "L", "XL", "X", "IX", "V", "IV", "I"]​  let result = ''  for (let i = 0; num; i++) {    const d = e[i]    const v = s[i]    while (num >= d) {      num -= d      result += v    }  }  return result};

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH400-686c0942--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="86fee6529ceb4fd4b4094ff25b62e08a"><span data-offset-key="86fee6529ceb4fd4b4094ff25b62e08a:0">Problem:</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="782d00b31cdc4c6584a779848337bfc3"><span data-offset-key="782d00b31cdc4c6584a779848337bfc3:0">Roman numerals are represented by seven different symbols: </span><span data-offset-key="782d00b31cdc4c6584a779848337bfc3:1">`I`</span><span data-offset-key="782d00b31cdc4c6584a779848337bfc3:2">, </span><span data-offset-key="782d00b31cdc4c6584a779848337bfc3:3">`V`</span><span data-offset-key="782d00b31cdc4c6584a779848337bfc3:4">, </span><span data-offset-key="782d00b31cdc4c6584a779848337bfc3:5">`X`</span><span data-offset-key="782d00b31cdc4c6584a779848337bfc3:6">, </span><span data-offset-key="782d00b31cdc4c6584a779848337bfc3:7">`L`</span><span data-offset-key="782d00b31cdc4c6584a779848337bfc3:8">, </span><span data-offset-key="782d00b31cdc4c6584a779848337bfc3:9">`C`</span><span data-offset-key="782d00b31cdc4c6584a779848337bfc3:10">, </span><span data-offset-key="782d00b31cdc4c6584a779848337bfc3:11">`D`</span><span data-offset-key="782d00b31cdc4c6584a779848337bfc3:12"> and </span><span data-offset-key="782d00b31cdc4c6584a779848337bfc3:13">`M`</span><span data-offset-key="782d00b31cdc4c6584a779848337bfc3:14">.</span></span></span>

    Symbol       ValueI             1V             5X             10L             50C             100D             500M             1000

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="a2f9f6b6750d4e3684cdf3e2f1f404de"><span data-offset-key="a2f9f6b6750d4e3684cdf3e2f1f404de:0">For example, two is written as </span><span data-offset-key="a2f9f6b6750d4e3684cdf3e2f1f404de:1">`II`</span><span data-offset-key="a2f9f6b6750d4e3684cdf3e2f1f404de:2"> in Roman numeral, just two one's added together. Twelve is written as, </span><span data-offset-key="a2f9f6b6750d4e3684cdf3e2f1f404de:3">`XII`</span><span data-offset-key="a2f9f6b6750d4e3684cdf3e2f1f404de:4">, which is simply </span><span data-offset-key="a2f9f6b6750d4e3684cdf3e2f1f404de:5">`X`</span><span data-offset-key="a2f9f6b6750d4e3684cdf3e2f1f404de:6"> + </span><span data-offset-key="a2f9f6b6750d4e3684cdf3e2f1f404de:7">`II`</span><span data-offset-key="a2f9f6b6750d4e3684cdf3e2f1f404de:8">. The number twenty seven is written as </span><span data-offset-key="a2f9f6b6750d4e3684cdf3e2f1f404de:9">`XXVII`</span><span data-offset-key="a2f9f6b6750d4e3684cdf3e2f1f404de:10">, which is </span><span data-offset-key="a2f9f6b6750d4e3684cdf3e2f1f404de:11">`XX`</span><span data-offset-key="a2f9f6b6750d4e3684cdf3e2f1f404de:12"> + </span><span data-offset-key="a2f9f6b6750d4e3684cdf3e2f1f404de:13">`V`</span><span data-offset-key="a2f9f6b6750d4e3684cdf3e2f1f404de:14"> + </span><span data-offset-key="a2f9f6b6750d4e3684cdf3e2f1f404de:15">`II`</span><span data-offset-key="a2f9f6b6750d4e3684cdf3e2f1f404de:16">.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="3cb6a624908f415c960a74d62f960dc6"><span data-offset-key="3cb6a624908f415c960a74d62f960dc6:0">Roman numerals are usually written largest to smallest from left to right. However, the numeral for four is not </span><span data-offset-key="3cb6a624908f415c960a74d62f960dc6:1">`IIII`</span><span data-offset-key="3cb6a624908f415c960a74d62f960dc6:2">. Instead, the number four is written as </span><span data-offset-key="3cb6a624908f415c960a74d62f960dc6:3">`IV`</span><span data-offset-key="3cb6a624908f415c960a74d62f960dc6:4">. Because the one is before the five we subtract it making four. The same principle applies to the number nine, which is written as </span><span data-offset-key="3cb6a624908f415c960a74d62f960dc6:5">`IX`</span><span data-offset-key="3cb6a624908f415c960a74d62f960dc6:6">. There are six instances where subtraction is used:</span></span></span>

- <span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="b288e8d9c0c44ceea58eba10fe94268c"><span data-offset-key="b288e8d9c0c44ceea58eba10fe94268c:0">`I`</span><span data-offset-key="b288e8d9c0c44ceea58eba10fe94268c:1"> can be placed before </span><span data-offset-key="b288e8d9c0c44ceea58eba10fe94268c:2">`V`</span><span data-offset-key="b288e8d9c0c44ceea58eba10fe94268c:3"> (5) and </span><span data-offset-key="b288e8d9c0c44ceea58eba10fe94268c:4">`X`</span><span data-offset-key="b288e8d9c0c44ceea58eba10fe94268c:5"> (10) to make 4 and 9.</span></span></span>

- <span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="a38d7becf03846dcb1b30d2f4d4bcb86"><span data-offset-key="a38d7becf03846dcb1b30d2f4d4bcb86:0">`X`</span><span data-offset-key="a38d7becf03846dcb1b30d2f4d4bcb86:1"> can be placed before </span><span data-offset-key="a38d7becf03846dcb1b30d2f4d4bcb86:2">`L`</span><span data-offset-key="a38d7becf03846dcb1b30d2f4d4bcb86:3"> (50) and </span><span data-offset-key="a38d7becf03846dcb1b30d2f4d4bcb86:4">`C`</span><span data-offset-key="a38d7becf03846dcb1b30d2f4d4bcb86:5"> (100) to make 40 and 90.</span></span></span>

- <span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="302e1d4312e441869722867dae253a17"><span data-offset-key="302e1d4312e441869722867dae253a17:0">`C`</span><span data-offset-key="302e1d4312e441869722867dae253a17:1"> can be placed before </span><span data-offset-key="302e1d4312e441869722867dae253a17:2">`D`</span><span data-offset-key="302e1d4312e441869722867dae253a17:3"> (500) and </span><span data-offset-key="302e1d4312e441869722867dae253a17:4">`M`</span><span data-offset-key="302e1d4312e441869722867dae253a17:5"> (1000) to make 400 and 900.</span></span></span>

Input is guaranteed to be within the range from 1 to 3999.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH400-686c0942--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="d3cdb5251ea34fa0971052b8eb8648d7"><span data-offset-key="d3cdb5251ea34fa0971052b8eb8648d7:0">Solution:</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="ad8f13381f4549fe976e8e103c5a437a"><span data-offset-key="ad8f13381f4549fe976e8e103c5a437a:0">Normally we just add up the digits, except when the digit is greater than its left (e.g. IV). In that case we need to fallback and remove the last digit then combine the two as new digit. That is why we subtract the last digit twice.</span></span></span>

    /** * @param {string} s * @return {number} */let romanToInt = function (s) {  const rdigit = {    I: 1,    V: 5,    X: 10,    L: 50,    C: 100,    D: 500,    M: 1000,  }​  let result = 0  for (let i = 0, lastDigit = Infinity; i < s.length; i++) {    let digit = rdigit[s[i]]    result += digit <= lastDigit ? digit : digit - lastDigit * 2    lastDigit = digit  }  return result};

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH400-686c0942--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="62d9650cc35b4212abed82682511add8"><span data-offset-key="62d9650cc35b4212abed82682511add8:0">Problem:</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="ccb67d5fc3bb48ebb8eed05d55217e55"><span data-offset-key="ccb67d5fc3bb48ebb8eed05d55217e55:0">Write a function to find the longest common prefix string amongst an array of strings.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="fc9e39b2fa9c4872a578e5d59d2394e4"><span data-offset-key="fc9e39b2fa9c4872a578e5d59d2394e4:0">If there is no common prefix, return an empty string </span><span data-offset-key="fc9e39b2fa9c4872a578e5d59d2394e4:1">`""`</span><span data-offset-key="fc9e39b2fa9c4872a578e5d59d2394e4:2">.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="6f9c07b5bce34df39965e3e47e3b650c"><span data-offset-key="6f9c07b5bce34df39965e3e47e3b650c:0">**Example 1:**</span></span></span>

    Input: ["flower","flow","flight"]Output: "fl"

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="02caaa861edb4f41b4278a40e66e0a5e"><span data-offset-key="02caaa861edb4f41b4278a40e66e0a5e:0">**Example 2:**</span></span></span>

    Input: ["dog","racecar","car"]Output: ""Explanation: There is no common prefix among the input strings.

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="c113cab8d5ba40b7b52fd771a920f483"><span data-offset-key="c113cab8d5ba40b7b52fd771a920f483:0">**Note:**</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="19f6a9911a7643e4ae801b28cad3eb39"><span data-offset-key="19f6a9911a7643e4ae801b28cad3eb39:0">All given inputs are in lowercase letters </span><span data-offset-key="19f6a9911a7643e4ae801b28cad3eb39:1">`a-z`</span><span data-offset-key="19f6a9911a7643e4ae801b28cad3eb39:2">.</span></span></span>

###

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH400-686c0942--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="374c594da3f04cd2aa9c50f7f677909b"><span data-offset-key="374c594da3f04cd2aa9c50f7f677909b:0">Solution:</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="43bef37b0dca4a2bb4c95fd3a2ed1b70"><span data-offset-key="43bef37b0dca4a2bb4c95fd3a2ed1b70:0">**ONE**</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="8b89630fe67d4fa8868a93b5daed5921"><span data-offset-key="8b89630fe67d4fa8868a93b5daed5921:0">JavaScript specific solution. Get the min len then narrow down the prefix.</span></span></span>

    /** * @param {string[]} strs * @return {string} */let longestCommonPrefix = function (strs) {  if (strs.length > 0) {    let minLen = Math.min(...strs.map(s => s.length))    const anyStr = strs[0]    while (minLen) {      const prefix = anyStr.slice(0, minLen--)      if (strs.every(s => s.startsWith(prefix))) {        return prefix      }    }  }  return ''};

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="da8c0c12e4574fe18fcde98b1cc7458e"><span data-offset-key="da8c0c12e4574fe18fcde98b1cc7458e:0">**TWO**</span></span></span>

    /** * @param {string[]} strs * @return {string} */let longestCommonPrefix = function(strs) {  if (strs.length <= 0) { return '' }    let i = 0  while (strs.every(s => s[i] && s[i] === strs[0][i])) {    i++  }  return strs[0].slice(0, i)};

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="60669665c11b4b1badf071e99608a14d"><span data-offset-key="60669665c11b4b1badf071e99608a14d:0">**THREE**</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="78e46b1b6c0542c2903b3c474bb93e27"><span data-offset-key="78e46b1b6c0542c2903b3c474bb93e27:0">General solution. Build up the prefix.</span></span></span>

    /** * @param {string[]} strs * @return {string} */let longestCommonPrefix = function (strs) {  let prefix = ''  if (strs.length > 0) {    for (let i = 0; ; i++) {      const c = strs[0][i]      if (!c) { return prefix }      for (let j = 0; j < strs.length; j++) {        if (strs[j][i] !== c) {          return prefix        }      }      prefix += c    }  }  return prefix};
