<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH600-23f228db--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="31fdaccd8cf94f07bdb402131a0d6c8f"><span data-offset-key="31fdaccd8cf94f07bdb402131a0d6c8f:0"><span data-slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><a href="https://leetcode.com/problems/3sum/description/" class="link-a079aa82--primary-53a25e66--link-faf6c434"><span data-key="0cb68f3368064ff39a771b4302a0811c"><span data-offset-key="0cb68f3368064ff39a771b4302a0811c:0">15. 3Sum</span></span></a><span data-key="65f41027244249b5ac61f9b428ad0d8b"><span data-offset-key="65f41027244249b5ac61f9b428ad0d8b:0"><span data-slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span></span>

###

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH400-686c0942--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="0f2831a6e1594e1cb17c9476ce9f6d8d"><span data-offset-key="0f2831a6e1594e1cb17c9476ce9f6d8d:0">Problem:</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="7ab040881fef4cb7bbb3172d4fc7e0ab"><span data-offset-key="7ab040881fef4cb7bbb3172d4fc7e0ab:0">Given an array </span><span data-offset-key="7ab040881fef4cb7bbb3172d4fc7e0ab:1">`nums`</span><span data-offset-key="7ab040881fef4cb7bbb3172d4fc7e0ab:2"> of </span><span data-offset-key="7ab040881fef4cb7bbb3172d4fc7e0ab:3">_n_</span><span data-offset-key="7ab040881fef4cb7bbb3172d4fc7e0ab:4"> integers, are there elements </span><span data-offset-key="7ab040881fef4cb7bbb3172d4fc7e0ab:5">_a_</span><span data-offset-key="7ab040881fef4cb7bbb3172d4fc7e0ab:6">, </span><span data-offset-key="7ab040881fef4cb7bbb3172d4fc7e0ab:7">_b_</span><span data-offset-key="7ab040881fef4cb7bbb3172d4fc7e0ab:8">, </span><span data-offset-key="7ab040881fef4cb7bbb3172d4fc7e0ab:9">_c_</span><span data-offset-key="7ab040881fef4cb7bbb3172d4fc7e0ab:10"> in </span><span data-offset-key="7ab040881fef4cb7bbb3172d4fc7e0ab:11">`nums`</span><span data-offset-key="7ab040881fef4cb7bbb3172d4fc7e0ab:12"> such that </span><span data-offset-key="7ab040881fef4cb7bbb3172d4fc7e0ab:13">_a_</span><span data-offset-key="7ab040881fef4cb7bbb3172d4fc7e0ab:14"> + </span><span data-offset-key="7ab040881fef4cb7bbb3172d4fc7e0ab:15">_b_</span><span data-offset-key="7ab040881fef4cb7bbb3172d4fc7e0ab:16"> + </span><span data-offset-key="7ab040881fef4cb7bbb3172d4fc7e0ab:17">_c_</span><span data-offset-key="7ab040881fef4cb7bbb3172d4fc7e0ab:18"> = 0? Find all unique triplets in the array which gives the sum of zero.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="a66127cbe1d84cfd8b088c13bff7bb5b"><span data-offset-key="a66127cbe1d84cfd8b088c13bff7bb5b:0">**Note:**</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="7a5873b149174f1fbbd3b91c14a6e5e7"><span data-offset-key="7a5873b149174f1fbbd3b91c14a6e5e7:0">The solution set must not contain duplicate triplets.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="d9d9a7e43b044d24a8a2998facf65037"><span data-offset-key="d9d9a7e43b044d24a8a2998facf65037:0">**Example:**</span></span></span>

    Given array nums = [-1, 0, 1, 2, -1, -4],​A solution set is:[  [-1, 0, 1],  [-1, -1, 2]]

###

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH400-686c0942--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="79af6ed2f82e40adb05ea5718b514757"><span data-offset-key="79af6ed2f82e40adb05ea5718b514757:0">Solution:</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="6c58a4c7944b42a3b2505e90ef28294e"><span data-offset-key="6c58a4c7944b42a3b2505e90ef28294e:0">To simplify the problem, sort the nums first.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="960c6bc10ad94817837b1ab73c487509"><span data-offset-key="960c6bc10ad94817837b1ab73c487509:0">If </span><span data-offset-key="960c6bc10ad94817837b1ab73c487509:1">`sorted[0] > 0`</span><span data-offset-key="960c6bc10ad94817837b1ab73c487509:2"> or </span><span data-offset-key="960c6bc10ad94817837b1ab73c487509:3">`sorted[last] < 0`</span><span data-offset-key="960c6bc10ad94817837b1ab73c487509:4">, return an empty set.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="900eb09b0ee046f389e13012463af3dc"><span data-offset-key="900eb09b0ee046f389e13012463af3dc:0">From i = </span><span data-offset-key="900eb09b0ee046f389e13012463af3dc:1">`0`</span><span data-offset-key="900eb09b0ee046f389e13012463af3dc:2"> to </span><span data-offset-key="900eb09b0ee046f389e13012463af3dc:3">`len(sorted) - 2`</span><span data-offset-key="900eb09b0ee046f389e13012463af3dc:4">, pick </span><span data-offset-key="900eb09b0ee046f389e13012463af3dc:5">`sorted[i]`</span><span data-offset-key="900eb09b0ee046f389e13012463af3dc:6"> as the first number of a possible triplet result.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="8aa7c0407de34f31843c824849be0d71"><span data-offset-key="8aa7c0407de34f31843c824849be0d71:0">Let </span><span data-offset-key="8aa7c0407de34f31843c824849be0d71:1">`l = i + 1`</span><span data-offset-key="8aa7c0407de34f31843c824849be0d71:2">, </span><span data-offset-key="8aa7c0407de34f31843c824849be0d71:3">`r = len(sorted) - 1`</span><span data-offset-key="8aa7c0407de34f31843c824849be0d71:4">, we want to narrow them down to enumerate all possible combinations.</span></span></span>

- <span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="ca6ce4a8a9cf4c1ca88a8e5fb1e038fc"><span data-offset-key="ca6ce4a8a9cf4c1ca88a8e5fb1e038fc:0">`l++`</span><span data-offset-key="ca6ce4a8a9cf4c1ca88a8e5fb1e038fc:1"> if </span><span data-offset-key="ca6ce4a8a9cf4c1ca88a8e5fb1e038fc:2">`sorted[i] + sorted[l] + sorted[r] > 0`</span><span data-offset-key="ca6ce4a8a9cf4c1ca88a8e5fb1e038fc:3">.</span></span></span>

- <span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="5f51a6df136f449cade9ebe1515d3455"><span data-offset-key="5f51a6df136f449cade9ebe1515d3455:0">`r--`</span><span data-offset-key="5f51a6df136f449cade9ebe1515d3455:1"> if </span><span data-offset-key="5f51a6df136f449cade9ebe1515d3455:2">`sorted[i] + sorted[l] + sorted[r] < 0`</span><span data-offset-key="5f51a6df136f449cade9ebe1515d3455:3">.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="c74dc7b78ac242b1a0a6b9b88550c5d8"><span data-offset-key="c74dc7b78ac242b1a0a6b9b88550c5d8:0">Skip any duplicate number as we iterate to avoid duplicate triplets.</span></span></span>

    /** * @param {number[]} nums * @return {number[][]} */let threeSum = function (nums) {  const len = nums.length  const sorted = nums.sort((a, b) => a - b)  const result = []​  if (sorted[0] > 0 || sorted[len-1] < 0) {    return result  }​  for (let i = 0; i < len - 2; i++) {    if (sorted[i] > 0) {      break    }​    if (i > 0 && sorted[i] === sorted[i-1]) {      continue    }​    const twoSum = 0 - sorted[i]​    for (let l = i + 1, r = len - 1; l < r;) {      const diff = twoSum - sorted[l] - sorted[r]      if (diff > 0) {        l++      } else if (diff < 0) {        r--      } else {        result.push([sorted[i], sorted[l], sorted[r]])        while (++l < r && sorted[l] === sorted[l - 1]);        while (--r > l && sorted[r] === sorted[r + 1]);      }    }  }​  return result};

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="d138cfd91eaa4c7cbe540f4bfb329405"><span data-offset-key="d138cfd91eaa4c7cbe540f4bfb329405:0">_Template generated via_ </span></span><a href="https://github.com/crimx/crx-leetmark" class="link-a079aa82--primary-53a25e66--link-faf6c434"><span data-key="5cf1ad21a40f480b87f6e7bdd357e6e3"><span data-offset-key="5cf1ad21a40f480b87f6e7bdd357e6e3:0"><em>Leetmark</em></span></span></a><span data-key="3726832bd29445c5b25c66b48618a95f"><span data-offset-key="3726832bd29445c5b25c66b48618a95f:0">_._</span></span></span>

###

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH400-686c0942--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="21deeb72d83c41b3ac01ef7ef479ded6"><span data-offset-key="21deeb72d83c41b3ac01ef7ef479ded6:0">Problem:</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="5bbbbbfedd4844e3a774cd37b3226fdb"><span data-offset-key="5bbbbbfedd4844e3a774cd37b3226fdb:0">Given an array </span><span data-offset-key="5bbbbbfedd4844e3a774cd37b3226fdb:1">`nums`</span><span data-offset-key="5bbbbbfedd4844e3a774cd37b3226fdb:2"> of </span><span data-offset-key="5bbbbbfedd4844e3a774cd37b3226fdb:3">_n_</span><span data-offset-key="5bbbbbfedd4844e3a774cd37b3226fdb:4"> integers and an integer </span><span data-offset-key="5bbbbbfedd4844e3a774cd37b3226fdb:5">`target`</span><span data-offset-key="5bbbbbfedd4844e3a774cd37b3226fdb:6">, find three integers in </span><span data-offset-key="5bbbbbfedd4844e3a774cd37b3226fdb:7">`nums`</span><span data-offset-key="5bbbbbfedd4844e3a774cd37b3226fdb:8"> such that the sum is closest to </span><span data-offset-key="5bbbbbfedd4844e3a774cd37b3226fdb:9">`target`</span><span data-offset-key="5bbbbbfedd4844e3a774cd37b3226fdb:10">. Return the sum of the three integers. You may assume that each input would have exactly one solution.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="9d4c5e043ad74db9b5865c8939dbcae0"><span data-offset-key="9d4c5e043ad74db9b5865c8939dbcae0:0">**Example:**</span></span></span>

    Given array nums = [-1, 2, 1, -4], and target = 1.​The sum that is closest to the target is 2. (-1 + 2 + 1 = 2).

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH400-686c0942--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="bcf993cd24224f669822b32ece4afe5e"><span data-offset-key="bcf993cd24224f669822b32ece4afe5e:0">Solution:</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="6a791b9a1e454b52b4fb36dedc7dd011"><span data-offset-key="6a791b9a1e454b52b4fb36dedc7dd011:0">Simplified version of </span></span><a href="file:///C:/MY-WEB-DEV/06-DS-ALGO-OUTTER/06-DS-ALGO/main/CONTENT/DS-n-Algos/SANDBOX/015.%203Sum.md" class="link-a079aa82--primary-53a25e66--link-faf6c434"><span data-key="cf5493da135c44a683adff36f97888d6"><span data-offset-key="cf5493da135c44a683adff36f97888d6:0">15. 3Sum</span></span></a><span data-key="3f20d7bfb9a5468a8aba9935b88bc319"><span data-offset-key="3f20d7bfb9a5468a8aba9935b88bc319:0">.</span></span></span>

    /** * @param {number[]} nums * @param {number} target * @return {number} */let threeSumClosest = function(nums, target) {  const len = nums.length  const sorted = nums.sort((a, b) => a - b)​  let minDiff = Infinity​  for (let i = 0; i < len - 2; i++) {    if (i > 0 && sorted[i] === sorted[i-1]) {      continue    }​    const twoSum = target - sorted[i]​    for (let l = i + 1, r = len - 1; l < r;) {      const diff = twoSum - sorted[l] - sorted[r]      if (diff === 0) {        return target      } else {        if (diff > 0) {          l++        } else {          r--        }​        if (Math.abs(diff) < Math.abs(minDiff)) {          minDiff = diff        }      }    }  }​  return target - minDiff};

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="2b9476414b074cc9b4e09c5f58fe4eb4"><span data-offset-key="2b9476414b074cc9b4e09c5f58fe4eb4:0">**ONE**</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="3d024a3b90c44335a043be128d655beb"><span data-offset-key="3d024a3b90c44335a043be128d655beb:0">JavaScript specific optimization.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="3ebbd22d05324b36b210b32a3cf8bead"><span data-offset-key="3ebbd22d05324b36b210b32a3cf8bead:0">`Array.prototype.push`</span><span data-offset-key="3ebbd22d05324b36b210b32a3cf8bead:1"> accepts arbitrary arguments which enables tighter loops.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="24628846886b43c2aedfdf1a5d6f4503"><span data-offset-key="24628846886b43c2aedfdf1a5d6f4503:0">Also, appending string is faster than prepending.</span></span></span>

    /** * @param {string} digits * @return {string[]} */let letterCombinations = function(digits) {  if (digits.length <= 0) { return [] }​  const letters = [    ,    ,    ['a', 'b', 'c'],    ['d', 'e', 'f'],    ['g', 'h', 'i'],    ['j', 'k', 'l'],    ['m', 'n', 'o'],    ['p', 'q', 'r', 's'],    ['t', 'u', 'v'],    ['w', 'x', 'y', 'z'],  ]​  let result = ['']​  for (let i = 0; i < digits.length; i++) {    const arr = letters[digits[i]]    let newResult = []    arr.forEach(c => newResult.push(...result.map(r => r + c)))    result = newResult  }​  return result};

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="6f3a9c92b3e44b97a871419c39798a41"><span data-offset-key="6f3a9c92b3e44b97a871419c39798a41:0">**TWO**</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="ecc19c0f1df24e4fa7bdab154ee93033"><span data-offset-key="ecc19c0f1df24e4fa7bdab154ee93033:0">General recursive DFS solution.</span></span></span>

    /** * @param {string} digits * @return {string[]} */let letterCombinations = function(digits) {  const letters = [,, 'abc', 'def', 'ghi', 'jkl', 'mno', 'pqrs', 'tuv', 'wxyz']  const result = []  if (digits.length > 0) {    dfs(digits, 0, '', letters, result)  }  return result};​function dfs (digits, idigit, path, letters, result) {  if (idigit >= digits.length) {    result.push(path)    return  }  const str = letters[digits[idigit]]  for (let i = 0; i < str.length; i++) {    dfs(digits, idigit + 1, path + str[i], letters, result)  }};

data-offset-key="b6c6678a006447a9a00b9bb1155fccfa:23">_d_</span><span data-offset-key="b6c6678a006447a9a00b9bb1155fccfa:24"> = </span><span data-offset-key="b6c6678a006447a9a00b9bb1155fccfa:25">`target`</span><span data-offset-key="b6c6678a006447a9a00b9bb1155fccfa:26">? Find all unique quadruplets in the array which gives the sum of </span><span data-offset-key="b6c6678a006447a9a00b9bb1155fccfa:27">`target`</span><span data-offset-key="b6c6678a006447a9a00b9bb1155fccfa:28">.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="9b52b717dcf846b69cd09c7c739701f1"><span data-offset-key="9b52b717dcf846b69cd09c7c739701f1:0">**Note:**</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="2673ff7e200a4af9ab4d6ddca21fca74"><span data-offset-key="2673ff7e200a4af9ab4d6ddca21fca74:0">The solution set must not contain duplicate quadruplets.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="d99e12b4a5df435d93c7f0e736c34818"><span data-offset-key="d99e12b4a5df435d93c7f0e736c34818:0">**Example:**</span></span></span>

    Given array nums = [1, 0, -1, 0, -2, 2], and target = 0.​A solution set is:[  [-1,  0, 0, 1],  [-2, -1, 1, 2],  [-2,  0, 0, 2]]

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH400-686c0942--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="7f140558737a493d97e3e9c90fbc86f7"><span data-offset-key="7f140558737a493d97e3e9c90fbc86f7:0">Solution:</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="393bb2e90da7498898dafd62c721f7cc"><span data-offset-key="393bb2e90da7498898dafd62c721f7cc:0">Like </span></span><a href="file:///C:/MY-WEB-DEV/06-DS-ALGO-OUTTER/06-DS-ALGO/main/CONTENT/DS-n-Algos/SANDBOX/015.%203Sum.md" class="link-a079aa82--primary-53a25e66--link-faf6c434"><span data-key="022d32279c66494494137ab46345a061"><span data-offset-key="022d32279c66494494137ab46345a061:0">15. 3Sum</span></span></a><span data-key="9e0cdcdaf8424d968b9c6da03f9bdef9"><span data-offset-key="9e0cdcdaf8424d968b9c6da03f9bdef9:0"> and </span></span><a href="file:///C:/MY-WEB-DEV/06-DS-ALGO-OUTTER/06-DS-ALGO/main/CONTENT/DS-n-Algos/SANDBOX/016.%203Sum%20Closest.md" class="link-a079aa82--primary-53a25e66--link-faf6c434"><span data-key="661b1bb4e2874e8c93bece4bc3f38ce7"><span data-offset-key="661b1bb4e2874e8c93bece4bc3f38ce7:0">16. 3Sum Closest</span></span></a><span data-key="14d282c1c52e4a679db51b47e8b81436"><span data-offset-key="14d282c1c52e4a679db51b47e8b81436:0">. Wrap one more loop.</span></span></span>

    /** * @param {number[]} nums * @param {number} target * @return {number[][]} */let fourSum = function(nums, target) {  const len = nums.length  const sorted = nums.sort((a, b) => a - b)  const result = []​  for (let k = 0; k < len - 3; k++) {    if (k > 0 && sorted[k] === sorted[k-1]) {      continue    }​    const threeSum = target - sorted[k]​    for (let i = k+1; i < len - 2; i++) {      if (i > k+1 && sorted[i] === sorted[i-1]) {        continue      }​      const twoSum = threeSum - sorted[i]​      for (let l = i + 1, r = len - 1; l < r;) {        const diff = twoSum - sorted[l] - sorted[r]        if (diff > 0) {          l++        } else if (diff < 0) {          r--        } else {          result.push([sorted[k], sorted[i], sorted[l], sorted[r]])          while (++l < r && sorted[l] === sorted[l - 1]);          while (--r > l && sorted[r] === sorted[r + 1]);        }      }    }  }​  return result};

Remove Nth Node From End of List</span></span></a><span data-key="feab1374f1e245f7ba650b42c4457dbe"><span data-offset-key="feab1374f1e245f7ba650b42c4457dbe:0"><span data-slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span></span>

###

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH400-686c0942--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="b4519f713ad3482ead8b89e4ad99fa3a"><span data-offset-key="b4519f713ad3482ead8b89e4ad99fa3a:0">Problem:</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="2c925a3ef1004cc293c560dde09cc3eb"><span data-offset-key="2c925a3ef1004cc293c560dde09cc3eb:0">Given a linked list, remove the </span><span data-offset-key="2c925a3ef1004cc293c560dde09cc3eb:1">_n_</span><span data-offset-key="2c925a3ef1004cc293c560dde09cc3eb:2">-th node from the end of list and return its head.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="5df1efe562044f64b03aa6ff223d5e65"><span data-offset-key="5df1efe562044f64b03aa6ff223d5e65:0">**Example:**</span></span></span>

    Given linked list: 1->2->3->4->5, and n = 2.​After removing the second node from the end, the linked list becomes 1->2->3->5.

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="c87f5e49a4f345aeb8d84c7f6d07c85f"><span data-offset-key="c87f5e49a4f345aeb8d84c7f6d07c85f:0">**Note:**</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="c7222aeefc16477d944ac3d0ded71683"><span data-offset-key="c7222aeefc16477d944ac3d0ded71683:0">Given </span><span data-offset-key="c7222aeefc16477d944ac3d0ded71683:1">_n_</span><span data-offset-key="c7222aeefc16477d944ac3d0ded71683:2"> will always be valid.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="1a1c2853087f4c5eaf7c250239f9b09d"><span data-offset-key="1a1c2853087f4c5eaf7c250239f9b09d:0">**Follow up:**</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="984be3a831004385824628a2a080b9d9"><span data-offset-key="984be3a831004385824628a2a080b9d9:0">Could you do this in one pass?</span></span></span>

###

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH400-686c0942--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="01cc6d02289f4bbb99f900f6b04da24b"><span data-offset-key="01cc6d02289f4bbb99f900f6b04da24b:0">Solution:</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="1fa21cbcf446425d82ab32592dfd50b5"><span data-offset-key="1fa21cbcf446425d82ab32592dfd50b5:0">Set a pointer </span><span data-offset-key="1fa21cbcf446425d82ab32592dfd50b5:1">`p1`</span><span data-offset-key="1fa21cbcf446425d82ab32592dfd50b5:2"> for iterating, and </span><span data-offset-key="1fa21cbcf446425d82ab32592dfd50b5:3">`p2`</span><span data-offset-key="1fa21cbcf446425d82ab32592dfd50b5:4"> which is </span><span data-offset-key="1fa21cbcf446425d82ab32592dfd50b5:5">`n`</span><span data-offset-key="1fa21cbcf446425d82ab32592dfd50b5:6"> nodes behind, pointing at the (n+1)-th node from the end of list.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="2ffd82289b5b4d45a077f4716ee1e496"><span data-offset-key="2ffd82289b5b4d45a077f4716ee1e496:0">Boundaries that should be awared of:</span></span></span>

- <span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="3dd02852f1e2493686afd8ff4bcee730"><span data-offset-key="3dd02852f1e2493686afd8ff4bcee730:0">`p2`</span><span data-offset-key="3dd02852f1e2493686afd8ff4bcee730:1"> could be one node before </span><span data-offset-key="3dd02852f1e2493686afd8ff4bcee730:2">`head`</span><span data-offset-key="3dd02852f1e2493686afd8ff4bcee730:3">, which means the </span><span data-offset-key="3dd02852f1e2493686afd8ff4bcee730:4">`head`</span><span data-offset-key="3dd02852f1e2493686afd8ff4bcee730:5"> should be removed.</span></span></span>

- <span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="0adcc58ad7b74ab09952357385d4c1f3"><span data-offset-key="0adcc58ad7b74ab09952357385d4c1f3:0">`p2`</span><span data-offset-key="0adcc58ad7b74ab09952357385d4c1f3:1"> could be larger than the length of the list (Though the description says </span><span data-offset-key="0adcc58ad7b74ab09952357385d4c1f3:2">`n`</span><span data-offset-key="0adcc58ad7b74ab09952357385d4c1f3:3"> will always be valid, we take care of it anyway).</span></span></span>

- <span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="4306c8fac61c48459a5e8333a242cb1b"><span data-offset-key="4306c8fac61c48459a5e8333a242cb1b:0">It should be </span><span data-offset-key="4306c8fac61c48459a5e8333a242cb1b:1">`p1.next`</span><span data-offset-key="4306c8fac61c48459a5e8333a242cb1b:2"> touches the end rather than </span><span data-offset-key="4306c8fac61c48459a5e8333a242cb1b:3">`p1`</span><span data-offset-key="4306c8fac61c48459a5e8333a242cb1b:4"> because we want </span><span data-offset-key="4306c8fac61c48459a5e8333a242cb1b:5">`p1`</span><span data-offset-key="4306c8fac61c48459a5e8333a242cb1b:6"> pointing at the last node.</span></span></span>

  /** _ Definition for singly-linked list. _ function ListNode(val) { _ this.val = val; _ this.next = null; _ } _//** _ @param {ListNode} head _ @param {number} n _ @return {ListNode} _/let removeNthFromEnd = function(head, n) { let p1 = head while (p1 && n--) { p1 = p1.next }​ if (!p1) { return n ? head : head.next }​ let p2 = head while (p1.next) { p1 = p1.next p2 = p2.next }​ p2.next = p2.next.next​ return head};

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH400-686c0942--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="8f3259c762dd408586f63f2921dbd3bb"><span data-offset-key="8f3259c762dd408586f63f2921dbd3bb:0">Problem:</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="2c2f0d1c4e34469ab138c85c5c0d8664"><span data-offset-key="2c2f0d1c4e34469ab138c85c5c0d8664:0">Given a string containing just the characters </span><span data-offset-key="2c2f0d1c4e34469ab138c85c5c0d8664:1">`'('`</span><span data-offset-key="2c2f0d1c4e34469ab138c85c5c0d8664:2">, </span><span data-offset-key="2c2f0d1c4e34469ab138c85c5c0d8664:3">`')'`</span><span data-offset-key="2c2f0d1c4e34469ab138c85c5c0d8664:4">, </span><span data-offset-key="2c2f0d1c4e34469ab138c85c5c0d8664:5">`'{'`</span><span data-offset-key="2c2f0d1c4e34469ab138c85c5c0d8664:6">, </span><span data-offset-key="2c2f0d1c4e34469ab138c85c5c0d8664:7">`'}'`</span><span data-offset-key="2c2f0d1c4e34469ab138c85c5c0d8664:8">, </span><span data-offset-key="2c2f0d1c4e34469ab138c85c5c0d8664:9">`'['`</span><span data-offset-key="2c2f0d1c4e34469ab138c85c5c0d8664:10"> and </span><span data-offset-key="2c2f0d1c4e34469ab138c85c5c0d8664:11">`']'`</span><span data-offset-key="2c2f0d1c4e34469ab138c85c5c0d8664:12">, determine if the input string is valid.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="99c3c99c5abd495abca13644cb2b60b0"><span data-offset-key="99c3c99c5abd495abca13644cb2b60b0:0">An input string is valid if:</span></span></span>

1.  <span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="4ed208d152e64b3d9483e22eb53f5d16"><span data-offset-key="4ed208d152e64b3d9483e22eb53f5d16:0">Open brackets must be closed by the same type of brackets.</span></span></span>

2.  <span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="604da0b50d0c453987abd5af7dccbf61"><span data-offset-key="604da0b50d0c453987abd5af7dccbf61:0">Open brackets must be closed in the correct order.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="3f77f4eef1a442bca4ba1f2a6e3e9867"><span data-offset-key="3f77f4eef1a442bca4ba1f2a6e3e9867:0">Note that an empty string is also considered valid.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="364719aadfdd4ab195fda8e4ceecddbb"><span data-offset-key="364719aadfdd4ab195fda8e4ceecddbb:0">**Example 1:**</span></span></span>

    Input: "()"Output: true

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH400-686c0942--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="9771c2ed67604337bf7b1e0cdab4c1ad"><span data-offset-key="9771c2ed67604337bf7b1e0cdab4c1ad:0">Solution:</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="31abbf9ca59d4f3bb223d911edcab5c6"><span data-offset-key="31abbf9ca59d4f3bb223d911edcab5c6:0">Stack 101.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="9a48fdf78dd64699bea2412ca41c4a3e"><span data-offset-key="9a48fdf78dd64699bea2412ca41c4a3e:0">Whenever we meet a close bracket, we want to compare it to the last open bracket.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="05c61b09920f434dbae6707abbff2fb6"><span data-offset-key="05c61b09920f434dbae6707abbff2fb6:0">That is why we use stack to store open brackets: first in, last out.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="a4568b27e34d4d13a1391c50ab23916e"><span data-offset-key="a4568b27e34d4d13a1391c50ab23916e:0">And since there is only bracket characters, the last open bracket happens to be the last character.</span></span></span>

    /** * @param {string} s * @return {boolean} */let isValid = function(s) {  const stack = []  const pairs = {    '}': '{',    ']': '[',    ')': '(',  }  for (const c of s) {    const open = pairs[c]    if (open) {      if (stack.pop() !== open) {        return false      }    } else {      stack.push(c)    }  }  return stack.length <= 0};

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="bd28ee3ca77d44b8bb12607214d2bdb5"><span data-offset-key="bd28ee3ca77d44b8bb12607214d2bdb5:0">Merge two sorted linked lists and return it as a new list. The new list should be made by splicing together the nodes of the first two lists.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="b97c24ea5b874f8bbffe35adfdf65536"><span data-offset-key="b97c24ea5b874f8bbffe35adfdf65536:0">Example:</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH400-686c0942--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="eb99d5938d5f49ad9c98b3ef4a3cf81a"><span data-offset-key="eb99d5938d5f49ad9c98b3ef4a3cf81a:0">Solution:</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="f9e786e6d18f4ac9961ac6c6a0e0cff8"><span data-offset-key="f9e786e6d18f4ac9961ac6c6a0e0cff8:0">Keep tracking the head of two lists and keep moving the pointer of smaller one to the next node.</span></span></span>

    /** * Definition for singly-linked list. * function ListNode(val) { *     this.val = val; *     this.next = null; * } *//** * @param {ListNode} l1 * @param {ListNode} l2 * @return {ListNode} */let mergeTwoLists = function(l1, l2) {  let prehead = { next: null }  let p = prehead  let p1 = l1  let p2 = l2  while (p1 && p2) {    let pSel    if  (p1.val < p2.val) {      pSel = p1      p1 = p1.next    } else {      pSel = p2      p2 = p2.next    }    p.next = pSel    p = pSel  }​  p.next = p1 || p2​  return prehead.next};​

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="5fa021b59fb746f5a6074efb74887e87"><span data-offset-key="5fa021b59fb746f5a6074efb74887e87:0">Given n pairs of parentheses, write a function to generate all combinations of well-formed parentheses.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="ec02e11ad0a74c008aee61a1d9e63a03"><span data-offset-key="ec02e11ad0a74c008aee61a1d9e63a03:0">For example, given n = 3, a solution set is:</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH400-686c0942--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="7331df0755014786a1b3ffd5e41fd5e7"><span data-offset-key="7331df0755014786a1b3ffd5e41fd5e7:0">Solution:</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="51a1b1369d1544e3bfb466b93640d140"><span data-offset-key="51a1b1369d1544e3bfb466b93640d140:0">**ONE**</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="cc6ea66bae4941ab802f4cf2633f4b04"><span data-offset-key="cc6ea66bae4941ab802f4cf2633f4b04:0">Recursive DFS backtracking.</span></span></span>

    /** * @param {number} n * @return {string[]} */let generateParenthesis = function(n) {  const result = []  if (n > 0) {    dfs(n, 0, 0, '', result)  }  return result};​function dfs (n, nopen, nclose, path, result) {  if (path.length === n * 2) {    result.push(path)    return  }​  if (nopen < n) {    dfs(n, nopen + 1, nclose, path + '(', result)  }​  if (nclose < nopen) {    dfs(n, nopen, nclose + 1, path + ')', result)  }};

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="d4ffa698fced44e7838f421296d61f11"><span data-offset-key="d4ffa698fced44e7838f421296d61f11:0">**TWO**</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="19d5111a883148ccbad104928a48740a"><span data-offset-key="19d5111a883148ccbad104928a48740a:0">BFS.</span></span></span>

    /** * @param {number} n * @return {string[]} */let generateParenthesis = function(n) {  if (n <= 0) { return [] }​  const queue = [{    path: '(',    open: 1,    close: 0,  }]​  while (true) {    const { path, open, close } = queue.shift()    if (open + close === n * 2) {      queue.unshift({ path, open, close })      break    }​    if (open < n) {      queue.push({        path: path + '(',        open: open + 1,        close,      })    }​    if (close < open) {      queue.push({        path: path + ')',        open,        close: close + 1,      })    }  }​  return queue.map(x => x.path)};

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="810ef2b6e40a402a88b1f506ac5b8276"><span data-offset-key="810ef2b6e40a402a88b1f506ac5b8276:0">Merge </span><span data-offset-key="810ef2b6e40a402a88b1f506ac5b8276:1">_k_</span><span data-offset-key="810ef2b6e40a402a88b1f506ac5b8276:2"> sorted linked lists and return it as one sorted list. Analyze and describe its complexity.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="61dcb08248ee43e0b927bc6612494011"><span data-offset-key="61dcb08248ee43e0b927bc6612494011:0">**Example:**</span></span></span>

    Input:[  1->4->5,  1->3->4,  2->6]Output: 1->1->2->3->4->4->5->6

###

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH400-686c0942--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="e2e0affc79c2490baa8adfbdb9fde1ea"><span data-offset-key="e2e0affc79c2490baa8adfbdb9fde1ea:0">Solution:</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="8eeaa051b91841feac61935f8310fbbd"><span data-offset-key="8eeaa051b91841feac61935f8310fbbd:0">**ONE**</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="044e6227eacd48968b884dad8314b169"><span data-offset-key="044e6227eacd48968b884dad8314b169:0">Extend the idea of </span></span><a href="file:///C:/MY-WEB-DEV/06-DS-ALGO-OUTTER/06-DS-ALGO/main/CONTENT/DS-n-Algos/SANDBOX/021.%20Merge%20Two%20Sorted%20Lists.md" class="link-a079aa82--primary-53a25e66--link-faf6c434"><span data-key="3d61dde1c1264b229154942705c2a1e6"><span data-offset-key="3d61dde1c1264b229154942705c2a1e6:0">21. Merge Two Sorted Lists</span></span></a><span data-key="cad17beab76f49d5bf0ee4d76303347f"><span data-offset-key="cad17beab76f49d5bf0ee4d76303347f:0"> and compare N items at a time.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="df79b7cafa2142cfa2262e0e92e1685d"><span data-offset-key="df79b7cafa2142cfa2262e0e92e1685d:0">This is slow as it reaches O(N^2).</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="a76d0b212fb34601a45cf5dfde2239f2"><span data-offset-key="a76d0b212fb34601a45cf5dfde2239f2:0">**TWO**</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="2f9dc1d0c981444cb14d836dc51d5090"><span data-offset-key="2f9dc1d0c981444cb14d836dc51d5090:0">Priority Queue. O(N \* log(K)).</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="fd60f04a9d704933bf221d22d6519c72"><span data-offset-key="fd60f04a9d704933bf221d22d6519c72:0">Since JavaScript does not provide a standard built-in Priority Queue data structure, it is challenging to implement an efficient one barehanded.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="b74b46ecb7e743b7810dc8b73f8e16af"><span data-offset-key="b74b46ecb7e743b7810dc8b73f8e16af:0">**THREE**</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="673f95f1b6674b279afe8f9959058b7d"><span data-offset-key="673f95f1b6674b279afe8f9959058b7d:0">Divide and conquer. Also O(N \* log(K)).</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="fdeffded01094099a0ccb43190fc9ae4"><span data-offset-key="fdeffded01094099a0ccb43190fc9ae4:0">Divide N lists into ceil(N/2) pairs and merge your way up.</span></span></span>

    /** * Definition for singly-linked list. * function ListNode(val) { *     this.val = val; *     this.next = null; * } *//** * @param {ListNode[]} lists * @return {ListNode} */let mergeKLists = function(lists) {  while (lists.length > 1) {    lists.unshift(mergeTwoLists(lists.pop(), lists.pop()))  }  return lists[0] || []};​/** * Definition for singly-linked list. * function ListNode(val) { *     this.val = val; *     this.next = null; * } *//** * @param {ListNode} l1 * @param {ListNode} l2 * @return {ListNode} */function mergeTwoLists (l1, l2) {  let prehead = { next: null }  let p = prehead  let p1 = l1  let p2 = l2  while (p1 && p2) {    let pSel    if  (p1.val < p2.val) {      pSel = p1      p1 = p1.next    } else {      pSel = p2      p2 = p2.next    }    p.next = pSel    p = pSel  }​  p.next = p1 || p2​  return prehead.next};

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="ee2f9a24f8054a1a8c21131cca0897e7"><span data-offset-key="ee2f9a24f8054a1a8c21131cca0897e7:0">_Template generated via_ </span></span><a href="https://github.com/crimx/crx-leetmark" class="link-a079aa82--primary-53a25e66--link-faf6c434"><span data-key="496227ba35614f9d82b4f02ee686be82"><span data-offset-key="496227ba35614f9d82b4f02ee686be82:0"><em>Leetmark</em></span></span></a><span data-key="311ed9b2faf44801976b7f689b36de9d"><span data-offset-key="311ed9b2faf44801976b7f689b36de9d:0">_._</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH600-23f228db--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="49423ae23e7a474ca0b27ebb03376c91"><span data-offset-key="49423ae23e7a474ca0b27ebb03376c91:0">Difficulty: Medium Related Topics: "Linked List": </span></span><a href="https://leetcode.com/tag/linked-list" class="link-a079aa82--primary-53a25e66--link-faf6c434"><span data-key="3c805a7fcc6a4a66ad1c9af9d9a1570d"><span data-offset-key="3c805a7fcc6a4a66ad1c9af9d9a1570d:0">https://leetcode.com/tag/linked-list</span></span></a><span data-key="992fc4e196924f32a5f1f49416feec89"><span data-offset-key="992fc4e196924f32a5f1f49416feec89:0"> Similar Questions: "Reverse Nodes in k-Group": </span></span><a href="https://leetcode.com/problems/reverse-nodes-in-k-group" class="link-a079aa82--primary-53a25e66--link-faf6c434"><span data-key="56cbb3583a14423f9bff50f5257f7842"><span data-offset-key="56cbb3583a14423f9bff50f5257f7842:0">https://leetcode.com/problems/reverse-nodes-in-k-group</span></span></a><span data-key="1fda175af03e4de494efbbdb98dda448"><span data-offset-key="1fda175af03e4de494efbbdb98dda448:0"><span data-slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH600-23f228db--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="e39e20fe4d4d4163b65bd5eb8b57c908"><span data-offset-key="e39e20fe4d4d4163b65bd5eb8b57c908:0"><span data-slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><a href="https://leetcode.com/problems/swap-nodes-in-pairs/description/" class="link-a079aa82--primary-53a25e66--link-faf6c434"><span data-key="13b6455a97be46e691e32cea22270cea"><span data-offset-key="13b6455a97be46e691e32cea22270cea:0">24. Swap Nodes in Pairs</span></span></a><span data-key="b9e983139fac452abac9406cd86bc837"><span data-offset-key="b9e983139fac452abac9406cd86bc837:0"><span data-slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span></span>

###

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH400-686c0942--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="f91a8605fb92410f8347889ae2924122"><span data-offset-key="f91a8605fb92410f8347889ae2924122:0">Problem:</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="3fad293e639b46598abd8751bcfe673a"><span data-offset-key="3fad293e639b46598abd8751bcfe673a:0">Given a linked list, swap every two adjacent nodes and return its head.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="c8b5a620cf364f4aa975401006ed8a15"><span data-offset-key="c8b5a620cf364f4aa975401006ed8a15:0">**Example:**</span></span></span>

    Given 1->2->3->4, you should return the list as 2->1->4->3.

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="7589d4186b2847da821e1c3813ced111"><span data-offset-key="7589d4186b2847da821e1c3813ced111:0">**Note:**</span></span></span>

- <span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="fad8726f3d4c427684c59ebd81b86400"><span data-offset-key="fad8726f3d4c427684c59ebd81b86400:0">Your algorithm should use only constant extra space.</span></span></span>

- <span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="95da478f4ade4d74a2334f1bb31f75c7"><span data-offset-key="95da478f4ade4d74a2334f1bb31f75c7:0">You may </span><span data-offset-key="95da478f4ade4d74a2334f1bb31f75c7:1">**not**</span><span data-offset-key="95da478f4ade4d74a2334f1bb31f75c7:2"> modify the values in the list's nodes, only nodes itself may be changed.</span></span></span>

###

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH400-686c0942--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="d2dcfdb4f2a544e7825eba99dc9d9812"><span data-offset-key="d2dcfdb4f2a544e7825eba99dc9d9812:0">Solution:</span></span></span>

1.  <span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="3202ed2590394ce9b1558fb373eec82b"><span data-offset-key="3202ed2590394ce9b1558fb373eec82b:0">Draw the nodes down on paper to reason about the relationships.</span></span></span>

2.  <span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="7389fe93c9c04c3da111b94398594b30"><span data-offset-key="7389fe93c9c04c3da111b94398594b30:0">Pointing to every active node is an easy way to keep on track.</span></span></span>

    /** _ Definition for singly-linked list. _ function ListNode(val) { _ this.val = val; _ this.next = null; _ } _//** _ @param {ListNode} head _ @return {ListNode} \*/let swapPairs = function(head) { const prehead = { next: head }​ for (let p = prehead; p.next !== null && p.next.next !== null;) { const p1 = p.next const p2 = p1.next p1.next = p2.next p2.next = p1 p.next = p2 p = p1 }​ return prehead.next};

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="ef2303e968524bfbb32bbfa02ca3f546"><span data-offset-key="ef2303e968524bfbb32bbfa02ca3f546:0">_Template generated via_ </span></span><a href="https://github.com/crimx/crx-leetmark" class="link-a079aa82--primary-53a25e66--link-faf6c434"><span data-key="d457bf6bd832471d8584099d6b3dffc2"><span data-offset-key="d457bf6bd832471d8584099d6b3dffc2:0"><em>Leetmark</em></span></span></a><span data-key="3c47e490f79347158c0d6d274f58c269"><span data-offset-key="3c47e490f79347158c0d6d274f58c269:0">_._</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH600-23f228db--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="9047c0c7c8c345caa07c10cadaed7be2"><span data-offset-key="9047c0c7c8c345caa07c10cadaed7be2:0">Difficulty: Hard Related Topics: "Linked List": </span></span><a href="https://leetcode.com/tag/linked-list" class="link-a079aa82--primary-53a25e66--link-faf6c434"><span data-key="eb28dfd5d366484f97b069c190c48866"><span data-offset-key="eb28dfd5d366484f97b069c190c48866:0">https://leetcode.com/tag/linked-list</span></span></a><span data-key="4e203e51c2f64aea984ca62952e579e2"><span data-offset-key="4e203e51c2f64aea984ca62952e579e2:0"> Similar Questions: "Swap Nodes in Pairs": </span></span><a href="https://leetcode.com/problems/swap-nodes-in-pairs" class="link-a079aa82--primary-53a25e66--link-faf6c434"><span data-key="007f0efb8b93411cb1d8d06c8da40093"><span data-offset-key="007f0efb8b93411cb1d8d06c8da40093:0">https://leetcode.com/problems/swap-nodes-in-pairs</span></span></a><span data-key="edde61cbc7d04c118e6b84c59cf516f8"><span data-offset-key="edde61cbc7d04c118e6b84c59cf516f8:0"><span data-slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH600-23f228db--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="2bce9c54eef640ef9a74e6abed658127"><span data-offset-key="2bce9c54eef640ef9a74e6abed658127:0"><span data-slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><a href="https://leetcode.com/problems/reverse-nodes-in-k-group/description/" class="link-a079aa82--primary-53a25e66--link-faf6c434"><span data-key="6294cdf4150f47cf8b92fed8096b2b7e"><span data-offset-key="6294cdf4150f47cf8b92fed8096b2b7e:0">25. Reverse Nodes in k-Group</span></span></a><span data-key="73161a978c1641c8a30a2c2d20c1d8a3"><span data-offset-key="73161a978c1641c8a30a2c2d20c1d8a3:0"><span data-slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span></span>

###

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH400-686c0942--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="ca55c06f277b4648a7996697618247fd"><span data-offset-key="ca55c06f277b4648a7996697618247fd:0">Problem:</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="e05f54a2673a47868b8180dbc161085d"><span data-offset-key="e05f54a2673a47868b8180dbc161085d:0">Given a linked list, reverse the nodes of a linked list </span><span data-offset-key="e05f54a2673a47868b8180dbc161085d:1">_k_</span><span data-offset-key="e05f54a2673a47868b8180dbc161085d:2"> at a time and return its modified list.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="9c9d3d16817045af8a3fdae662694dbf"><span data-offset-key="9c9d3d16817045af8a3fdae662694dbf:0">_k_</span><span data-offset-key="9c9d3d16817045af8a3fdae662694dbf:1"> is a positive integer and is less than or equal to the length of the linked list. If the number of nodes is not a multiple of </span><span data-offset-key="9c9d3d16817045af8a3fdae662694dbf:2">_k_</span><span data-offset-key="9c9d3d16817045af8a3fdae662694dbf:3"> then left-out nodes in the end should remain as it is.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="b25b967cbd424a9597eb9ec1c871c8ff"><span data-offset-key="b25b967cbd424a9597eb9ec1c871c8ff:0">**Example:**</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="16134a03f3ca406c830ad9ee24f2bef5"><span data-offset-key="16134a03f3ca406c830ad9ee24f2bef5:0">Given this linked list: </span><span data-offset-key="16134a03f3ca406c830ad9ee24f2bef5:1">`1->2->3->4->5`</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="d0dd4fc052944e6fbdf058ddd9921471"><span data-offset-key="d0dd4fc052944e6fbdf058ddd9921471:0">For </span><span data-offset-key="d0dd4fc052944e6fbdf058ddd9921471:1">_k_</span><span data-offset-key="d0dd4fc052944e6fbdf058ddd9921471:2"> = 2, you should return: </span><span data-offset-key="d0dd4fc052944e6fbdf058ddd9921471:3">`2->1->4->3->5`</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="080ce83c5e184ce99fa51b0b6e3ede50"><span data-offset-key="080ce83c5e184ce99fa51b0b6e3ede50:0">For </span><span data-offset-key="080ce83c5e184ce99fa51b0b6e3ede50:1">_k_</span><span data-offset-key="080ce83c5e184ce99fa51b0b6e3ede50:2"> = 3, you should return: </span><span data-offset-key="080ce83c5e184ce99fa51b0b6e3ede50:3">`3->2->1->4->5`</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="2f282ec87b6a4336a53b0bfe3fe2297b"><span data-offset-key="2f282ec87b6a4336a53b0bfe3fe2297b:0">**Note:**</span></span></span>

- <span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="b10bd4deca54485c88d5ae838cb1327c"><span data-offset-key="b10bd4deca54485c88d5ae838cb1327c:0">Only constant extra memory is allowed.</span></span></span>

- <span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="16745eac194345ec8681ad2469d4b8f8"><span data-offset-key="16745eac194345ec8681ad2469d4b8f8:0">You may not alter the values in the list's nodes, only nodes itself may be changed.</span></span></span>

###

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH400-686c0942--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="3c884a0247fd493992e97d9d3ebc22f4"><span data-offset-key="3c884a0247fd493992e97d9d3ebc22f4:0">Solution:</span></span></span>

1.  <span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="39f47303958a4ca38dac2d35c56e93e4"><span data-offset-key="39f47303958a4ca38dac2d35c56e93e4:0">Find the end node of a portion that needs to be reversed.</span></span></span>

2.  <span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="555db735de804764a89d51072f7f5c63"><span data-offset-key="555db735de804764a89d51072f7f5c63:0">Get the next node of the end node.</span></span></span>

3.  <span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="b14ff31a3629438d84bc37640235edd8"><span data-offset-key="b14ff31a3629438d84bc37640235edd8:0">Reverse the portion using the next node as edge(null) pointer.</span></span></span>

4.  <span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="c4b12dbdcdb4450bacf6940d62101fc2"><span data-offset-key="c4b12dbdcdb4450bacf6940d62101fc2:0">Connect it back to the main linked list.</span></span></span>

    /** _ Definition for singly-linked list. _ function ListNode(val) { _ this.val = val; _ this.next = null; _ } _//** _ @param {ListNode} head _ @param {number} k _ @return {ListNode} _/let reverseKGroup = function(head, k) { const prehead = { next: head } let p = prehead while (true) { let n = k let pEndNext = p.next while (pEndNext && n) { pEndNext = pEndNext.next n-- }​ if (n !== 0) { break }​ const nextp = p.next // The first node will be the last after reverse p.next = reverseLinkList(p.next, pEndNext) p = nextp }​ return prehead.next};​function reverseLinkList (head, nullNode = null) { let prev = nullNode let curr = head while (curr !== nullNode) { const next = curr.next curr.next = prev prev = curr curr = next } return prev};

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="641d99e85b8148f4ac08c00366abdafa"><span data-offset-key="641d99e85b8148f4ac08c00366abdafa:0">_Template generated via_ </span></span><a href="https://github.com/crimx/crx-leetmark" class="link-a079aa82--primary-53a25e66--link-faf6c434"><span data-key="670939d7f3e0414685717241d1968aaa"><span data-offset-key="670939d7f3e0414685717241d1968aaa:0"><em>Leetmark</em></span></span></a><span data-key="9669df1911c24af8ac3ebde85a0af442"><span data-offset-key="9669df1911c24af8ac3ebde85a0af442:0">_._</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH600-23f228db--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="d7a127fe39c745fda7050fa943e670b2"><span data-offset-key="d7a127fe39c745fda7050fa943e670b2:0">Difficulty: Easy Related Topics: "Array": </span></span><a href="https://leetcode.com/tag/array" class="link-a079aa82--primary-53a25e66--link-faf6c434"><span data-key="d4840289b7224c8494473b054b1c9d06"><span data-offset-key="d4840289b7224c8494473b054b1c9d06:0">https://leetcode.com/tag/array</span></span></a><span data-key="55287f2c113547f0a2163ce33b681289"><span Remove Duplicates from Sorted Array</span></span></a><span data-key="e6c554788e3b4afd99c0a92c4442ca37"><span data-offset-key="e6c554788e3b4afd99c0a92c4442ca37:0"><span data-slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span></span>

###

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH400-686c0942--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="44409ee361a343fcab9b0b274fc6092e"><span data-offset-key="44409ee361a343fcab9b0b274fc6092e:0">Problem:</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="4e5fce6653f1483480c0ab511e822fae"><span data-offset-key="4e5fce6653f1483480c0ab511e822fae:0">Given a sorted array </span><span data-offset-key="4e5fce6653f1483480c0ab511e822fae:1">_nums_</span><span data-offset-key="4e5fce6653f1483480c0ab511e822fae:2">, remove the duplicates </span></span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/In-place_algorithm" class="link-a079aa82--primary-53a25e66--link-faf6c434"><span data-key="4f48aefa3b494423ad5aacf12673218d"><span data-offset-key="4f48aefa3b494423ad5aacf12673218d:0"><strong>in-place</strong></span></span></a><span data-key="356b455612b34dd18c1ea9dd2531271b"><span data-offset-key="356b455612b34dd18c1ea9dd2531271b:0"> such that each element appear only </span><span data-offset-key="356b455612b34dd18c1ea9dd2531271b:1">_once_</span><span data-offset-key="356b455612b34dd18c1ea9dd2531271b:2"> and return the new length.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="f7815d3753ab45999a8b3dad5925300c"><span data-offset-key="f7815d3753ab45999a8b3dad5925300c:0">Do not allocate extra space for another array, you must do this by </span><span data-offset-key="f7815d3753ab45999a8b3dad5925300c:1">**modifying the input array in-place**</span><span data-offset-key="f7815d3753ab45999a8b3dad5925300c:2"> with O(1) extra memory.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="bebb844fd1b740de9cb0ec453cb49b13"><span data-offset-key="bebb844fd1b740de9cb0ec453cb49b13:0">**Example 1:**</span></span></span>

    Given nums = [1,1,2],​Your function should return length = 2, with the first two elements of nums being 1 and 2 respectively.​It doesn't matter what you leave beyond the returned length.

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="b689b5ef30df419586aca484332ae821"><span data-offset-key="b689b5ef30df419586aca484332ae821:0">**Example 2:**</span></span></span>

    Given nums = [0,0,1,1,1,2,2,3,3,4],​Your function should return length = 5, with the first five elements of nums being modified to 0, 1, 2, 3, and 4 respectively.​It doesn't matter what values are set beyond the returned length.

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="7c07ac474a6148ce844d967b9c2d7be3"><span data-offset-key="7c07ac474a6148ce844d967b9c2d7be3:0">**Clarification:**</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="217454c344324950b17b2bad26047163"><span data-offset-key="217454c344324950b17b2bad26047163:0">Confused why the returned value is an integer but your answer is an array?</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="0f2f7f18f75e4797bd37864a65b32e88"><span data-offset-key="0f2f7f18f75e4797bd37864a65b32e88:0">Note that the input array is passed in by </span><span data-offset-key="0f2f7f18f75e4797bd37864a65b32e88:1">**reference**</span><span data-offset-key="0f2f7f18f75e4797bd37864a65b32e88:2">, which means modification to the input array will be known to the caller as well.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="5dd5f23155714c818f89e2cf85f9207d"><span data-offset-key="5dd5f23155714c818f89e2cf85f9207d:0">Internally you can think of this:</span></span></span>

    // nums is passed in by reference. (i.e., without making a copy)int len = removeDuplicates(nums);​// any modification to nums in your function would be known by the caller.// using the length returned by your function, it prints the first len elements.for (int i = 0; i < len; i++) {    print(nums[i]);}

###

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH400-686c0942--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="5adb4816dff14375891a7da45ad9683e"><span data-offset-key="5adb4816dff14375891a7da45ad9683e:0">Solution:</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="972c40afd04149d59a9c4a814743d32a"><span data-offset-key="972c40afd04149d59a9c4a814743d32a:0">The result array can only be shorter. That is why we can build the array in-place with the new length.</span></span></span>

    /** * @param {number[]} nums * @return {number} */let removeDuplicates = function(nums) {  let len = 0  for (let i = 0; i < nums.length; i++) {    if (nums[i] !== nums[i-1]) {      nums[len++] = nums[i]    }  }  return len};

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="031544180cd444d98a1c2c9a7ea0d5ae"><span data-offset-key="031544180cd444d98a1c2c9a7ea0d5ae:0">_Template generated via_ </span></span><a href="https://github.com/crimx/crx-leetmark" class="link-a079aa82--primary-53a25e66--link-faf6c434"><span data-key="ad88ce4c8f834441a0fab94314be1ff4"><span data-offset-key="ad88ce4c8f834441a0fab94314be1ff4:0"><em>Leetmark</em></span></span></a><span data-key="243d7e823996475a9dd3b8d74a44d0de"><span data-offset-key="243d7e823996475a9dd3b8d74a44d0de:0">_._</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH400-686c0942--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="c443e48736d9424e9b6d0824209376c2"><span data-offset-key="c443e48736d9424e9b6d0824209376c2:0">Problem:</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="107c15540752433d994a6d84b36d7644"><span data-offset-key="107c15540752433d994a6d84b36d7644:0">Given an array </span><span data-offset-key="107c15540752433d994a6d84b36d7644:1">_nums_</span><span data-offset-key="107c15540752433d994a6d84b36d7644:2"> and a value </span><span data-offset-key="107c15540752433d994a6d84b36d7644:3">_val_</span><span data-offset-key="107c15540752433d994a6d84b36d7644:4">, remove all instances of that value </span></span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/In-place_algorithm" class="link-a079aa82--primary-53a25e66--link-faf6c434"><span data-key="74ede82e6486464891ef8558ae58f633"><span data-offset-key="74ede82e6486464891ef8558ae58f633:0"><strong>in-place</strong></span></span></a><span data-key="a20baab48c9d453297d7ecc5ea096a33"><span data-offset-key="a20baab48c9d453297d7ecc5ea096a33:0"> and return the new length.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="d6f2c420a163499a9de706425d796f8d"><span data-offset-key="d6f2c420a163499a9de706425d796f8d:0">Do not allocate extra space for another array, you must do this by </span><span data-offset-key="d6f2c420a163499a9de706425d796f8d:1">**modifying the input array in-place**</span><span data-offset-key="d6f2c420a163499a9de706425d796f8d:2"> with O(1) extra memory.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="2033a6fe1de643578f5ec3a2a0449aed"><span data-offset-key="2033a6fe1de643578f5ec3a2a0449aed:0">The order of elements can be changed. It doesn't matter what you leave beyond the new length.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="ab5aaf68d22e4c12bb99267ddafb1f53"><span data-offset-key="ab5aaf68d22e4c12bb99267ddafb1f53:0">**Example 1:**</span></span></span>

    Given nums = [3,2,2,3], val = 3,​Your function should return length = 2, with the first two elements of nums being 2.​It doesn't matter what you leave beyond the returned length.

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="d75ad96306bd4758853cd1fbfd76d031"><span data-offset-key="d75ad96306bd4758853cd1fbfd76d031:0">**Example 2:**</span></span></span>

    Given nums = [0,1,2,2,3,0,4,2], val = 2,​Your function should return length = 5, with the first five elements of nums containing 0, 1, 3, 0, and 4.​Note that the order of those five elements can be arbitrary.​It doesn't matter what values are set beyond the returned length.

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="ad478bd1f063452b828b52f088c7e1c4"><span data-offset-key="ad478bd1f063452b828b52f088c7e1c4:0">**Clarification:**</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="4423c35e6bd2415bb9a71fae367a1ade"><span data-offset-key="4423c35e6bd2415bb9a71fae367a1ade:0">Confused why the returned value is an integer but your answer is an array?</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="2660a55b23034334ad15c62bca81751f"><span data-offset-key="2660a55b23034334ad15c62bca81751f:0">Note that the input array is passed in by </span><span data-offset-key="2660a55b23034334ad15c62bca81751f:1">**reference**</span><span data-offset-key="2660a55b23034334ad15c62bca81751f:2">, which means modification to the input array will be known to the caller as well.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="ed37392c6dbc44f99ab4889fce8b2e0e"><span data-offset-key="ed37392c6dbc44f99ab4889fce8b2e0e:0">Internally you can think of this:</span></span></span>

    // nums is passed in by reference. (i.e., without making a copy)int len = removeElement(nums, val);​// any modification to nums in your function would be known by the caller.// using the length returned by your function, it prints the first len elements.for (int i = 0; i < len; i++) {    print(nums[i]);}

###

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH400-686c0942--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="8568086c028044fe912967a9e98ca4fa"><span data-offset-key="8568086c028044fe912967a9e98ca4fa:0">Solution:</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="9d8f700ed60446a09991d213bfbbf9c9"><span data-offset-key="9d8f700ed60446a09991d213bfbbf9c9:0">The order does not matter. So just take the last number to fill the vacancy.</span></span></span>

    /** * @param {number[]} nums * @param {number} val * @return {number} */let removeElement = function(nums, val) {  let len = nums.length  for (let i = 0; i < len; i++) {    if (nums[i] === val) {      nums[i--] = nums[--len]    }  }  return len};

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="0c33be4545204b23bd617c2da094cc09"><span data-offset-key="0c33be4545204b23bd617c2da094cc09:0">_Template generated via_ </span></span><a href="https://github.com/crimx/crx-leetmark" class="link-a079aa82--primary-53a25e66--link-faf6c434"><span data-key="523f701c774849ddb48022732c039de8"><span data-offset-key="523f701c774849ddb48022732c039de8:0"><em>Leetmark</em></span></span></a><span data-key="3ceee5c2885540d080704092cfe195a2"><span data-offset-key="3ceee5c2885540d080704092cfe195a2:0">_._</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH600-23f228db--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="ff1ae0f6ae194695a5ccc6d627b30687"><span data-offset-key="ff1ae0f6ae194695a5ccc6d627b30687:0">Difficulty: Medium Related Topics: "Math": </span></span><a href="https://leetcode.com/tag/math" class="link-a079aa82--primary-53a25e66--link-faf6c434"><span data-key="86374e7682084305a02a2d04a757319a"><span data-offset-key="86374e7682084305a02a2d04a757319a:0">https://leetcode.com/tag/math</span></span></a><span data-key="1d1b07ead48b441da18e256e14bc68b1"><span data-offset-key="1d1b07ead48b441da18e256e14bc68b1:0"> "Binary Search": </span></span><a href="https://leetcode.com/tag/binary-search" class="link-a079aa82--primary-53a25e66--link-faf6c434"><span data-key="fe3e1ca779124d0189510032838418e9"><span data-offset-key="fe3e1ca779124d0189510032838418e9:0">https://leetcode.com/tag/binary-search</span></span></a><span data-key="bc2bff3974474469b7aef32f0ecc6c03"><span data-offset-key="bc2bff3974474469b7aef32f0ecc6c03:0"><span data-slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span></span>

Divide Two Integers</span></span></a><span data-key="e2234892dc044632ad45d6fe8b9ab235"><span data-offset-key="e2234892dc044632ad45d6fe8b9ab235:0"><span data-slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span></span>

###

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH400-686c0942--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="737971fd715a47559a7322dce3fab5c1"><span data-offset-key="737971fd715a47559a7322dce3fab5c1:0">Problem:</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="8eb6c84382ac4d7598b4ecac2aa3805e"><span data-offset-key="8eb6c84382ac4d7598b4ecac2aa3805e:0">Given two integers </span><span data-offset-key="8eb6c84382ac4d7598b4ecac2aa3805e:1">`dividend`</span><span data-offset-key="8eb6c84382ac4d7598b4ecac2aa3805e:2"> and </span><span data-offset-key="8eb6c84382ac4d7598b4ecac2aa3805e:3">`divisor`</span><span data-offset-key="8eb6c84382ac4d7598b4ecac2aa3805e:4">, divide two integers without using multiplication, division and mod operator.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="b23cde58d84347cc93e33bdb45e7ca19"><span data-offset-key="b23cde58d84347cc93e33bdb45e7ca19:0">Return the quotient after dividing </span><span data-offset-key="b23cde58d84347cc93e33bdb45e7ca19:1">`dividend`</span><span data-offset-key="b23cde58d84347cc93e33bdb45e7ca19:2"> by </span><span data-offset-key="b23cde58d84347cc93e33bdb45e7ca19:3">`divisor`</span><span data-offset-key="b23cde58d84347cc93e33bdb45e7ca19:4">.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="d44e3b58dbc94a99a151000d66c0f49d"><span data-offset-key="d44e3b58dbc94a99a151000d66c0f49d:0">The integer division should truncate toward zero.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="eba562709744403e951fbcd90df1df25"><span data-offset-key="eba562709744403e951fbcd90df1df25:0">**Example 1:**</span></span></span>

    Input: dividend = 10, divisor = 3Output: 3

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="4a6c0e05ea9e4b1ea31888eeb4d7acc1"><span data-offset-key="4a6c0e05ea9e4b1ea31888eeb4d7acc1:0">**Example 2:**</span></span></span>

    Input: dividend = 7, divisor = -3Output: -2

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="04c81434538c441bb0e3878fa802399b"><span data-offset-key="04c81434538c441bb0e3878fa802399b:0">**Note:**</span></span></span>

- <span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="931499d32c4e452083638dd912ed00dc"><span data-offset-key="931499d32c4e452083638dd912ed00dc:0">Both dividend and divisor will be 32-bit signed integers.</span></span></span>

- <span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="161043ad44374bf88e4c472b49a1b450"><span data-offset-key="161043ad44374bf88e4c472b49a1b450:0">The divisor will never be 0.</span></span></span>

- <span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="8c692c24c57b49678cff8831dc6f5439"><span data-offset-key="8c692c24c57b49678cff8831dc6f5439:0">Assume we are dealing with an environment which could only store integers within the 32-bit signed integer range: \[−231, 231 − 1\]. For the purpose of this problem, assume that your function returns 231 − 1 when the division result overflows.</span></span></span>

###

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH400-686c0942--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="9bfc91bfbd7c4cc19acb777be1074168"><span data-offset-key="9bfc91bfbd7c4cc19acb777be1074168:0">Solution:</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="365974099e7c4880a9e2ee6246d3df9b"><span data-offset-key="365974099e7c4880a9e2ee6246d3df9b:0">Every decimal number can be represented as </span><span data-offset-key="365974099e7c4880a9e2ee6246d3df9b:1">`a0*2^0 + a1*2^1 + a2*2^2 + ... + an*2^n`</span><span data-offset-key="365974099e7c4880a9e2ee6246d3df9b:2">.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="64ae7e285025493ebbc90b91a6d14db2"><span data-offset-key="64ae7e285025493ebbc90b91a6d14db2:0">Replace multiplication and division with binary shifting.</span></span></span>

    /** * @param {number} dividend * @param {number} divisor * @return {number} */let divide = function(dividend, divisor) {  if (divisor === 0 ||      divisor === -1 && dividend < -2147483647 ||      dividend > 2147483647 ||      dividend < -2147483648  ) {    return 2147483647  }​  const isNegative = dividend < 0 && divisor >= 0 || dividend >= 0 && divisor < 0  const pDividend = Math.abs(dividend)  const pDivisor = Math.abs(divisor)​  if (dividend === 0 || pDividend < pDivisor) { return 0 }​  let doubling = pDivisor  let count = 1  while (doubling < pDividend && !(doubling & (1 << 30))) {    doubling <<= 1    count <<= 1  }  if (doubling > pDividend) {    doubling >>>= 1    count >>>= 1  }​  const result = count + divide(pDividend - doubling, pDivisor)  return isNegative ? -result : result};

Next Permutation</span></span></a><span data-key="af23a0a9490843feabe5f084d5cce5f6"><span data-offset-key="af23a0a9490843feabe5f084d5cce5f6:0"><span data-slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span></span>

###

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH400-686c0942--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="0304be8a78474c069fe9774185ef8f77"><span data-offset-key="0304be8a78474c069fe9774185ef8f77:0">Problem:</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="483c4dc728de4c15baae53ec131327ad"><span data-offset-key="483c4dc728de4c15baae53ec131327ad:0">Implement </span><span data-offset-key="483c4dc728de4c15baae53ec131327ad:1">**next permutation**</span><span data-offset-key="483c4dc728de4c15baae53ec131327ad:2">, which rearranges numbers into the lexicographically next greater permutation of numbers.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="2d8ef87e763349bca267a59a3d7508a8"><span data-offset-key="2d8ef87e763349bca267a59a3d7508a8:0">If such arrangement is not possible, it must rearrange it as the lowest possible order (ie, sorted in ascending order).</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="5a4ec88948624a7d90aa62715973ff43"><span data-offset-key="5a4ec88948624a7d90aa62715973ff43:0">The replacement must be </span><span data-offset-key="5a4ec88948624a7d90aa62715973ff43:1">**in-place**</span><span data-offset-key="5a4ec88948624a7d90aa62715973ff43:2"> and use only constant extra memory.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="c503a26e8c03405cb41c7ee40b4f4c7e"><span data-offset-key="c503a26e8c03405cb41c7ee40b4f4c7e:0">Here are some examples. Inputs are in the left-hand column and its corresponding outputs are in the right-hand column.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="accae4b9ca7943a6bb8c63bd92f8de5e"><span data-offset-key="accae4b9ca7943a6bb8c63bd92f8de5e:0">`1,2,3`</span><span data-offset-key="accae4b9ca7943a6bb8c63bd92f8de5e:1"> → </span><span data-offset-key="accae4b9ca7943a6bb8c63bd92f8de5e:2">`1,3,2`</span><span data-offset-key="accae4b9ca7943a6bb8c63bd92f8de5e:3"> </span><span data-offset-key="accae4b9ca7943a6bb8c63bd92f8de5e:4">`3,2,1`</span><span data-offset-key="accae4b9ca7943a6bb8c63bd92f8de5e:5"> → </span><span data-offset-key="accae4b9ca7943a6bb8c63bd92f8de5e:6">`1,2,3`</span><span data-offset-key="accae4b9ca7943a6bb8c63bd92f8de5e:7"> </span><span data-offset-key="accae4b9ca7943a6bb8c63bd92f8de5e:8">`1,1,5`</span><span data-offset-key="accae4b9ca7943a6bb8c63bd92f8de5e:9"> → </span><span data-offset-key="accae4b9ca7943a6bb8c63bd92f8de5e:10">`1,5,1`</span></span></span>

###

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH400-686c0942--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="9d2046b72b914259a121421af9b17886"><span data-offset-key="9d2046b72b914259a121421af9b17886:0">Solution:</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="37e7fd3dc1d141368b1afa6de25b991b"><span data-offset-key="37e7fd3dc1d141368b1afa6de25b991b:0">Observe a few longer examples and the pattern is self-evident.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="1ff418dabc874c92a0dceea610edd1ed"><span data-offset-key="1ff418dabc874c92a0dceea610edd1ed:0">Divide the list into two parts. The first half must be incremental and the second half must be decremental.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="01c47e5d202e44958d7d3ce4a208334f"><span data-offset-key="01c47e5d202e44958d7d3ce4a208334f:0">Reverse the second half and find the smallest number in it that is greater the last number of the first half.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="d719227cbe114e9d97dddeaad661692c"><span data-offset-key="d719227cbe114e9d97dddeaad661692c:0">Swap the two.</span></span></span>

    /** * @param {number[]} nums * @return {void} Do not return anything, modify nums in-place instead. */let nextPermutation = function(nums) {  const len = nums.length  if (len <= 1) { return }​  for (let i = len - 1; i > 0; i--) {    if (nums[i] > nums[i-1]) {      let t      for (let s = i, e = len-1; s < e; s++, e--) {        t = nums[s]        nums[s] = nums[e]        nums[e]  = t      }​      let j = len - 1      while (nums[j] <= nums[i-1]) {        j--      }​      t = nums[j]      nums[j] = nums[i-1]      nums[i-1] = t            break    }  }​  if (i === 0) {    nums.reverse()  }};

###

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH400-686c0942--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="e4f6d55f47344524a34b3364e3a46fb4"><span data-offset-key="e4f6d55f47344524a34b3364e3a46fb4:0">Problem:</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="4eb60c1e0c154bbe96948bc37268dc9c"><span data-offset-key="4eb60c1e0c154bbe96948bc37268dc9c:0">Suppose an array sorted in ascending order is rotated at some pivot unknown to you beforehand.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="59b71506734e43b5a566ea608fd5b360"><span data-offset-key="59b71506734e43b5a566ea608fd5b360:0">(i.e., </span><span data-offset-key="59b71506734e43b5a566ea608fd5b360:1">`[0,1,2,4,5,6,7]`</span><span data-offset-key="59b71506734e43b5a566ea608fd5b360:2"> might become </span><span data-offset-key="59b71506734e43b5a566ea608fd5b360:3">`[4,5,6,7,0,1,2]`</span><span data-offset-key="59b71506734e43b5a566ea608fd5b360:4">).</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="a2018970b2c5409d9efeb47210b298af"><span data-offset-key="a2018970b2c5409d9efeb47210b298af:0">You are given a target value to search. If found in the array return its index, otherwise return </span><span data-offset-key="a2018970b2c5409d9efeb47210b298af:1">`-1`</span><span data-offset-key="a2018970b2c5409d9efeb47210b298af:2">.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="333160be265f4040a6c6c693b7710e7b"><span data-offset-key="333160be265f4040a6c6c693b7710e7b:0">You may assume no duplicate exists in the array.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="4c563db8c1f648a29777e90ab92d3660"><span data-offset-key="4c563db8c1f648a29777e90ab92d3660:0">Your algorithm's runtime complexity must be in the order of </span><span data-offset-key="4c563db8c1f648a29777e90ab92d3660:1">_O_</span><span data-offset-key="4c563db8c1f648a29777e90ab92d3660:2">(log </span><span data-offset-key="4c563db8c1f648a29777e90ab92d3660:3">_n_</span><span data-offset-key="4c563db8c1f648a29777e90ab92d3660:4">).</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="e9ab22e5a9a14c9cbc1296681e81bb90"><span data-offset-key="e9ab22e5a9a14c9cbc1296681e81bb90:0">**Example 1:**</span></span></span>

    Input: nums = [4,5,6,7,0,1,2], target = 0Output: 4

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="61cd66c7b6e546388a71aa357ffa027f"><span data-offset-key="61cd66c7b6e546388a71aa357ffa027f:0">**Example 2:**</span></span></span>

    Input: nums = [4,5,6,7,0,1,2], target = 3Output: -1

###

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH400-686c0942--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="56f44624fef84b5f945e74c3758b71e9"><span data-offset-key="56f44624fef84b5f945e74c3758b71e9:0">Solution:</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="e6bb7bfdf456421fb5385f6810bde923"><span data-offset-key="e6bb7bfdf456421fb5385f6810bde923:0">Obviously the problem requires binary search.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="cfe4fa2e03f64ead98f77387c337698b"><span data-offset-key="cfe4fa2e03f64ead98f77387c337698b:0">The core idea of binary search is to pick the middle item and then decide to keep which half.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="4f48f8d813fc4c57847c9d9792a90f18"><span data-offset-key="4f48f8d813fc4c57847c9d9792a90f18:0">The precondition of it is the array must be sorted.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="a5f81cc4273f44e2bee9fcb627d32528"><span data-offset-key="a5f81cc4273f44e2bee9fcb627d32528:0">But take a closer look and we realize that only one of the two halves needs to be sorted. This is sufficient for us to know if the target is in that half. If not, then it must be in the other.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="416583dcd3fd40d793188a83bfd2601c"><span data-offset-key="416583dcd3fd40d793188a83bfd2601c:0">Whenever we choose a pivot, it must be in one of the two sorted parts of the rotated array.</span></span></span>

- <span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="69da8d585ad7464c96b0c662de201ce6"><span data-offset-key="69da8d585ad7464c96b0c662de201ce6:0">If the pivot is in the left part. We know that the begin of the left part to the pivot are sorted.</span></span></span>

- <span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="0ddb0dc771244808848790772c83862a"><span data-offset-key="0ddb0dc771244808848790772c83862a:0">Otherwise the pivot is in the right part. We know that the end of the right part to the pivot are sorted.</span></span></span>

  /\*\* _ @param {number[]} nums _ @param {number} target _ @return {number} _/let search = function(nums, target) { let s = 0 let e = nums.length - 1​ while (s <= e) { const p = (e + s) / 2 | 0 const pivot = nums[p]​ if (pivot === target) { return p }​ if (pivot < nums[e]) { // right half is sorted if (target > pivot && target <= nums[e]) { // target is inside the right half s = p + 1 } else { e = p - 1 } } else { // left half is sorted if (target < pivot && target >= nums[s]) { // target is inside the left half e = p - 1 } else { s = p + 1 } } }​ return -1};

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="b8ec69dbcd464a35b552d20860a47562"><span data-offset-key="b8ec69dbcd464a35b552d20860a47562:0">_Template generated via_ </span></span><a href="https://github.com/crimx/crx-leetmark" class="link-a079aa82--primary-53a25e66--link-faf6c434"><span data-key="8ce0a47e66d74e0080d0b1559b3688a6"><span data-offset-key="8ce0a47e66d74e0080d0b1559b3688a6:0"><em>Leetmark</em></span></span></a><span data-key="f99882617c7648bbb6f238758170d817"><span data-offset-key="f99882617c7648bbb6f238758170d817:0">_._</span></span></span>
