<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="dfa0a9b47e904e02bfa6e9f75b962270"><span data-offset-key="dfa0a9b47e904e02bfa6e9f75b962270:0">Given an absolute path for a file (Unix-style), simplify it.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="16a79a899f814fe9ade19c0bc1c708a4"><span data-offset-key="16a79a899f814fe9ade19c0bc1c708a4:0">For example, </span><span data-offset-key="16a79a899f814fe9ade19c0bc1c708a4:1">**path**</span><span data-offset-key="16a79a899f814fe9ade19c0bc1c708a4:2"> = </span><span data-offset-key="16a79a899f814fe9ade19c0bc1c708a4:3">`"/home/"`</span><span data-offset-key="16a79a899f814fe9ade19c0bc1c708a4:4">, =&gt; </span><span data-offset-key="16a79a899f814fe9ade19c0bc1c708a4:5">`"/home"`</span><span data-offset-key="16a79a899f814fe9ade19c0bc1c708a4:6"> </span><span data-offset-key="16a79a899f814fe9ade19c0bc1c708a4:7">**path**</span><span data-offset-key="16a79a899f814fe9ade19c0bc1c708a4:8"> = </span><span data-offset-key="16a79a899f814fe9ade19c0bc1c708a4:9">`"/a/./b/../../c/"`</span><span data-offset-key="16a79a899f814fe9ade19c0bc1c708a4:10">, =&gt; </span><span data-offset-key="16a79a899f814fe9ade19c0bc1c708a4:11">`"/c"`</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="437da91fca844539b27c78582abdebd8"><span data-offset-key="437da91fca844539b27c78582abdebd8:0">**Corner Cases:**</span></span></span>

- <span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="991ebef0fc494e2db319f271d6280bf6"><span data-offset-key="991ebef0fc494e2db319f271d6280bf6:0">Did you consider the case where </span><span data-offset-key="991ebef0fc494e2db319f271d6280bf6:1">**path**</span><span data-offset-key="991ebef0fc494e2db319f271d6280bf6:2"> = </span><span data-offset-key="991ebef0fc494e2db319f271d6280bf6:3">`"/../"`</span><span data-offset-key="991ebef0fc494e2db319f271d6280bf6:4">? In this case, you should return </span><span data-offset-key="991ebef0fc494e2db319f271d6280bf6:5">`"/"`</span><span data-offset-key="991ebef0fc494e2db319f271d6280bf6:6">.</span></span></span>

- <span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="7fcdf1f9b0764491be62707ab2a94ddb"><span data-offset-key="7fcdf1f9b0764491be62707ab2a94ddb:0">Another corner case is the path might contain multiple slashes </span><span data-offset-key="7fcdf1f9b0764491be62707ab2a94ddb:1">`'/'`</span><span data-offset-key="7fcdf1f9b0764491be62707ab2a94ddb:2"> together, such as </span><span data-offset-key="7fcdf1f9b0764491be62707ab2a94ddb:3">`"/home//foo/"`</span><span data-offset-key="7fcdf1f9b0764491be62707ab2a94ddb:4">. In this case, you should ignore redundant slashes and return </span><span data-offset-key="7fcdf1f9b0764491be62707ab2a94ddb:5">`"/home/foo"`</span><span data-offset-key="7fcdf1f9b0764491be62707ab2a94ddb:6">.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH400-686c0942--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="fb8ccd4ce343424da8ffff97010d3152"><span data-offset-key="fb8ccd4ce343424da8ffff97010d3152:0">Solution:</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="e464242aa1564da186501d97e2475575"><span data-offset-key="e464242aa1564da186501d97e2475575:0">Use stack to handle </span><span data-offset-key="e464242aa1564da186501d97e2475575:1">`/../`</span><span data-offset-key="e464242aa1564da186501d97e2475575:2">.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="2248b67d596e4b20a0852c410c17770d"><span data-offset-key="2248b67d596e4b20a0852c410c17770d:0">**ONE**</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="76b247d76ece4ef58dddbebcbeb314ad"><span data-offset-key="76b247d76ece4ef58dddbebcbeb314ad:0">RegExp matching.</span></span></span>

    /** * @param {string} path * @return {string} */let simplifyPath = function(path) {  return '/' + (path.match(/[^\/]+/g) || [])    .reduce((stack, p) => {      if (p === '..') {        stack.pop()      } else if (p !== '.') {        stack.push(p)      }      return stack    }, [])    .join('/')};

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="feec666512084e2983a3f2d1a5d62af5"><span data-offset-key="feec666512084e2983a3f2d1a5d62af5:0">**TWO**</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="503b2a80c1a84854aeb9406c475d1223"><span data-offset-key="503b2a80c1a84854aeb9406c475d1223:0">Direct search.</span></span></span>

    /** * @param {string} path * @return {string} */let simplifyPath = function(path) {  const len = path.length  const stack = []  let e = 0  while (e < len) {    while (e < len && path[e] === '/') {      e++    }    const s = e    while (e < len && path[e] !== '/') {      e++    }    if (s < e) {      const p = path.slice(s, e)      if (p === '..') {        stack.pop()      } else if (p !== '.') {        stack.push(p)      }    }  }  return '/' + stack.join('/')};

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH400-686c0942--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="3cfcf8c0b6f3463eaa20aca788564215"><span data-offset-key="3cfcf8c0b6f3463eaa20aca788564215:0">Problem:</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="1606508056704d18bb29f9c8372b272d"><span data-offset-key="1606508056704d18bb29f9c8372b272d:0">Given two words </span><span data-offset-key="1606508056704d18bb29f9c8372b272d:1">_word1_</span><span data-offset-key="1606508056704d18bb29f9c8372b272d:2"> and </span><span data-offset-key="1606508056704d18bb29f9c8372b272d:3">_word2_</span><span data-offset-key="1606508056704d18bb29f9c8372b272d:4">, find the minimum number of operations required to convert </span><span data-offset-key="1606508056704d18bb29f9c8372b272d:5">_word1_</span><span data-offset-key="1606508056704d18bb29f9c8372b272d:6"> to </span><span data-offset-key="1606508056704d18bb29f9c8372b272d:7">_word2_</span><span data-offset-key="1606508056704d18bb29f9c8372b272d:8">.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="9ef8d540c0074e32b1923fc3df597272"><span data-offset-key="9ef8d540c0074e32b1923fc3df597272:0">You have the following 3 operations permitted on a word:</span></span></span>

1.  <span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="5bc73f5053d04a4bb22c8acfca9cdda4"><span data-offset-key="5bc73f5053d04a4bb22c8acfca9cdda4:0">Insert a character</span></span></span>

2.  <span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="345a32d6952e4874852d8b7ec7a91489"><span data-offset-key="345a32d6952e4874852d8b7ec7a91489:0">Delete a character</span></span></span>

3.  <span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="39d588d01c414337b24a838639f5bc7a"><span data-offset-key="39d588d01c414337b24a838639f5bc7a:0">Replace a character</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="d9e2a31774554a38a71c87ed6b697cf8"><span data-offset-key="d9e2a31774554a38a71c87ed6b697cf8:0">**Example 1:**</span></span></span>

    Input: word1 = "horse", word2 = "ros"Output: 3Explanation: horse -> rorse (replace 'h' with 'r')rorse -> rose (remove 'r')rose -> ros (remove 'e')

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="c9338016d6604469894441be7c10c243"><span data-offset-key="c9338016d6604469894441be7c10c243:0">**Example 2:**</span></span></span>

    Input: word1 = "intention", word2 = "execution"Output: 5Explanation: intention -> inention (remove 't')inention -> enention (replace 'i' with 'e')enention -> exention (replace 'n' with 'x')exention -> exection (replace 'n' with 'c')exection -> execution (insert 'u')

###

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH400-686c0942--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="2a38bfcfaee24baf8d93b95f96ce77a5"><span data-offset-key="2a38bfcfaee24baf8d93b95f96ce77a5:0">Solution:</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="7721e86f4546410d948b08e163dc45f7"><span data-offset-key="7721e86f4546410d948b08e163dc45f7:0">DP.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="f05f82570f07424fb3926e66a6c8acd9"><span data-offset-key="f05f82570f07424fb3926e66a6c8acd9:0">Define </span><span data-offset-key="f05f82570f07424fb3926e66a6c8acd9:1">`f(i, j)`</span><span data-offset-key="f05f82570f07424fb3926e66a6c8acd9:2"> to be the min edit distance from </span><span data-offset-key="f05f82570f07424fb3926e66a6c8acd9:3">`word1[0...i)`</span><span data-offset-key="f05f82570f07424fb3926e66a6c8acd9:4"> to </span><span data-offset-key="f05f82570f07424fb3926e66a6c8acd9:5">`word2[0...j)`</span><span data-offset-key="f05f82570f07424fb3926e66a6c8acd9:6">.</span></span></span>

    f(0, 0) = 0f(0, j) = f(0, j-1) + 1 // can only insertf(i, 0) = f(i-1, 0) + 1 // can only deletef(i, j) = min(  f(i, j-1) + 1 // insert  f(i-1, j) + 1 // delete  f(i-1, j-1) + (word1[i-1] !== word2[j-1] ? 1 : 0) // replace or do nothing)

    /** * @param {string} word1 * @param {string} word2 * @return {number} */let minDistance = function(word1, word2) {  const len1 = word1.length  const len2 = word2.length​  if(len1 <= 0 || len2 <= 0) {    return len1 + len2  }​  const dp = []​  for (let i = 0; i <= len1; i++) {    dp[i] = [i]  }​  for (let j = 0; j <= len2; j++) {    dp[0][j] = j  }​  for (let i = 1; i <= len1; i++) {    for (let j = 1; j <= len2; j++) {      dp[i][j] = Math.min(        dp[i][j-1] + 1,        dp[i-1][j] + 1,        dp[i-1][j-1] + (word1[i-1] === word2[j-1] ? 0 : 1)      )    }  }​  return dp[len1][len2]};

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="c98b2d3d180042ea973434d8b9b30c31"><span data-offset-key="c98b2d3d180042ea973434d8b9b30c31:0">_Template generated via_ </span></span><a href="https://github.com/crimx/crx-leetmark" class="link-a079aa82--primary-53a25e66--link-faf6c434"><span data-key="5fab09dc2a5d4158b0d5af4910070988"><span data-offset-key="5fab09dc2a5d4158b0d5af4910070988:0"><em>Leetmark</em></span></span></a><span data-key="7251f7fe6bf546e782372553046d2d84"><span data-offset-key="7251f7fe6bf546e782372553046d2d84:0">_._</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH600-23f228db--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="392cb6f880504386bdc1d4c78241e42e"><span data-offset-key="392cb6f880504386bdc1d4c78241e42e:0">Difficulty: Medium Related Topics: "Array": </span></span><a href="https://leetcode.com/tag/array" class="link-a079aa82--primary-53a25e66--link-faf6c434"><span data-key="34fb98946b5b4ea29be322ec10809a8e"><span data-offset-key="34fb98946b5b4ea29be322ec10809a8e:0">https://leetcode.com/tag/array</span></span></a><span data-key="3550549256c54478acff3a0adf140b93"><span data-offset-key="3550549256c54478acff3a0adf140b93:0"> Similar Questions: "Game of Life": </span></span><a href="https://leetcode.com/problems/game-of-life" class="link-a079aa82--primary-53a25e66--link-faf6c434"><span data-key="b6c6570ee4c7446d8d563ca5e14fdaa0"><span data-offset-key="b6c6570ee4c7446d8d563ca5e14fdaa0:0">https://leetcode.com/problems/game-of-life</span></span></a><span data-key="045d24f28192447b8d77755e1001c059"><span data-offset-key="045d24f28192447b8d77755e1001c059:0"><span data-slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH600-23f228db--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="107ba541d436474fb0686d6c6b6ba3dd"><span data-offset-key="107ba541d436474fb0686d6c6b6ba3dd:0"><span data-slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><a href="https://leetcode.com/problems/set-matrix-zeroes/description/" class="link-a079aa82--primary-53a25e66--link-faf6c434"><span data-key="136cfec071ec44db809c6995647f1202"><span data-offset-key="136cfec071ec44db809c6995647f1202:0">73. Set Matrix Zeroes</span></span></a><span data-key="3a3e5ea80c8f40339bf38e2a7fce7bd5"><span data-offset-key="3a3e5ea80c8f40339bf38e2a7fce7bd5:0"><span data-slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span></span>

###

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH400-686c0942--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="68c80991a5b24b13a37b6699ddd83e1c"><span data-offset-key="68c80991a5b24b13a37b6699ddd83e1c:0">Problem:</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="2d794383fea4438295014fa5f1bed9db"><span data-offset-key="2d794383fea4438295014fa5f1bed9db:0">Given a </span><span data-offset-key="2d794383fea4438295014fa5f1bed9db:1">_m_</span><span data-offset-key="2d794383fea4438295014fa5f1bed9db:2"> x </span><span data-offset-key="2d794383fea4438295014fa5f1bed9db:3">_n_</span><span data-offset-key="2d794383fea4438295014fa5f1bed9db:4"> matrix, if an element is 0, set its entire row and column to 0. Do it </span></span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/In-place_algorithm" class="link-a079aa82--primary-53a25e66--link-faf6c434"><span data-key="07d06386312a44288e64a41b33b75ce3"><span data-offset-key="07d06386312a44288e64a41b33b75ce3:0"><strong>in-place</strong></span></span></a><span data-key="b85108a6a4584881a42e76f925e46513"><span data-offset-key="b85108a6a4584881a42e76f925e46513:0">.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="7de3c4178df04bfd9c39e48ee91fe6f5"><span data-offset-key="7de3c4178df04bfd9c39e48ee91fe6f5:0">**Example 1:**</span></span></span>

    Input: [  [1,1,1],  [1,0,1],  [1,1,1]]Output: [  [1,0,1],  [0,0,0],  [1,0,1]]

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="dced91bcb8734f4cbc8a6e4e795dfbc7"><span data-offset-key="dced91bcb8734f4cbc8a6e4e795dfbc7:0">**Example 2:**</span></span></span>

    Input: [  [0,1,2,0],  [3,4,5,2],  [1,3,1,5]]Output: [  [0,0,0,0],  [0,4,5,0],  [0,3,1,0]]

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="2e97c4087d8f483b8db8001487014a0f"><span data-offset-key="2e97c4087d8f483b8db8001487014a0f:0">**Follow up:**</span></span></span>

- <span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="77a7b34b40d541dc8ff55dfd085c00bf"><span data-offset-key="77a7b34b40d541dc8ff55dfd085c00bf:0">A straight forward solution using O(</span><span data-offset-key="77a7b34b40d541dc8ff55dfd085c00bf:1">_m\*\*n_</span><span data-offset-key="77a7b34b40d541dc8ff55dfd085c00bf:2">) space is probably a bad idea.</span></span></span>

- <span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="0350b8c3cf9e4f50bf2327c5ec658cad"><span data-offset-key="0350b8c3cf9e4f50bf2327c5ec658cad:0">A simple improvement uses O(</span><span data-offset-key="0350b8c3cf9e4f50bf2327c5ec658cad:1">_m_</span><span data-offset-key="0350b8c3cf9e4f50bf2327c5ec658cad:2"> + </span><span data-offset-key="0350b8c3cf9e4f50bf2327c5ec658cad:3">_n_</span><span data-offset-key="0350b8c3cf9e4f50bf2327c5ec658cad:4">) space, but still not the best solution.</span></span></span>

- <span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="f94df7d384f4400b9c9867fefe15cf1b"><span data-offset-key="f94df7d384f4400b9c9867fefe15cf1b:0">Could you devise a constant space solution?</span></span></span>

###

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH400-686c0942--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="7885f76777d94beaaf2f4282277e94ab"><span data-offset-key="7885f76777d94beaaf2f4282277e94ab:0">Solution:</span></span></span>

- <span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="0cf3c27b35f34c94a254e87861874606"><span data-offset-key="0cf3c27b35f34c94a254e87861874606:0">O(</span><span data-offset-key="0cf3c27b35f34c94a254e87861874606:1">_m\*\*n_</span><span data-offset-key="0cf3c27b35f34c94a254e87861874606:2">) space solution: Copy a new matrix.</span></span></span>

- <span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="729a08513a3d440b816efb4ef3c1579a"><span data-offset-key="729a08513a3d440b816efb4ef3c1579a:0">O(</span><span data-offset-key="729a08513a3d440b816efb4ef3c1579a:1">_m_</span><span data-offset-key="729a08513a3d440b816efb4ef3c1579a:2"> + </span><span data-offset-key="729a08513a3d440b816efb4ef3c1579a:3">_n_</span><span data-offset-key="729a08513a3d440b816efb4ef3c1579a:4">) space solution: Use extra arrays to store rows and columns that need to be set 0.</span></span></span>

- <span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="c5e263490d2343f89d9ff57ba34592f0"><span data-offset-key="c5e263490d2343f89d9ff57ba34592f0:0">Constant space solutions:</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="4d53acc853cf417abf30629823452012"><span data-offset-key="4d53acc853cf417abf30629823452012:0">**ONE**</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="548ece70be15433daa4ca54f240af087"><span data-offset-key="548ece70be15433daa4ca54f240af087:0">Instead of allocating extra arrays. Just use the first row and column.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="f449ac96efa443c483e5d5a25a4288e7"><span data-offset-key="f449ac96efa443c483e5d5a25a4288e7:0">First scan through the first row and column to see if they need be set 0. If so, mark and do it in the end.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="1f54f0f7e2734e6cb7c3519ffdef1cc7"><span data-offset-key="1f54f0f7e2734e6cb7c3519ffdef1cc7:0">Now scan the matrix and set 0 to the first row and column whenever a 0 is met.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="ec16cb9aee854bfb8e24f2055dfcb813"><span data-offset-key="ec16cb9aee854bfb8e24f2055dfcb813:0">Walk the matrix again and set 0 according to the first row and column.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="2146127d7e2342ce83af70a996c0a95e"><span data-offset-key="2146127d7e2342ce83af70a996c0a95e:0">Finally set the first row and column to 0 if needed.</span></span></span>

    /** * @param {number[][]} matrix * @return {void} Do not return anything, modify matrix in-place instead. */let setZeroes = function(matrix) {  const height = matrix.length  if (height <= 0) { return }  const width = matrix[0].length  if (width <= 0) { return }​  const shouldClearFirstRow = matrix[0].some(x => x === 0)  const shouldClearFirstCol = matrix.some(row => row[0] === 0)​  for (let i = 1; i < height; i++) {    for (let j = 1; j < width; j++) {      if (matrix[i][j] === 0) {        matrix[i][0] = 0        matrix[0][j] = 0      }    }  }​  for (let i = 1; i < height; i++) {    if (matrix[i][0] === 0) {      matrix[i].fill(0)    }  }​  for (let j = 1; j < width; j++) {    if (matrix[0][j] === 0) {      for (let i = 1; i < height; i++) {        matrix[i][j] = 0      }    }  }​  if (shouldClearFirstRow) {    matrix[0].fill(0)  }​  if (shouldClearFirstCol) {    for (let i = 0; i < height; i++) {      matrix[i][0] = 0    }  }};

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="346d4b249ada412ba5065797e31b6efe"><span data-offset-key="346d4b249ada412ba5065797e31b6efe:0">**TWO**</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="4bdee049f10845f79c10fcee07d2d53f"><span data-offset-key="4bdee049f10845f79c10fcee07d2d53f:0">Use </span><span data-offset-key="4bdee049f10845f79c10fcee07d2d53f:1">`NaN`</span><span data-offset-key="4bdee049f10845f79c10fcee07d2d53f:2"> to mark cells that need to be set 0.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="28b512ed99c541adae2ff0abe6594352"><span data-offset-key="28b512ed99c541adae2ff0abe6594352:0">Still constant space just a bit slower due to repeatedly setting overlapping </span><span data-offset-key="28b512ed99c541adae2ff0abe6594352:1">`NaN`</span><span data-offset-key="28b512ed99c541adae2ff0abe6594352:2">s.</span></span></span>

    /** * @param {number[][]} matrix * @return {void} Do not return anything, modify matrix in-place instead. */let setZeroes = function(matrix) {  const height = matrix.length  if (height <= 0) { return }  const width = matrix[0].length  if (width <= 0) { return }​  for (let i = 0; i < height; i++) {    for (let j = 0; j < width; j++) {      if (matrix[i][j] !== 0) { continue }​      for (let jj = 0; jj < width; jj++) {        if (matrix[i][jj] !== 0) {          matrix[i][jj] = NaN        }      }​      for (let ii = 0; ii < height; ii++) {        if (matrix[ii][j] !== 0) {          matrix[ii][j] = NaN        }      }    }  }​  for (let i = 0; i < height; i++) {    for (let j = 0; j < width; j++) {      if (isNaN(matrix[i][j])) {        matrix[i][j] = 0      }    }  }};

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="9d60ee56f6b245a09559bc34665a02e3"><span data-offset-key="9d60ee56f6b245a09559bc34665a02e3:0">_Template generated via_ </span></span><a href="https://github.com/crimx/crx-leetmark" class="link-a079aa82--primary-53a25e66--link-faf6c434"><span data-key="ecec2d0772f143ab97662d564b4cc4d6"><span data-offset-key="ecec2d0772f143ab97662d564b4cc4d6:0"><em>Leetmark</em></span></span></a><span data-key="91a9facc99d54ca6a3e7106072330a48"><span data-offset-key="91a9facc99d54ca6a3e7106072330a48:0">_._</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH600-23f228db--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="81bb18c063824da8b2d5ec47a876af88"><span data-offset-key="81bb18c063824da8b2d5ec47a876af88:0">Difficulty: Medium Related Topics: "Array": </span></span><a href="https://leetcode.com/tag/array" class="link-a079aa82--primary-53a25e66--link-faf6c434"><span data-key="f30a71352c82450c886d117644a01ced"><span data-offset-key="f30a71352c82450c886d117644a01ced:0">https://leetcode.com/tag/array</span></span></a><span data-key="c2b23faa12574bdbb0cb9e7b981b7cbe"><span data-offset-key="c2b23faa12574bdbb0cb9e7b981b7cbe:0"> "Binary Search": </span></span><a href="https://leetcode.com/tag/binary-search" class="link-a079aa82--primary-53a25e66--link-faf6c434"><span data-key="40b2b7bcddc74aff829573daa4f0fcc0"><span data-offset-key="40b2b7bcddc74aff829573daa4f0fcc0:0">https://leetcode.com/tag/binary-search</span></span></a><span data-key="2504b4a319384a388617fed68eeb488b"><span data-offset-key="2504b4a319384a388617fed68eeb488b:0"> Similar Questions: "Search a 2D Matrix II": </span></span><a href="https://leetcode.com/problems/search-a-2d-matrix-ii" class="link-a079aa82--primary-53a25e66--link-faf6c434"><span data-key="0e9136e592ea491694197a54eaf91f4a"><span data-offset-key="0e9136e592ea491694197a54eaf91f4a:0">https://leetcode.com/problems/search-a-2d-matrix-ii</span></span></a><span data-key="08965327475e4063a7d5fdb8e456de1e"><span data-offset-key="08965327475e4063a7d5fdb8e456de1e:0"><span data-slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH600-23f228db--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="e676a74124864358a2ceb9b6e75c36e9"><span data-offset-key="e676a74124864358a2ceb9b6e75c36e9:0"><span data-slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><a href="https://leetcode.com/problems/search-a-2d-matrix/description/" class="link-a079aa82--primary-53a25e66--link-faf6c434"><span data-key="2dce5f1c50d5492a882da8dcc0b6b7e1"><span data-offset-key="2dce5f1c50d5492a882da8dcc0b6b7e1:0">74. Search a 2D Matrix</span></span></a><span data-key="37da3bfb9fa648c799c1a7666b961b0e"><span data-offset-key="37da3bfb9fa648c799c1a7666b961b0e:0"><span data-slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span></span>

###

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH400-686c0942--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="468706bd413f456488b0b5b34bfde889"><span data-offset-key="468706bd413f456488b0b5b34bfde889:0">Problem:</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="c83498bacb594863ac59793b12ea96b6"><span data-offset-key="c83498bacb594863ac59793b12ea96b6:0">Write an efficient algorithm that searches for a value in an </span><span data-offset-key="c83498bacb594863ac59793b12ea96b6:1">_m_</span><span data-offset-key="c83498bacb594863ac59793b12ea96b6:2"> x </span><span data-offset-key="c83498bacb594863ac59793b12ea96b6:3">_n_</span><span data-offset-key="c83498bacb594863ac59793b12ea96b6:4"> matrix. This matrix has the following properties:</span></span></span>

- <span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="de8b8f8ecdc44056aa97ad1fda8316ae"><span data-offset-key="de8b8f8ecdc44056aa97ad1fda8316ae:0">Integers in each row are sorted from left to right.</span></span></span>

- <span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="6bcf065c7e474d079e66f6665c3142a9"><span data-offset-key="6bcf065c7e474d079e66f6665c3142a9:0">The first integer of each row is greater than the last integer of the previous row.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="b2698b53590145fbbe817ad1e554a0a5"><span data-offset-key="b2698b53590145fbbe817ad1e554a0a5:0">**Example 1:**</span></span></span>

    Input:matrix = [  [1,   3,  5,  7],  [10, 11, 16, 20],  [23, 30, 34, 50]]target = 3Output: true

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="55d9248ff766481cbba4618f8e6867cc"><span data-offset-key="55d9248ff766481cbba4618f8e6867cc:0">**Example 2:**</span></span></span>

    Input:matrix = [  [1,   3,  5,  7],  [10, 11, 16, 20],  [23, 30, 34, 50]]target = 13Output: false

###

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH400-686c0942--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="878647344f544145b6aed77866f86a47"><span data-offset-key="878647344f544145b6aed77866f86a47:0">Solution:</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="f0c4e49b8f884fc0aa7332b642510950"><span data-offset-key="f0c4e49b8f884fc0aa7332b642510950:0">**ONE**</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="f98456cb1322423d88284090255fdc42"><span data-offset-key="f98456cb1322423d88284090255fdc42:0">Search from top-left to bottom-right. O(</span><span data-offset-key="f98456cb1322423d88284090255fdc42:1">_n_</span><span data-offset-key="f98456cb1322423d88284090255fdc42:2">).</span></span></span>

    /** * @param {number[][]} matrix * @param {number} target * @return {boolean} */let searchMatrix = function(matrix, target) {  const height = matrix.length  if (height <= 0) { return false }  const width = matrix[0].length  if (width <= 0) { return false }​  let i = 0  let j = width - 1  while (i < height && j >= 0) {    const diff = matrix[i][j] - target    if (diff > 0) {      j--    } else if (diff < 0) {      i++    } else {      return true    }  }​  return false};

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="04d8519323fb4e68bcb9c9146b5cef99"><span data-offset-key="04d8519323fb4e68bcb9c9146b5cef99:0">**TWO**</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="ba33f0878370423186a27ff5cf0fe103"><span data-offset-key="ba33f0878370423186a27ff5cf0fe103:0">Binary search. O(log</span><span data-offset-key="ba33f0878370423186a27ff5cf0fe103:1">_n_</span><span data-offset-key="ba33f0878370423186a27ff5cf0fe103:2">).</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="8bcb66831a454450b2dd991665ad1a19"><span data-offset-key="8bcb66831a454450b2dd991665ad1a19:0">View the matrix as an sorted array that is cut into </span><span data-offset-key="8bcb66831a454450b2dd991665ad1a19:1">`n`</span><span data-offset-key="8bcb66831a454450b2dd991665ad1a19:2"> slices.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="4f1fcd6d247b409aaa78acea290b7b4f"><span data-offset-key="4f1fcd6d247b409aaa78acea290b7b4f:0">Take the algorithm from </span></span><a href="file:///C:/MY-WEB-DEV/06-DS-ALGO-OUTTER/06-DS-ALGO/main/CONTENT/DS-n-Algos/SANDBOX/035.%20Search%20Insert%20Position.md" class="link-a079aa82--primary-53a25e66--link-faf6c434"><span data-key="f4f74d96d5494bc8baa8ff1d2ac38cd5"><span data-offset-key="f4f74d96d5494bc8baa8ff1d2ac38cd5:0">35. Search Insert Position</span></span></a><span data-key="0ba4399390564bb49c9aa21eedf4f837"><span data-offset-key="0ba4399390564bb49c9aa21eedf4f837:0">.</span></span></span>

    /** * @param {number[][]} matrix * @param {number} target * @return {boolean} */let searchMatrix = function(matrix, target) {  const height = matrix.length  if (height <= 0) { return false }  const width = matrix[0].length  if (width <= 0) { return false }​  let s = 0  let e = width * height - 1  while (s <= e) {    const mid = Math.floor((s + e) / 2)    const diff = matrix[Math.floor(mid / width)][mid % width] - target    if (diff < 0) {      s = mid + 1    } else if (diff > 0) {      e = mid - 1    } else {      return true    }  }​  return false};

Sort Colors</span></span></a><span data-key="9687fa19959c4bb1baa2b4848c93e65e"><span data-offset-key="9687fa19959c4bb1baa2b4848c93e65e:0"><span data-slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span></span>

###

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH400-686c0942--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="be0bcda0edb54a7492f891b00d9b47fc"><span data-offset-key="be0bcda0edb54a7492f891b00d9b47fc:0">Problem:</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="dacb14d8bc1e4c6b8750f1aca260b9c2"><span data-offset-key="dacb14d8bc1e4c6b8750f1aca260b9c2:0">Given an array with </span><span data-offset-key="dacb14d8bc1e4c6b8750f1aca260b9c2:1">_n_</span><span data-offset-key="dacb14d8bc1e4c6b8750f1aca260b9c2:2"> objects colored red, white or blue, sort them </span><span data-offset-key="dacb14d8bc1e4c6b8750f1aca260b9c2:3">**in-place**</span><span data-offset-key="dacb14d8bc1e4c6b8750f1aca260b9c2:4">so that objects of the same color are adjacent, with the colors in the order red, white and blue.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="a19289033c994cb298f25269ec7d9929"><span data-offset-key="a19289033c994cb298f25269ec7d9929:0">Here, we will use the integers 0, 1, and 2 to represent the color red, white, and blue respectively.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="bbd07fa44d5c4ac1882ed12342faaeca"><span data-offset-key="bbd07fa44d5c4ac1882ed12342faaeca:0">**Note:**</span><span data-offset-key="bbd07fa44d5c4ac1882ed12342faaeca:1"> You are not suppose to use the library's sort function for this problem.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="8d64391a9449401c87eac6f5501fcc38"><span data-offset-key="8d64391a9449401c87eac6f5501fcc38:0">**Example:**</span></span></span>

    Input: [2,0,2,1,1,0]Output: [0,0,1,1,2,2]

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="38517c9c1cdb406995eb19d485554c0e"><span data-offset-key="38517c9c1cdb406995eb19d485554c0e:0">**Follow up:**</span></span></span>

- <span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="4688ffb576344c11944217892c0e42c0"><span data-offset-key="4688ffb576344c11944217892c0e42c0:0">A rather straight forward solution is a two-pass algorithm using counting sort. First, iterate the array counting number of 0's, 1's, and 2's, then overwrite array with total number of 0's, then 1's and followed by 2's.</span></span></span>

- <span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="d4435a0a21e4440992d07f14fe77fecd"><span data-offset-key="d4435a0a21e4440992d07f14fe77fecd:0">Could you come up with a one-pass algorithm using only constant space?</span></span></span>

###

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH400-686c0942--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="eefbd465eda14035ac528abc2ad330e0"><span data-offset-key="eefbd465eda14035ac528abc2ad330e0:0">Solution:</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="ba5a257875e3477fb5de412b0883fa23"><span data-offset-key="ba5a257875e3477fb5de412b0883fa23:0">One-pass algorithm.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="89d4cbc5733748ada84de2baf5bf06ce"><span data-offset-key="89d4cbc5733748ada84de2baf5bf06ce:0">Take the idea of the partition algorithm from quick sort. Use </span><span data-offset-key="89d4cbc5733748ada84de2baf5bf06ce:1">`1`</span><span data-offset-key="89d4cbc5733748ada84de2baf5bf06ce:2"> as pivot.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="14fc89b5863f4d04879aa297277ea1a5"><span data-offset-key="14fc89b5863f4d04879aa297277ea1a5:0">Count the number of sorted </span><span data-offset-key="14fc89b5863f4d04879aa297277ea1a5:1">`0`</span><span data-offset-key="14fc89b5863f4d04879aa297277ea1a5:2">s and </span><span data-offset-key="14fc89b5863f4d04879aa297277ea1a5:3">`2`</span><span data-offset-key="14fc89b5863f4d04879aa297277ea1a5:4">s so that we know where to swap.</span></span></span>

    /** * @param {number[]} nums * @return {void} Do not return anything, modify nums in-place instead. */let sortColors = function(nums) {  const len = nums.length  let zeroEnd = 0  let twoStart = len - 1  let i = 0  while (i <= twoStart) {    if (nums[i] === 0 && i !== zeroEnd) {      const t = nums[i]      nums[i] = nums[zeroEnd]      nums[zeroEnd] = t      zeroEnd++    } else if (nums[i] === 2 && i !== twoStart) {      const t = nums[i]      nums[i] = nums[twoStart]      nums[twoStart] = t      twoStart--    } else {      i++    }  }};

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="a8c3a6c14ff9448fb1e1936fd29be8a9"><span data-offset-key="a8c3a6c14ff9448fb1e1936fd29be8a9:0">_Template generated via_ </span></span><a href="https://github.com/crimx/crx-leetmark" class="link-a079aa82--primary-53a25e66--link-faf6c434"><span data-key="78314af7030f44dea2901ff44603f933"><span data-offset-key="78314af7030f44dea2901ff44603f933:0"><em>Leetmark</em></span></span></a><span data-key="563031821458403b8b4d0ba58c5bf9e1"><span data-offset-key="563031821458403b8b4d0ba58c5bf9e1:0">_._</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="3aa10a0bfaa24f45b1c8e77513671482"><span data-offset-key="3aa10a0bfaa24f45b1c8e77513671482:0">Given two integers </span><span data-offset-key="3aa10a0bfaa24f45b1c8e77513671482:1">_n_</span><span data-offset-key="3aa10a0bfaa24f45b1c8e77513671482:2"> and </span><span data-offset-key="3aa10a0bfaa24f45b1c8e77513671482:3">_k_</span><span data-offset-key="3aa10a0bfaa24f45b1c8e77513671482:4">, return all possible combinations of </span><span data-offset-key="3aa10a0bfaa24f45b1c8e77513671482:5">_k_</span><span data-offset-key="3aa10a0bfaa24f45b1c8e77513671482:6"> numbers out of 1 ... </span><span data-offset-key="3aa10a0bfaa24f45b1c8e77513671482:7">_n_</span><span data-offset-key="3aa10a0bfaa24f45b1c8e77513671482:8">.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="f6035f37ef9846e5aa5a944517f6f1a3"><span data-offset-key="f6035f37ef9846e5aa5a944517f6f1a3:0">**Example:**</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH400-686c0942--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="cd9381266adc46afb1825c5c9fed97fb"><span data-offset-key="cd9381266adc46afb1825c5c9fed97fb:0">Solution:</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="e58e4f7f6564460e86aef2c8861d0bcb"><span data-offset-key="e58e4f7f6564460e86aef2c8861d0bcb:0">Basic DFS + Backtracking.</span></span></span>

    /** * @param {number} n * @param {number} k * @return {number[][]} */let combine = function(n, k) {  const result = []  _combine(1, [], n, k, result)  return result};​function _combine (cur, path, n, k, result) {  if (path.length === k) {    return result.push(path.slice())  }​  while (cur <= n) {    path.push(cur)    _combine(++cur, path, n, k, result)    path.pop()  }}

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="125150bffc2741ac989d43224b8b4cd5"><span data-offset-key="125150bffc2741ac989d43224b8b4cd5:0">Given a set of </span><span data-offset-key="125150bffc2741ac989d43224b8b4cd5:1">**distinct**</span><span data-offset-key="125150bffc2741ac989d43224b8b4cd5:2"> integers, </span><span data-offset-key="125150bffc2741ac989d43224b8b4cd5:3">_nums_</span><span data-offset-key="125150bffc2741ac989d43224b8b4cd5:4">, return all possible subsets (the power set).</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="48b7ad132b35426bb8d7ef29e18355c4"><span data-offset-key="48b7ad132b35426bb8d7ef29e18355c4:0">**Note:**</span><span data-offset-key="48b7ad132b35426bb8d7ef29e18355c4:1"> The solution set must not contain duplicate subsets.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="7123615dbb7b4f13a4aeebd26767f1c2"><span data-offset-key="7123615dbb7b4f13a4aeebd26767f1c2:0">**Example:**</span></span></span>

    Input: nums = [1,2,3]Output:[  [3],  [1],  [2],  [1,2,3],  [1,3],  [2,3],  [1,2],  []]

###

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH400-686c0942--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="43869a54ed5640b8a66ae3bad2817956"><span data-offset-key="43869a54ed5640b8a66ae3bad2817956:0">Solution:</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="aefaee2123de4dc99c6a380a70d03b3b"><span data-offset-key="aefaee2123de4dc99c6a380a70d03b3b:0">**ONE**</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="0fa4881b5f514092bf9b1eeb0c08c594"><span data-offset-key="0fa4881b5f514092bf9b1eeb0c08c594:0">BFS.</span></span></span>

    /** * @param {number[]} nums * @return {number[][]} */let subsets = function(nums) {  return nums.reduce((result, num) => result.concat(result.map(r => [...r, num])), [[]])};

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="9ce2dc859b8046d98a0e62bc985659cb"><span data-offset-key="9ce2dc859b8046d98a0e62bc985659cb:0">Or more imperative. Loop backward to avoid crossing the boundary.</span></span></span>

    /** * @param {number[]} nums * @return {number[][]} */let subsets = function(nums) {  const result = [[]]  for (let i = nums.length - 1; i >= 0; i--) {    for (let j = result.length - 1; j >= 0; j--) {      result.push([nums[i], ...result[j]])    }  }  return result};

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="1c6ad964f78f47359c77ba56890b6349"><span data-offset-key="1c6ad964f78f47359c77ba56890b6349:0">**TWO**</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="5f1b665c809048d5a35251b427c2dc51"><span data-offset-key="5f1b665c809048d5a35251b427c2dc51:0">DFS + Backtracking.</span></span></span>

    /** * @param {number[]} nums * @return {number[][]} */let subsets = function(nums) {  const result = []  _subsets(nums, 0, [], result)  return result};​function _subsets(nums, start, path, result) {  result.push(path.slice())  while (start < nums.length) {    path.push(nums[start])    _subsets(nums, ++start, path, result)    path.pop()  }}

Word Search</span></span></a><span data-key="04f897dc40764bd4816d6c9afd5caeca"><span data-offset-key="04f897dc40764bd4816d6c9afd5caeca:0"><span data-slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH400-686c0942--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="9e4474d08f7148f4b6d1b86d3fda8b82"><span data-offset-key="9e4474d08f7148f4b6d1b86d3fda8b82:0">Problem:</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="26515fe2ef5e4747a78ef5039287239f"><span data-offset-key="26515fe2ef5e4747a78ef5039287239f:0">Given a 2D board and a word, find if the word exists in the grid.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="57d85f1d174b44ad8f948d54fe7ba593"><span data-offset-key="57d85f1d174b44ad8f948d54fe7ba593:0">The word can be constructed from letters of sequentially adjacent cell, where "adjacent" cells are those horizontally or vertically neighboring. The same letter cell may not be used more than once.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="4a5b9e6a061e4186be8e193e7471e9fe"><span data-offset-key="4a5b9e6a061e4186be8e193e7471e9fe:0">**Example:**</span></span></span>

    board =[  ['A','B','C','E'],  ['S','F','C','S'],  ['A','D','E','E']]​Given word = "ABCCED", return true.Given word = "SEE", return true.Given word = "ABCB", return false.

###

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH400-686c0942--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="16cbeb61faa14b038b735f9a801933bb"><span data-offset-key="16cbeb61faa14b038b735f9a801933bb:0">Solution:</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="cecba4de911e4b37b2fb69af59c1ecf0"><span data-offset-key="cecba4de911e4b37b2fb69af59c1ecf0:0">DFS + Backtracking. Replace the cell with </span><span data-offset-key="cecba4de911e4b37b2fb69af59c1ecf0:1">`NaN`</span><span data-offset-key="cecba4de911e4b37b2fb69af59c1ecf0:2"> before proceeding to the next level and restore when backtracking.</span></span></span>

    /** * @param {character[][]} board * @param {string} word * @return {boolean} */let exist = function(board, word) {  const height = board.length  if (height <= 0) { return false }  const width = board[0].length  if (width <= 0) { return false }​  for (let row = 0; row < height; row++) {    for (let col = 0; col < width; col++) {      if (board[row][col] === word[0] &&          _exist(board, word, 0, [[-1, 0], [1, 0], [0, -1], [0, 1]], row, col)      ) {        return true      }    }  }​  return false};​function _exist (board, word, iWord, directions, row, col) {  if (iWord === word.length) {    return true  }​  if (!board[row] || word[iWord] !== board[row][col]) {    return false  }​  const cell = board[row][col]  board[row][col] = NaN​  for (let i = directions.length - 1; i >= 0; i--) {    if (_exist(board, word, iWord+1, directions, row+directions[i][0], col+directions[i][1])) {      return true    }  }​  board[row][col] = cell​  return false}

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="71c373d5d80b433d95b11e2ae85699ec"><span data-offset-key="71c373d5d80b433d95b11e2ae85699ec:0">_Template generated via_ </span></span><a href="https://github.com/crimx/crx-leetmark" class="link-a079aa82--primary-53a25e66--link-faf6c434"><span data-key="0e0806fdfe094bf0a2b4716695783ad0"><span data-offset-key="0e0806fdfe094bf0a2b4716695783ad0:0"><em>Leetmark</em></span></span></a><span data-key="786cd36f499649568ddb7c09bfffad6d"><span data-offset-key="786cd36f499649568ddb7c09bfffad6d:0">_._</span></span></span>

Remove Duplicates from Sorted Array II</span></span></a><span data-key="2959db28827f4565b2692181faeec580"><span data-offset-key="2959db28827f4565b2692181faeec580:0"><span data-slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span></span>

###

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH400-686c0942--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="98dc7eb765f242aea9497c58216d4866"><span data-offset-key="98dc7eb765f242aea9497c58216d4866:0">Problem:</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="0ccfdffccc8b42818df95742003338a2"><span data-offset-key="0ccfdffccc8b42818df95742003338a2:0">Given a sorted array </span><span data-offset-key="0ccfdffccc8b42818df95742003338a2:1">_nums_</span><span data-offset-key="0ccfdffccc8b42818df95742003338a2:2">, remove the duplicates </span></span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/In-place_algorithm" class="link-a079aa82--primary-53a25e66--link-faf6c434"><span data-key="6d08106fb35a4613870b1a43726ba029"><span data-offset-key="6d08106fb35a4613870b1a43726ba029:0"><strong>in-place</strong></span></span></a><span data-key="2324100b17e147dbad1cdc126fc778f2"><span data-offset-key="2324100b17e147dbad1cdc126fc778f2:0"> such that duplicates appeared at most </span><span data-offset-key="2324100b17e147dbad1cdc126fc778f2:1">_twice_</span><span data-offset-key="2324100b17e147dbad1cdc126fc778f2:2"> and return the new length.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="f998296fef944892a83b1f6fa17ebd64"><span data-offset-key="f998296fef944892a83b1f6fa17ebd64:0">Do not allocate extra space for another array, you must do this by </span><span data-offset-key="f998296fef944892a83b1f6fa17ebd64:1">**modifying the input array in-place**</span><span data-offset-key="f998296fef944892a83b1f6fa17ebd64:2"> with O(1) extra memory.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="0b4e03596c9a4d2cbe5e0829c1b71cce"><span data-offset-key="0b4e03596c9a4d2cbe5e0829c1b71cce:0">**Example 1:**</span></span></span>

    Given nums = [1,1,1,2,2,3],​Your function should return length = 5, with the first five elements of nums being 1, 1, 2, 2 and 3 respectively.​It doesn't matter what you leave beyond the returned length.

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="552989949f7244be86c53b3a8df66a7a"><span data-offset-key="552989949f7244be86c53b3a8df66a7a:0">**Example 2:**</span></span></span>

    Given nums = [0,0,1,1,1,1,2,3,3],​Your function should return length = 7, with the first seven elements of nums being modified to 0, 0, 1, 1, 2, 3 and 3 respectively.​It doesn't matter what values are set beyond the returned length.

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="11fd1a31f0174c4cac1486c9bb76c1c8"><span data-offset-key="11fd1a31f0174c4cac1486c9bb76c1c8:0">**Clarification:**</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="fa870f9de3bd49f0bc9c4463e9ca6952"><span data-offset-key="fa870f9de3bd49f0bc9c4463e9ca6952:0">Confused why the returned value is an integer but your answer is an array?</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="3de098b834604f1c899e27e2ad27ee5f"><span data-offset-key="3de098b834604f1c899e27e2ad27ee5f:0">Note that the input array is passed in by </span><span data-offset-key="3de098b834604f1c899e27e2ad27ee5f:1">**reference**</span><span data-offset-key="3de098b834604f1c899e27e2ad27ee5f:2">, which means modification to the input array will be known to the caller as well.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="2e3f4a4a8ead49848dec3c1d5a92264e"><span data-offset-key="2e3f4a4a8ead49848dec3c1d5a92264e:0">Internally you can think of this:</span></span></span>

    // nums is passed in by reference. (i.e., without making a copy)int len = removeDuplicates(nums);​// any modification to nums in your function would be known by the caller.// using the length returned by your function, it prints the first len elements.for (int i = 0; i < len; i++) {    print(nums[i]);}

###

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH400-686c0942--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="a7230a27cd8d4ce59e2a98d0df541761"><span data-offset-key="a7230a27cd8d4ce59e2a98d0df541761:0">Solution:</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="62c709437bb844288960456609a29abb"><span data-offset-key="62c709437bb844288960456609a29abb:0">Similar to </span></span><a href="file:///C:/MY-WEB-DEV/06-DS-ALGO-OUTTER/06-DS-ALGO/main/CONTENT/DS-n-Algos/SANDBOX/026.%20Remove%20Duplicates%20from%20Sorted%20Array.md" class="link-a079aa82--primary-53a25e66--link-faf6c434"><span data-key="ca6cc2ccb473488f93c1b637276c0dc0"><span data-offset-key="ca6cc2ccb473488f93c1b637276c0dc0:0">26. Remove Duplicates from Sorted Array</span></span></a><span data-key="2f0ce22d14634f439c11ea263dba03d8"><span data-offset-key="2f0ce22d14634f439c11ea263dba03d8:0">.</span></span></span>

    /** * @param {number[]} nums * @return {number} */let removeDuplicates = function(nums) {  let len = 0  for (let i = 0; i < nums.length; i++) {    if (nums[i] !== nums[len-2]) {      nums[len++] = nums[i]    }  }  return len};

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="92e883c2af064c04b51dcc4f2aafa283"><span data-offset-key="92e883c2af064c04b51dcc4f2aafa283:0">_Template generated via_ </span></span><a href="https://github.com/crimx/crx-leetmark" class="link-a079aa82--primary-53a25e66--link-faf6c434"><span data-key="674fde89c2e54325bae7543d7c3e1d5e"><span data-offset-key="674fde89c2e54325bae7543d7c3e1d5e:0"><em>Leetmark</em></span></span></a><span data-key="ee776a14b73b4e8f86a26e13ed2b112c"><span data-offset-key="ee776a14b73b4e8f86a26e13ed2b112c:0">_._</span></span></span>

Search in Rotated Sorted Array II</span></span></a><span data-key="0322e95f20b54ba1bc93fe3a9cc41a31"><span data-offset-key="0322e95f20b54ba1bc93fe3a9cc41a31:0"><span data-slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span></span>

###

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH400-686c0942--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="bbbaa82946f94fe0a7bb4774ead7acc1"><span data-offset-key="bbbaa82946f94fe0a7bb4774ead7acc1:0">Problem:</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="93b71b88b8bd4dc2954b0e90a22bed21"><span data-offset-key="93b71b88b8bd4dc2954b0e90a22bed21:0">Suppose an array sorted in ascending order is rotated at some pivot unknown to you beforehand.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="9392ad641ece48249e3afd8132b94aa5"><span data-offset-key="9392ad641ece48249e3afd8132b94aa5:0">(i.e., </span><span data-offset-key="9392ad641ece48249e3afd8132b94aa5:1">`[0,0,1,2,2,5,6]`</span><span data-offset-key="9392ad641ece48249e3afd8132b94aa5:2"> might become </span><span data-offset-key="9392ad641ece48249e3afd8132b94aa5:3">`[2,5,6,0,0,1,2]`</span><span data-offset-key="9392ad641ece48249e3afd8132b94aa5:4">).</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="c012679bc0264a99961ce9626f2a2878"><span data-offset-key="c012679bc0264a99961ce9626f2a2878:0">You are given a target value to search. If found in the array return </span><span data-offset-key="c012679bc0264a99961ce9626f2a2878:1">`true`</span><span data-offset-key="c012679bc0264a99961ce9626f2a2878:2">, otherwise return </span><span data-offset-key="c012679bc0264a99961ce9626f2a2878:3">`false`</span><span data-offset-key="c012679bc0264a99961ce9626f2a2878:4">.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="a0919c27cfa7400aa6f7bd09d167d0ae"><span data-offset-key="a0919c27cfa7400aa6f7bd09d167d0ae:0">**Example 1:**</span></span></span>

    Input: nums = [2,5,6,0,0,1,2], target = 0Output: true

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="9400c84908364b3c9a5609d1b904f32c"><span data-offset-key="9400c84908364b3c9a5609d1b904f32c:0">**Example 2:**</span></span></span>

    Input: nums = [2,5,6,0,0,1,2], target = 3Output: false

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="ba9456d288694d0e936ffb822846cdce"><span data-offset-key="ba9456d288694d0e936ffb822846cdce:0">**Follow up:**</span></span></span>

- <span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="3a8c87192041439ba61f0a8640957d60"><span data-offset-key="3a8c87192041439ba61f0a8640957d60:0">This is a follow up problem to </span></span><a href="https://leetcode.com/problems/search-in-rotated-sorted-array/description/" class="link-a079aa82--primary-53a25e66--link-faf6c434"><span data-key="6c6a96968f114506864af08864bbb125"><span data-offset-key="6c6a96968f114506864af08864bbb125:0">Search in Rotated Sorted Array</span></span></a><span data-key="bed8666b8231475bad48a513f3a8d3ce"><span data-offset-key="bed8666b8231475bad48a513f3a8d3ce:0">, where </span><span data-offset-key="bed8666b8231475bad48a513f3a8d3ce:1">`nums`</span><span data-offset-key="bed8666b8231475bad48a513f3a8d3ce:2"> may contain duplicates.</span></span></span>

- <span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="ca20bce65e1d4564a5d484bc0ba823bb"><span data-offset-key="ca20bce65e1d4564a5d484bc0ba823bb:0">Would this affect the run-time complexity? How and why?</span></span></span>

###

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH400-686c0942--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="8880f20fa9d54084a222e43fd5972a7a"><span data-offset-key="8880f20fa9d54084a222e43fd5972a7a:0">Solution:</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="53fd5d58bd954311bd511c61ef7c3aff"><span data-offset-key="53fd5d58bd954311bd511c61ef7c3aff:0">See </span></span><a href="file:///C:/MY-WEB-DEV/06-DS-ALGO-OUTTER/06-DS-ALGO/main/CONTENT/DS-n-Algos/SANDBOX/033.%20Search%20in%20Rotated%20Sorted%20Array.md" class="link-a079aa82--primary-53a25e66--link-faf6c434"><span data-key="c5e4dd00d02f40179007f61f380fa490"><span data-offset-key="c5e4dd00d02f40179007f61f380fa490:0">33. Search in Rotated Sorted Array</span></span></a><span data-key="9d8e8ce189094279a2985011a65640a3"><span data-offset-key="9d8e8ce189094279a2985011a65640a3:0">. The code is basically the same. Except with duplicates we can not tell which way to jump when </span><span data-offset-key="9d8e8ce189094279a2985011a65640a3:1">`pivot == nums[e]`</span><span data-offset-key="9d8e8ce189094279a2985011a65640a3:2">. The only thing we can do is to ditch </span><span data-offset-key="9d8e8ce189094279a2985011a65640a3:3">`nums[e]`</span><span data-offset-key="9d8e8ce189094279a2985011a65640a3:4">. SO worst case </span><span data-offset-key="9d8e8ce189094279a2985011a65640a3:5">`O(*n*)`</span><span data-offset-key="9d8e8ce189094279a2985011a65640a3:6">.</span></span></span>

    /** * @param {number[]} nums * @param {number} target * @return {boolean} */let search = function(nums, target) {  let s = 0  let e = nums.length - 1​  while (s <= e) {    const p = (e + s) / 2 | 0    const pivot = nums[p]​    if (target === pivot) {      return true    }​    if (pivot < nums[e]) {      if (target > nums[p] && target <= nums[e]) {        s = p + 1      } else {        e = p - 1      }    } else if (pivot > nums[e]) {      if (target < nums[p] && target >= nums[s]) {        e = p - 1      } else {        s = p + 1      }    } else {      e--    }  }​  return false};

Remove Duplicates from Sorted List II</span></span></a><span data-key="5b5ba4ed1a484dbcbff3536e6ccc3ed2"><span data-offset-key="5b5ba4ed1a484dbcbff3536e6ccc3ed2:0"><span data-slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH400-686c0942--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="7a1c1dc6675841a482669a80dff786d7"><span data-offset-key="7a1c1dc6675841a482669a80dff786d7:0">Problem:</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="9c888e112c1345b1915af9596dfe6f42"><span data-offset-key="9c888e112c1345b1915af9596dfe6f42:0">Given a sorted linked list, delete all nodes that have duplicate numbers, leaving only </span><span data-offset-key="9c888e112c1345b1915af9596dfe6f42:1">_distinct_</span><span data-offset-key="9c888e112c1345b1915af9596dfe6f42:2"> numbers from the original list.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="dbc7bc192f834bf3b545254ae5c2c560"><span data-offset-key="dbc7bc192f834bf3b545254ae5c2c560:0">**Example 1:**</span></span></span>

    Input: 1->2->3->3->4->4->5Output: 1->2->5

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="2d62728c12ed4a1a8d961ebccddca7d3"><span data-offset-key="2d62728c12ed4a1a8d961ebccddca7d3:0">**Example 2:**</span></span></span>

    Input: 1->1->1->2->3Output: 2->3

###

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH400-686c0942--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="589259f3963b49bfb19c4f09f1ae31b5"><span data-offset-key="589259f3963b49bfb19c4f09f1ae31b5:0">Solution:</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="3bbbf7b2f7234e2798401e8ce747ae0a"><span data-offset-key="3bbbf7b2f7234e2798401e8ce747ae0a:0">`p1`</span><span data-offset-key="3bbbf7b2f7234e2798401e8ce747ae0a:1"> points to the current node. </span><span data-offset-key="3bbbf7b2f7234e2798401e8ce747ae0a:2">`p`</span><span data-offset-key="3bbbf7b2f7234e2798401e8ce747ae0a:3"> points to the node before </span><span data-offset-key="3bbbf7b2f7234e2798401e8ce747ae0a:4">`p1`</span><span data-offset-key="3bbbf7b2f7234e2798401e8ce747ae0a:5"> so that we can ditch </span><span data-offset-key="3bbbf7b2f7234e2798401e8ce747ae0a:6">`p1`</span><span data-offset-key="3bbbf7b2f7234e2798401e8ce747ae0a:7"> if needed.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="421fec97faee4070aa4b857e56ebea37"><span data-offset-key="421fec97faee4070aa4b857e56ebea37:0">The list is sorted so we only need </span><span data-offset-key="421fec97faee4070aa4b857e56ebea37:1">`dupVal`</span><span data-offset-key="421fec97faee4070aa4b857e56ebea37:2"> to keep the latest duplicate value.</span></span></span>

    /** * Definition for singly-linked list. * function ListNode(val) { *     this.val = val; *     this.next = null; * } *//** * @param {ListNode} head * @return {ListNode} */let deleteDuplicates = function(head) {  if (!head) { return null }  const prehead = { next: head }​  let p = prehead  let dupVal = NaN​  for (let p1 = head; p1; p1 = p1.next) {    if (p1.val === dupVal) {      p.next = p1.next    } else if (p1.next && p1.val === p1.next.val) {      p.next = p1.next      dupVal = p1.val    } else {      p = p1    }  }​  return prehead.next};

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="a18f8facc34f420097d8c1c3c3be3694"><span data-offset-key="a18f8facc34f420097d8c1c3c3be3694:0">_Template generated via_ </span></span><a href="https://github.com/crimx/crx-leetmark" class="link-a079aa82--primary-53a25e66--link-faf6c434"><span data-key="4d71ebc5296546d3bba8981cb0f40d35"><span data-offset-key="4d71ebc5296546d3bba8981cb0f40d35:0"><em>Leetmark</em></span></span></a><span data-key="ce7773cd563e4df8b182af269839fba0"><span data-offset-key="ce7773cd563e4df8b182af269839fba0:0">_._</span></span></span>

Remove Duplicates from Sorted List</span></span></a><span data-key="2b4292743bd2433d81dfecb0884d9681"><span data-offset-key="2b4292743bd2433d81dfecb0884d9681:0"><span data-slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH400-686c0942--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="105029afdfe546d4a34f5a08cabea678"><span data-offset-key="105029afdfe546d4a34f5a08cabea678:0">Problem:</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="05a9c769718c4bbc9b7944e43261906b"><span data-offset-key="05a9c769718c4bbc9b7944e43261906b:0">Given a sorted linked list, delete all duplicates such that each element appear only </span><span data-offset-key="05a9c769718c4bbc9b7944e43261906b:1">_once_</span><span data-offset-key="05a9c769718c4bbc9b7944e43261906b:2">.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="1ed9279208964e7f98061b6b2cfcf1da"><span data-offset-key="1ed9279208964e7f98061b6b2cfcf1da:0">**Example 1:**</span></span></span>

    Input: 1->1->2Output: 1->2

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="e6b5bf52f7f149aa99437de26ae7c2c3"><span data-offset-key="e6b5bf52f7f149aa99437de26ae7c2c3:0">**Example 2:**</span></span></span>

    Input: 1->1->2->3->3Output: 1->2->3

###

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH400-686c0942--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="d2bc5eb97a7543f9a5fc5dc15716c128"><span data-offset-key="d2bc5eb97a7543f9a5fc5dc15716c128:0">Solution:</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="1f18cd64488545cba9375f2dfa845c10"><span data-offset-key="1f18cd64488545cba9375f2dfa845c10:0">**ONE**</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="67d335136994475cae02c15e05b69681"><span data-offset-key="67d335136994475cae02c15e05b69681:0">Just like </span></span><a href="file:///C:/MY-WEB-DEV/06-DS-ALGO-OUTTER/06-DS-ALGO/main/CONTENT/DS-n-Algos/SANDBOX/082.%20Remove%20Duplicates%20from%20Sorted%20List%20II.md" class="link-a079aa82--primary-53a25e66--link-faf6c434"><span data-key="d0d523e59f1645d0b4098b5261a11196"><span data-offset-key="d0d523e59f1645d0b4098b5261a11196:0">82. Remove Duplicates from Sorted List II</span></span></a><span data-key="573ef0865fe241289a8f38d46e181c43"><span data-offset-key="573ef0865fe241289a8f38d46e181c43:0"> except keeping the first duplicate node.</span></span></span>

    /** * Definition for singly-linked list. * function ListNode(val) { *     this.val = val; *     this.next = null; * } *//** * @param {ListNode} head * @return {ListNode} */let deleteDuplicates = function(head) {  if (!head) { return null }  const prehead = { next: head }​  let p = prehead  let dupVal = NaN​  for (let p1 = head; p1; p1 = p1.next) {    if (p1.val === dupVal) {      p.next = p1.next    } else {      if (p1.next && p1.val === p1.next.val) {        dupVal = p1.val      }      p = p1    }  }​  return prehead.next};

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="97b2b5c5b0f24576acedf820bdbf7881"><span data-offset-key="97b2b5c5b0f24576acedf820bdbf7881:0">**TWO**</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="1ba4fc2ff53f43a1a4ebaf9353b7db9a"><span data-offset-key="1ba4fc2ff53f43a1a4ebaf9353b7db9a:0">Just compare the next node. This is way more faster.</span></span></span>

    /** * Definition for singly-linked list. * function ListNode(val) { *     this.val = val; *     this.next = null; * } *//** * @param {ListNode} head * @return {ListNode} */let deleteDuplicates = function(head) {  if (!head) { return null }​  let p = head  while (p) {    if (p.next && p.val === p.next.val) {      p.next = p.next.next    } else {      p = p.next    }  }​  return head};

###

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH400-686c0942--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="80ec6f6d36364e14b0bc705abc9f6920"><span data-offset-key="80ec6f6d36364e14b0bc705abc9f6920:0">Solution:</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="21d3aab88f984a2fa06f0815fce4fca7"><span data-offset-key="21d3aab88f984a2fa06f0815fce4fca7:0">The height of a rectangle is determined by the lowest bar inside of it. So the core idea is, for each bar, assume it is the lowest bar and see how far it can expand. Then we have </span><span data-offset-key="21d3aab88f984a2fa06f0815fce4fca7:1">`len(heights)`</span><span data-offset-key="21d3aab88f984a2fa06f0815fce4fca7:2"> rectangles. Return the max area.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="e17d03011f824931a193034c5939585f"><span data-offset-key="e17d03011f824931a193034c5939585f:0">For a bar </span><span data-offset-key="e17d03011f824931a193034c5939585f:1">`b`</span><span data-offset-key="e17d03011f824931a193034c5939585f:2"> whose height is </span><span data-offset-key="e17d03011f824931a193034c5939585f:3">`h`</span><span data-offset-key="e17d03011f824931a193034c5939585f:4">, find the closest bar </span><span data-offset-key="e17d03011f824931a193034c5939585f:5">`b1`</span><span data-offset-key="e17d03011f824931a193034c5939585f:6"> on the left that is lower than </span><span data-offset-key="e17d03011f824931a193034c5939585f:7">`h`</span><span data-offset-key="e17d03011f824931a193034c5939585f:8">, and </span><span data-offset-key="e17d03011f824931a193034c5939585f:9">`b2`</span><span data-offset-key="e17d03011f824931a193034c5939585f:10"> on the right. The area of the rectangle is </span><span data-offset-key="e17d03011f824931a193034c5939585f:11">`h * (i2 - i1 - 1)`</span><span data-offset-key="e17d03011f824931a193034c5939585f:12">.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="7cf6fd08586f4a7c8646f27fd977baf9"><span data-offset-key="7cf6fd08586f4a7c8646f27fd977baf9:0">Notice that if we just loop the bars from left to right, </span><span data-offset-key="7cf6fd08586f4a7c8646f27fd977baf9:1">`b1`</span><span data-offset-key="7cf6fd08586f4a7c8646f27fd977baf9:2"> and </span><span data-offset-key="7cf6fd08586f4a7c8646f27fd977baf9:3">`b2`</span><span data-offset-key="7cf6fd08586f4a7c8646f27fd977baf9:4"> of each bar may overlap.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="9a00915a3ed142c488c7bc8be2422f27"><span data-offset-key="9a00915a3ed142c488c7bc8be2422f27:0">Observe how </span><span data-offset-key="9a00915a3ed142c488c7bc8be2422f27:1">`i1`</span><span data-offset-key="9a00915a3ed142c488c7bc8be2422f27:2"> and </span><span data-offset-key="9a00915a3ed142c488c7bc8be2422f27:3">`i2`</span><span data-offset-key="9a00915a3ed142c488c7bc8be2422f27:4"> changes depending on the height.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="4aa576017403423f9b65066ba4af51c0"><span data-offset-key="4aa576017403423f9b65066ba4af51c0:0">To reduce O(</span><span data-offset-key="4aa576017403423f9b65066ba4af51c0:1">_n^2_</span><span data-offset-key="4aa576017403423f9b65066ba4af51c0:2">) to O(</span><span data-offset-key="4aa576017403423f9b65066ba4af51c0:3">_n_</span><span data-offset-key="4aa576017403423f9b65066ba4af51c0:4">), we use a stack to store incremental </span><span data-offset-key="4aa576017403423f9b65066ba4af51c0:5">`b`</span><span data-offset-key="4aa576017403423f9b65066ba4af51c0:6">s. Because </span><span data-offset-key="4aa576017403423f9b65066ba4af51c0:7">`b1`</span><span data-offset-key="4aa576017403423f9b65066ba4af51c0:8"> and </span><span data-offset-key="4aa576017403423f9b65066ba4af51c0:9">`b2`</span><span data-offset-key="4aa576017403423f9b65066ba4af51c0:10"> are both lower than </span><span data-offset-key="4aa576017403423f9b65066ba4af51c0:11">`b`</span><span data-offset-key="4aa576017403423f9b65066ba4af51c0:12">, whenever we reach a bar that is lower than the top of the stack, we know it's a </span><span data-offset-key="4aa576017403423f9b65066ba4af51c0:13">`b2`</span><span data-offset-key="4aa576017403423f9b65066ba4af51c0:14">. So stack top is a </span><span data-offset-key="4aa576017403423f9b65066ba4af51c0:15">`b`</span><span data-offset-key="4aa576017403423f9b65066ba4af51c0:16">. Second top is a </span><span data-offset-key="4aa576017403423f9b65066ba4af51c0:17">`b1`</span><span data-offset-key="4aa576017403423f9b65066ba4af51c0:18">. Keep popping the </span><span data-offset-key="4aa576017403423f9b65066ba4af51c0:19">`b`</span><span data-offset-key="4aa576017403423f9b65066ba4af51c0:20"> to calculate areas until </span><span data-offset-key="4aa576017403423f9b65066ba4af51c0:21">`b2`</span><span data-offset-key="4aa576017403423f9b65066ba4af51c0:22"> is no longer lower than stack top.</span></span></span>

    /** * @param {number[]} heights * @return {number} */let largestRectangleArea = function(heights) {  const stack = [-1]  let max = 0  for (let i2 = 0; i2 <= heights.length; i2++) {    while ((heights[i2] || 0) < heights[stack[stack.length-1]]) {      const i = stack.pop()      const i1 = stack[stack.length-1]      max = Math.max(max, heights[i] * (i2 - i1 - 1))    }    stack.push(i2)  }  return max};​
