Populating Next Right Pointers in Each Node</span></span></a><span data-key="7cd038e9ed4a448f9b5846e1386abd7b"><span data-offset-key="7cd038e9ed4a448f9b5846e1386abd7b:0"><span data-slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span></span>

###

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH400-686c0942--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="71841da2edf84c4e93c479b6aafb14d4"><span data-offset-key="71841da2edf84c4e93c479b6aafb14d4:0">Problem:</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="867627ee814a46478b08828b93b9659e"><span data-offset-key="867627ee814a46478b08828b93b9659e:0">Given a binary tree</span></span></span>

    struct TreeLinkNode {  TreeLinkNode *left;  TreeLinkNode *right;  TreeLinkNode *next;}​

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="dac7e45211874e5f9bd8dc942d47692a"><span data-offset-key="dac7e45211874e5f9bd8dc942d47692a:0">Populate each next pointer to point to its next right node. If there is no next right node, the next pointer should be set to </span><span data-offset-key="dac7e45211874e5f9bd8dc942d47692a:1">`NULL`</span><span data-offset-key="dac7e45211874e5f9bd8dc942d47692a:2">.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="9223be5ba6b2445b81abe9b3dfe01f92"><span data-offset-key="9223be5ba6b2445b81abe9b3dfe01f92:0">Initially, all next pointers are set to </span><span data-offset-key="9223be5ba6b2445b81abe9b3dfe01f92:1">`NULL`</span><span data-offset-key="9223be5ba6b2445b81abe9b3dfe01f92:2">.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="57b88702db07472099d09d67df3264a7"><span data-offset-key="57b88702db07472099d09d67df3264a7:0">**Note:**</span></span></span>

- <span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="440f42214ad046fa93ae0f8ba8ae1c50"><span data-offset-key="440f42214ad046fa93ae0f8ba8ae1c50:0">You may only use constant extra space.</span></span></span>

- <span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="09e9f02979144d1795d08b90d2f4f8d1"><span data-offset-key="09e9f02979144d1795d08b90d2f4f8d1:0">Recursive approach is fine, implicit stack space does not count as extra space for this problem.</span></span></span>

- <span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="c30bb507dc3843c7bbda2ea78d3cde84"><span data-offset-key="c30bb507dc3843c7bbda2ea78d3cde84:0">You may assume that it is a perfect binary tree (ie, all leaves are at the same level, and every parent has two children).</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="b30a8b9c396143aa9b6bd24b34d3bce4"><span data-offset-key="b30a8b9c396143aa9b6bd24b34d3bce4:0">**Example:**</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="3d70e7e0381d4f8089b5b4b51ae42c1a"><span data-offset-key="3d70e7e0381d4f8089b5b4b51ae42c1a:0">Given the following perfect binary tree,</span></span></span>

         1   /  \  2    3 / \  / \4  5  6  7​

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="26f8a7977f444bb3841e44148229c550"><span data-offset-key="26f8a7977f444bb3841e44148229c550:0">After calling your function, the tree should look like:</span></span></span>

         1 -> NULL   /  \  2 -> 3 -> NULL / \  / \4->5->6->7 -> NULL​

###

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH400-686c0942--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="789fe0056a3a47219d9b8135895829f2"><span data-offset-key="789fe0056a3a47219d9b8135895829f2:0">Solution:</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="512c3f07d61c42faa3d9ed15b87462e1"><span data-offset-key="512c3f07d61c42faa3d9ed15b87462e1:0">**ONE**</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="ebeb5398b95646f2b53236227bb157fd"><span data-offset-key="ebeb5398b95646f2b53236227bb157fd:0">Recursive.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="bf77fd93f1674b119b95f129d7a4bf91"><span data-offset-key="bf77fd93f1674b119b95f129d7a4bf91:0">For every </span><span data-offset-key="bf77fd93f1674b119b95f129d7a4bf91:1">`node`</span><span data-offset-key="bf77fd93f1674b119b95f129d7a4bf91:2">:</span></span></span>

- <span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="81a41c2d665d4d6dade79ad0dc2828ea"><span data-offset-key="81a41c2d665d4d6dade79ad0dc2828ea:0">Left child: points to </span><span data-offset-key="81a41c2d665d4d6dade79ad0dc2828ea:1">`node.right`</span><span data-offset-key="81a41c2d665d4d6dade79ad0dc2828ea:2">.</span></span></span>

- <span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="cced1199b726434cba274989d8ce1546"><span data-offset-key="cced1199b726434cba274989d8ce1546:0">Right child: points to </span><span data-offset-key="cced1199b726434cba274989d8ce1546:1">`node.next.left`</span><span data-offset-key="cced1199b726434cba274989d8ce1546:2"> if </span><span data-offset-key="cced1199b726434cba274989d8ce1546:3">`node.next`</span><span data-offset-key="cced1199b726434cba274989d8ce1546:4"> exists.</span></span></span>

  /** _ Definition for binary tree with next pointer. _ function TreeLinkNode(val) { _ this.val = val; _ this.left = this.right = this.next = null; _ } _/​/** _ @param {TreeLinkNode} root _ @return {void} Do not return anything, modify tree in-place instead. \*/let connect = function(root) { if (!root) { return } if (root.left !== null) { root.left.next = root.right connect(root.left) } if (root.right !== null) { if (root.next !== null) { root.right.next = root.next.left } connect(root.right) }};

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="e2b1b9f691104f239c3b01bf831d22d5"><span data-offset-key="e2b1b9f691104f239c3b01bf831d22d5:0">**TWO**</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="648a9633061344b38f6c1712cafc8e07"><span data-offset-key="648a9633061344b38f6c1712cafc8e07:0">Level order traversal.</span></span></span>

    /** * Definition for binary tree with next pointer. * function TreeLinkNode(val) { *     this.val = val; *     this.left = this.right = this.next = null; * } */​/** * @param {TreeLinkNode} root * @return {void} Do not return anything, modify tree in-place instead. */let connect = function(root) {  if (!root) { return }​  const queue = [NaN, root]  while (queue.length > 1) {    const node = queue.shift()    if (node !== node) {      for (let i = 0; i < queue.length; i++) {        queue[i].next = queue[i+1] || null      }      queue.push(NaN)    } else {      if (node.left !== null) { queue.push(node.left) }      if (node.right !== null) { queue.push(node.right) }    }  }};

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="fd0170c8749649048dd903fb191fb01c"><span data-offset-key="fd0170c8749649048dd903fb191fb01c:0">_Template generated via_ </span></span><a href="https://github.com/crimx/crx-leetmark" class="link-a079aa82--primary-53a25e66--link-faf6c434"><span data-key="d0f549a5022c461f8e5c685d1701adc3"><span data-offset-key="d0f549a5022c461f8e5c685d1701adc3:0"><em>Leetmark</em></span></span></a><span data-key="94e9568f27f746e6905c188c5d967f2b"><span data-offset-key="94e9568f27f746e6905c188c5d967f2b:0">_._</span></span></span>

Populating Next Right Pointers in Each Node II</span></span></a><span data-key="7232be8a4cce4b45be630ac914260f09"><span data-offset-key="7232be8a4cce4b45be630ac914260f09:0"><span data-slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH400-686c0942--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="06b80a9b34c64abd8c529ece0f4c6e35"><span data-offset-key="06b80a9b34c64abd8c529ece0f4c6e35:0">Problem:</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="e87e0debc28d4d87bd597d8e0d3d91cd"><span data-offset-key="e87e0debc28d4d87bd597d8e0d3d91cd:0">Given a binary tree</span></span></span>

    struct TreeLinkNode {  TreeLinkNode *left;  TreeLinkNode *right;  TreeLinkNode *next;}​

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="75ee5960e30a4defa76a103cc9bcf0a9"><span data-offset-key="75ee5960e30a4defa76a103cc9bcf0a9:0">Populate each next pointer to point to its next right node. If there is no next right node, the next pointer should be set to </span><span data-offset-key="75ee5960e30a4defa76a103cc9bcf0a9:1">`NULL`</span><span data-offset-key="75ee5960e30a4defa76a103cc9bcf0a9:2">.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="35a0c93533b14ec4be7bc9c4baa9910c"><span data-offset-key="35a0c93533b14ec4be7bc9c4baa9910c:0">Initially, all next pointers are set to </span><span data-offset-key="35a0c93533b14ec4be7bc9c4baa9910c:1">`NULL`</span><span data-offset-key="35a0c93533b14ec4be7bc9c4baa9910c:2">.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="4798e9315e7440b19ac5016126328e5e"><span data-offset-key="4798e9315e7440b19ac5016126328e5e:0">**Note:**</span></span></span>

- <span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="7457fe68d18040d3b976acb1dc8f8a25"><span data-offset-key="7457fe68d18040d3b976acb1dc8f8a25:0">You may only use constant extra space.</span></span></span>

- <span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="11fe692985e04b3db40bb4ce306c0e3d"><span data-offset-key="11fe692985e04b3db40bb4ce306c0e3d:0">Recursive approach is fine, implicit stack space does not count as extra space for this problem.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="25955e9984984cb6b349d0751cf5253c"><span data-offset-key="25955e9984984cb6b349d0751cf5253c:0">**Example:**</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="024e3fd1804e4d1db215f1c9394f83de"><span data-offset-key="024e3fd1804e4d1db215f1c9394f83de:0">Given the following binary tree,</span></span></span>

         1   /  \  2    3 / \    \4   5    7​

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="8c71dd74afc24b10b6e937add929e2bf"><span data-offset-key="8c71dd74afc24b10b6e937add929e2bf:0">After calling your function, the tree should look like:</span></span></span>

         1 -> NULL   /  \  2 -> 3 -> NULL / \    \4-> 5 -> 7 -> NULL​

###

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH400-686c0942--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="d0290bfe091a44838755fb50ddb1e5fe"><span data-offset-key="d0290bfe091a44838755fb50ddb1e5fe:0">Solution:</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="e0a39fee00974b03857f87facf69a6e9"><span data-offset-key="e0a39fee00974b03857f87facf69a6e9:0">**ONE**</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="9309347f1c4f41249dca39dfc1074e5f"><span data-offset-key="9309347f1c4f41249dca39dfc1074e5f:0">Recursive. See </span></span><a href="file:///C:/MY-WEB-DEV/06-DS-ALGO-OUTTER/06-DS-ALGO/main/CONTENT/DS-n-Algos/SANDBOX/116.%20Populating%20Next%20Right%20Pointers%20in%20Each%20Node.md" class="link-a079aa82--primary-53a25e66--link-faf6c434"><span data-key="0a7cfac408364721a7a67f584341cfb4"><span data-offset-key="0a7cfac408364721a7a67f584341cfb4:0">116. Populating Next Right Pointers in Each Node</span></span></a><span data-key="0e0610ab08e34e2b8e12291361da9cec"><span data-offset-key="0e0610ab08e34e2b8e12291361da9cec:0">.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="7cdbb957b3eb4f688f00d300e0e3035e"><span data-offset-key="7cdbb957b3eb4f688f00d300e0e3035e:0">The tree may not be perfect now. So keep finding </span><span data-offset-key="7cdbb957b3eb4f688f00d300e0e3035e:1">`next`</span><span data-offset-key="7cdbb957b3eb4f688f00d300e0e3035e:2"> until there is a node with children, or </span><span data-offset-key="7cdbb957b3eb4f688f00d300e0e3035e:3">`null`</span><span data-offset-key="7cdbb957b3eb4f688f00d300e0e3035e:4">.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="e4c716b169c14bf9ae42bb6611838d9b"><span data-offset-key="e4c716b169c14bf9ae42bb6611838d9b:0">This also means post-order traversal is required.</span></span></span>

    /** * Definition for binary tree with next pointer. * function TreeLinkNode(val) { *     this.val = val; *     this.left = this.right = this.next = null; * } */​/** * @param {TreeLinkNode} root * @return {void} Do not return anything, modify tree in-place instead. */let connect = function(root) {  if (!root) { return }  let next = null  for (let node = root.next; node !== null; node = node.next) {    if (node.left !== null) {      next = node.left      break    }    if (node.right !== null) {      next = node.right      break    }  }  if (root.right !== null) {    root.right.next = next  }  if (root.left !== null) {    root.left.next = root.right || next  }  connect(root.right)  connect(root.left)};

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="924134d4598544e3906b9b72ccf19795"><span data-offset-key="924134d4598544e3906b9b72ccf19795:0">**TWO**</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="432a3ea9abd04bc088636c8ccf73fc3e"><span data-offset-key="432a3ea9abd04bc088636c8ccf73fc3e:0">Level order traversal. Exact same as </span></span><a href="file:///C:/MY-WEB-DEV/06-DS-ALGO-OUTTER/06-DS-ALGO/main/CONTENT/DS-n-Algos/SANDBOX/116.%20Populating%20Next%20Right%20Pointers%20in%20Each%20Node.md" class="link-a079aa82--primary-53a25e66--link-faf6c434"><span data-key="96da25264e3b4147b72de6e4b926f8f3"><span data-offset-key="96da25264e3b4147b72de6e4b926f8f3:0">116. Populating Next Right Pointers in Each Node</span></span></a><span data-key="e8f17fcc6a34443b98022ebb624052bf"><span data-offset-key="e8f17fcc6a34443b98022ebb624052bf:0">.</span></span></span>

    /** * Definition for binary tree with next pointer. * function TreeLinkNode(val) { *     this.val = val; *     this.left = this.right = this.next = null; * } */​/** * @param {TreeLinkNode} root * @return {void} Do not return anything, modify tree in-place instead. */let connect = function(root) {  if (!root) { return }​  const queue = [NaN, root]  while (queue.length > 1) {    const node = queue.shift()    if (node !== node) {      for (let i = 0; i < queue.length; i++) {        queue[i].next = queue[i+1] || null      }      queue.push(NaN)    } else {      if (node.left !== null) { queue.push(node.left) }      if (node.right !== null) { queue.push(node.right) }    }  }};

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="dbdb31e4b86a480bb3c6f2890827f243"><span data-offset-key="dbdb31e4b86a480bb3c6f2890827f243:0">_Template generated via_ </span></span><a href="https://github.com/crimx/crx-leetmark" class="link-a079aa82--primary-53a25e66--link-faf6c434"><span data-key="b2799c17f8f3438eaff04ff992024786"><span data-offset-key="b2799c17f8f3438eaff04ff992024786:0"><em>Leetmark</em></span></span></a><span data-key="104adf93e6a54887808531571daf106e"><span data-offset-key="104adf93e6a54887808531571daf106e:0">_._</span></span></span>

Pascal's Triangle</span></span></a><span data-key="83ed6c7451c64ea6bff0e0338f0b091d"><span data-offset-key="83ed6c7451c64ea6bff0e0338f0b091d:0"><span data-slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH400-686c0942--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="891f0a07cdc4444e98117196b7c5c3b4"><span data-offset-key="891f0a07cdc4444e98117196b7c5c3b4:0">Problem:</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="8288782ed9b7449f8b5c18ed783e3185"><span data-offset-key="8288782ed9b7449f8b5c18ed783e3185:0">Given a non-negative integer </span><span data-offset-key="8288782ed9b7449f8b5c18ed783e3185:1">_numRows_</span><span data-offset-key="8288782ed9b7449f8b5c18ed783e3185:2">, generate the first </span><span data-offset-key="8288782ed9b7449f8b5c18ed783e3185:3">_numRows_</span><span data-offset-key="8288782ed9b7449f8b5c18ed783e3185:4"> of Pascal's triangle.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="c4112fdc3411455db87010a8425b60db"><span data-offset-key="c4112fdc3411455db87010a8425b60db:0">In Pascal's triangle, each number is the sum of the two numbers directly above it.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="90120339bcc94c95b9d35cb5c0b001f2"><span data-offset-key="90120339bcc94c95b9d35cb5c0b001f2:0">**Example:**</span></span></span>

    Input: 5Output:[     [1],    [1,1],   [1,2,1],  [1,3,3,1], [1,4,6,4,1]]​

###

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH400-686c0942--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="15cdfeca1dda41a5b973955998777f69"><span data-offset-key="15cdfeca1dda41a5b973955998777f69:0">Solution:</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="1e99c042c966456a9f5dbdb31c29e757"><span data-offset-key="1e99c042c966456a9f5dbdb31c29e757:0">Dynamic Programming 101.</span></span></span>

    /** * @param {number} numRows * @return {number[][]} */let generate = function(numRows) {  if (numRows <= 0) { return [] }​  const result = [[1]]  for (let i = 1; i < numRows; i++) {    const lastRow = result[i-1]    const row = [1]    for (let j = 1; j < i; j++) {      row[j] = lastRow[j] + lastRow[j-1]    }    row.push(1)    result.push(row)  }    return result};

Pascal's Triangle II</span></span></a><span data-key="6290eacf174c4726bfccb0ee224cb504"><span data-offset-key="6290eacf174c4726bfccb0ee224cb504:0"><span data-slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH400-686c0942--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="98452b879f854eaf9589df0bf4c28c9d"><span data-offset-key="98452b879f854eaf9589df0bf4c28c9d:0">Problem:</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="4a7bf08454ce48d19f57b654f305177e"><span data-offset-key="4a7bf08454ce48d19f57b654f305177e:0">Given a non-negative index </span><span data-offset-key="4a7bf08454ce48d19f57b654f305177e:1">_k_</span><span data-offset-key="4a7bf08454ce48d19f57b654f305177e:2"> where </span><span data-offset-key="4a7bf08454ce48d19f57b654f305177e:3">_k_</span><span data-offset-key="4a7bf08454ce48d19f57b654f305177e:4"> ≤ 33, return the </span><span data-offset-key="4a7bf08454ce48d19f57b654f305177e:5">_k_</span><span data-offset-key="4a7bf08454ce48d19f57b654f305177e:6">th index row of the Pascal's triangle.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="fed47814e6884472a628a58cd6376f45"><span data-offset-key="fed47814e6884472a628a58cd6376f45:0">Note that the row index starts from 0.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="549e9252e2e840869cf0f645a91eeac2"><span data-offset-key="549e9252e2e840869cf0f645a91eeac2:0">In Pascal's triangle, each number is the sum of the two numbers directly above it.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="a2d5e3029ff54a0a91cf6027f1afd457"><span data-offset-key="a2d5e3029ff54a0a91cf6027f1afd457:0">**Example:**</span></span></span>

    Input: 3Output: [1,3,3,1]​

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="9dc42764e05a4165b589f72f335ca0e0"><span data-offset-key="9dc42764e05a4165b589f72f335ca0e0:0">**Follow up:**</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="8e491f592cbb4c75adaff1c298ae9ef2"><span data-offset-key="8e491f592cbb4c75adaff1c298ae9ef2:0">Could you optimize your algorithm to use only </span><span data-offset-key="8e491f592cbb4c75adaff1c298ae9ef2:1">_O_</span><span data-offset-key="8e491f592cbb4c75adaff1c298ae9ef2:2">(</span><span data-offset-key="8e491f592cbb4c75adaff1c298ae9ef2:3">_k_</span><span data-offset-key="8e491f592cbb4c75adaff1c298ae9ef2:4">) extra space?</span></span></span>

###

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH400-686c0942--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="0314cf1d42f34f9dae86666c276c9707"><span data-offset-key="0314cf1d42f34f9dae86666c276c9707:0">Solution:</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="5d70f445a50a4c81941cf916b3a1255e"><span data-offset-key="5d70f445a50a4c81941cf916b3a1255e:0">Dynamic Programming 101 with dynamic array.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="e8e08235d22e43ad8828b29250c89c3a"><span data-offset-key="e8e08235d22e43ad8828b29250c89c3a:0">State </span><span data-offset-key="e8e08235d22e43ad8828b29250c89c3a:1">`(i, j)`</span><span data-offset-key="e8e08235d22e43ad8828b29250c89c3a:2"> depends on </span><span data-offset-key="e8e08235d22e43ad8828b29250c89c3a:3">`(i-1, j)`</span><span data-offset-key="e8e08235d22e43ad8828b29250c89c3a:4"> and </span><span data-offset-key="e8e08235d22e43ad8828b29250c89c3a:5">`(i-1, j-1)`</span><span data-offset-key="e8e08235d22e43ad8828b29250c89c3a:6">. So to access </span><span data-offset-key="e8e08235d22e43ad8828b29250c89c3a:7">`(i-1, j-1)`</span><span data-offset-key="e8e08235d22e43ad8828b29250c89c3a:8"> iteration must be from right to left.</span></span></span>

    /** * @param {number} rowIndex * @return {number[]} */let getRow = function(rowIndex) {  if (rowIndex < 0) { return [] }​  const row = [1]  for (let i = 1; i <= rowIndex; i++) {    for (let j = i - 1; j > 0; j--) {      row[j] += row[j-1]    }    row.push(1)  }    return row};

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="965d86c9951c4d5fa5f7e15845729c6d"><span data-offset-key="965d86c9951c4d5fa5f7e15845729c6d:0">_Template generated via_ </span></span><a href="https://github.com/crimx/crx-leetmark" class="link-a079aa82--primary-53a25e66--link-faf6c434"><span data-key="5e59305100e84eeb9ad4438766219d57"><span data-offset-key="5e59305100e84eeb9ad4438766219d57:0"><em>Leetmark</em></span></span></a><span data-key="cd3ced9d5f58433b9b73a7459e95584e"><span data-offset-key="cd3ced9d5f58433b9b73a7459e95584e:0">_._</span></span></span>

Triangle</span></span></a><span data-key="5b3138c1308b47f897ef71c7ca0eb27f"><span data-offset-key="5b3138c1308b47f897ef71c7ca0eb27f:0"><span data-slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span></span>

###

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH400-686c0942--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="1193e99c070245a49adb671f10dd3275"><span data-offset-key="1193e99c070245a49adb671f10dd3275:0">Problem:</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="72728d1e47da4cd48ec4c864896aa8c5"><span data-offset-key="72728d1e47da4cd48ec4c864896aa8c5:0">Given a triangle, find the minimum path sum from top to bottom. Each step you may move to adjacent numbers on the row below.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="4fdff30bcc864b169dfccd2b17b83027"><span data-offset-key="4fdff30bcc864b169dfccd2b17b83027:0">For example, given the following triangle</span></span></span>

    [     [2],    [3,4],   [6,5,7],  [4,1,8,3]]​

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="1132d2c308ca4dedbd5f76f2c65b009a"><span data-offset-key="1132d2c308ca4dedbd5f76f2c65b009a:0">The minimum path sum from top to bottom is </span><span data-offset-key="1132d2c308ca4dedbd5f76f2c65b009a:1">`11`</span><span data-offset-key="1132d2c308ca4dedbd5f76f2c65b009a:2"> (i.e., </span><span data-offset-key="1132d2c308ca4dedbd5f76f2c65b009a:3">**2**</span><span data-offset-key="1132d2c308ca4dedbd5f76f2c65b009a:4"> + </span><span data-offset-key="1132d2c308ca4dedbd5f76f2c65b009a:5">**3**</span><span data-offset-key="1132d2c308ca4dedbd5f76f2c65b009a:6"> + </span><span data-offset-key="1132d2c308ca4dedbd5f76f2c65b009a:7">**5**</span><span data-offset-key="1132d2c308ca4dedbd5f76f2c65b009a:8"> + </span><span data-offset-key="1132d2c308ca4dedbd5f76f2c65b009a:9">**1**</span><span data-offset-key="1132d2c308ca4dedbd5f76f2c65b009a:10"> = 11).</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="c8997bf628c941a5b51c49fc0ad11762"><span data-offset-key="c8997bf628c941a5b51c49fc0ad11762:0">**Note:**</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="39e505cd60cf4cb6a5d6a7c0ae2d7ded"><span data-offset-key="39e505cd60cf4cb6a5d6a7c0ae2d7ded:0">Bonus point if you are able to do this using only </span><span data-offset-key="39e505cd60cf4cb6a5d6a7c0ae2d7ded:1">_O_</span><span data-offset-key="39e505cd60cf4cb6a5d6a7c0ae2d7ded:2">(</span><span data-offset-key="39e505cd60cf4cb6a5d6a7c0ae2d7ded:3">_n_</span><span data-offset-key="39e505cd60cf4cb6a5d6a7c0ae2d7ded:4">) extra space, where </span><span data-offset-key="39e505cd60cf4cb6a5d6a7c0ae2d7ded:5">_n_</span><span data-offset-key="39e505cd60cf4cb6a5d6a7c0ae2d7ded:6"> is the total number of rows in the triangle.</span></span></span>

###

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH400-686c0942--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="ca32a53ceede4c46ae985c5883a70645"><span data-offset-key="ca32a53ceede4c46ae985c5883a70645:0">Solution:</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="2eb8210139e340248e1876d75cea1ea6"><span data-offset-key="2eb8210139e340248e1876d75cea1ea6:0">Define </span><span data-offset-key="2eb8210139e340248e1876d75cea1ea6:1">`f(i, j)`</span><span data-offset-key="2eb8210139e340248e1876d75cea1ea6:2"> to be the minimum path sum from </span><span data-offset-key="2eb8210139e340248e1876d75cea1ea6:3">`triangle[0][0]`</span><span data-offset-key="2eb8210139e340248e1876d75cea1ea6:4"> to </span><span data-offset-key="2eb8210139e340248e1876d75cea1ea6:5">`triangle[i][j]`</span><span data-offset-key="2eb8210139e340248e1876d75cea1ea6:6">.</span></span></span>

    f(i, 0) = f(i-1, j) + triangle[i][0]f(i, j) = min( f(i-1, j-1), f(i-1, j) ) + triangle[i][j], 0 < j < if(i, i) = f(i-1, i-1) + triangle[i][i], i > 0

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="36056c739bea4154828319c723618418"><span data-offset-key="36056c739bea4154828319c723618418:0">Dynamic array can be used.</span></span></span>

    /** * @param {number[][]} triangle * @return {number} */let minimumTotal = function(triangle) {  if (triangle.length <= 0) { return 0 }​  const dp = [triangle[0][0]]  for (let i = 1; i < triangle.length; i++) {    dp[i] = dp[i-1] + triangle[i][i]    for (let j = i - 1; j >= 1; j--) {      dp[j] = Math.min(dp[j], dp[j-1]) + triangle[i][j]    }    dp[0] += triangle[i][0]  }  return Math.min(...dp)};

Best Time to Buy and Sell Stock</span></span></a><span data-key="5827333af0574397b41c9811c7d4285a"><span data-offset-key="5827333af0574397b41c9811c7d4285a:0"><span data-slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span></span>

###

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH400-686c0942--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="d507a55b18c34d98a61dc6d2706f0777"><span data-offset-key="d507a55b18c34d98a61dc6d2706f0777:0">Problem:</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="ef8a2534f6bf48df9a960a099e982000"><span data-offset-key="ef8a2534f6bf48df9a960a099e982000:0">Say you have an array for which the </span><span data-offset-key="ef8a2534f6bf48df9a960a099e982000:1">_i_</span><span data-offset-key="ef8a2534f6bf48df9a960a099e982000:2">th element is the price of a given stock on day </span><span data-offset-key="ef8a2534f6bf48df9a960a099e982000:3">_i_</span><span data-offset-key="ef8a2534f6bf48df9a960a099e982000:4">.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="023f73a86a2e43ceacff8c476e8ab3dc"><span data-offset-key="023f73a86a2e43ceacff8c476e8ab3dc:0">If you were only permitted to complete at most one transaction (i.e., buy one and sell one share of the stock), design an algorithm to find the maximum profit.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="0cb38ed83ecf4c8c81ac98b81c678a56"><span data-offset-key="0cb38ed83ecf4c8c81ac98b81c678a56:0">Note that you cannot sell a stock before you buy one.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="9e994e55e5cc469c8b3ef78bc152947e"><span data-offset-key="9e994e55e5cc469c8b3ef78bc152947e:0">**Example 1:**</span></span></span>

    Input: [7,1,5,3,6,4]Output: 5Explanation: Buy on day 2 (price = 1) and sell on day 5 (price = 6), profit = 6-1 = 5.             Not 7-1 = 6, as selling price needs to be larger than buying price.​

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="939ac1de99a7453a9b8439d7c230d187"><span data-offset-key="939ac1de99a7453a9b8439d7c230d187:0">**Example 2:**</span></span></span>

    Input: [7,6,4,3,1]Output: 0Explanation: In this case, no transaction is done, i.e. max profit = 0.​

###

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH400-686c0942--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="d8a6bbf16549471e8654f74b325d8bd1"><span data-offset-key="d8a6bbf16549471e8654f74b325d8bd1:0">Solution:</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="0a7b4483614d43d38214dabbdb959f6b"><span data-offset-key="0a7b4483614d43d38214dabbdb959f6b:0">Only care about positive profits. Take the frist item as base and scan to the right. If we encounter an item </span><span data-offset-key="0a7b4483614d43d38214dabbdb959f6b:1">`j`</span><span data-offset-key="0a7b4483614d43d38214dabbdb959f6b:2"> whose price </span><span data-offset-key="0a7b4483614d43d38214dabbdb959f6b:3">`price[j]`</span><span data-offset-key="0a7b4483614d43d38214dabbdb959f6b:4"> is lower than the base (which means if we sell now the profit would be negative), we sell </span><span data-offset-key="0a7b4483614d43d38214dabbdb959f6b:5">`j-1`</span><span data-offset-key="0a7b4483614d43d38214dabbdb959f6b:6"> instead and make </span><span data-offset-key="0a7b4483614d43d38214dabbdb959f6b:7">`j`</span><span data-offset-key="0a7b4483614d43d38214dabbdb959f6b:8"> the new base.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="0e6e7d282f024a76a1c0e6ff56ed616c"><span data-offset-key="0e6e7d282f024a76a1c0e6ff56ed616c:0">Because </span><span data-offset-key="0e6e7d282f024a76a1c0e6ff56ed616c:1">`price[j]`</span><span data-offset-key="0e6e7d282f024a76a1c0e6ff56ed616c:2"> is lower that the base, using </span><span data-offset-key="0e6e7d282f024a76a1c0e6ff56ed616c:3">`j`</span><span data-offset-key="0e6e7d282f024a76a1c0e6ff56ed616c:4"> as new base is guaranteed to gain more profit comparing to the old one.</span></span></span>

    /** * @param {number[]} prices * @return {number} */let maxProfit = function(prices) {  let max = 0  let base = prices[0]  for (let i = 1; i < prices.length; i++) {    const profit = prices[i] - base    if (profit > max) {      max = profit    } else if (profit < 0) {      base = prices[i]    }  }  return max};

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="f860db5d9cc74bc7b84363a336d47d34"><span data-offset-key="f860db5d9cc74bc7b84363a336d47d34:0">_Template generated via_ </span></span><a href="https://github.com/crimx/crx-leetmark" class="link-a079aa82--primary-53a25e66--link-faf6c434"><span data-key="9b87363441134532a87fb7864cc4b3ba"><span data-offset-key="9b87363441134532a87fb7864cc4b3ba:0"><em>Leetmark</em></span></span></a><span data-key="ef7d960b623f4389ad433278a578ae6e"><span data-offset-key="ef7d960b623f4389ad433278a578ae6e:0">_._</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH400-686c0942--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="67db35d5a301457d8f018f1f3b56c9af"><span data-offset-key="67db35d5a301457d8f018f1f3b56c9af:0">Problem:</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="0c2460758cab47b6bd0c14660d18bf91"><span data-offset-key="0c2460758cab47b6bd0c14660d18bf91:0">Say you have an array for which the </span><span data-offset-key="0c2460758cab47b6bd0c14660d18bf91:1">_i_</span><span data-offset-key="0c2460758cab47b6bd0c14660d18bf91:2">th element is the price of a given stock on day </span><span data-offset-key="0c2460758cab47b6bd0c14660d18bf91:3">_i_</span><span data-offset-key="0c2460758cab47b6bd0c14660d18bf91:4">.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="25d56e06d0de4247a28061ffe83918fb"><span data-offset-key="25d56e06d0de4247a28061ffe83918fb:0">Design an algorithm to find the maximum profit. You may complete as many transactions as you like (i.e., buy one and sell one share of the stock multiple times).</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="ac4042688b34445cb353f942cd3aa8c4"><span data-offset-key="ac4042688b34445cb353f942cd3aa8c4:0">**Note:**</span><span data-offset-key="ac4042688b34445cb353f942cd3aa8c4:1"> You may not engage in multiple transactions at the same time (i.e., you must sell the stock before you buy again).</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="cc3cab2437564f369d288d9a6f81ddf0"><span data-offset-key="cc3cab2437564f369d288d9a6f81ddf0:0">**Example 1:**</span></span></span>

    Input: [7,1,5,3,6,4]Output: 7Explanation: Buy on day 2 (price = 1) and sell on day 3 (price = 5), profit = 5-1 = 4.             Then buy on day 4 (price = 3) and sell on day 5 (price = 6), profit = 6-3 = 3.​

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="95f8501c575f4e24b4c524094958679b"><span data-offset-key="95f8501c575f4e24b4c524094958679b:0">**Example 2:**</span></span></span>

    Input: [1,2,3,4,5]Output: 4Explanation: Buy on day 1 (price = 1) and sell on day 5 (price = 5), profit = 5-1 = 4.             Note that you cannot buy on day 1, buy on day 2 and sell them later, as you are             engaging multiple transactions at the same time. You must sell before buying again.​

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="26509fed92dc4200b6b9d9824a7e8196"><span data-offset-key="26509fed92dc4200b6b9d9824a7e8196:0">**Example 3:**</span></span></span>

    Input: [7,6,4,3,1]Output: 0Explanation: In this case, no transaction is done, i.e. max profit = 0.

###

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH400-686c0942--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="81f0954d2b234faeace39cb89cc313c2"><span data-offset-key="81f0954d2b234faeace39cb89cc313c2:0">Solution:</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="3c05a3bba3334acaaed6c18e066eabd9"><span data-offset-key="3c05a3bba3334acaaed6c18e066eabd9:0">Sell immediately after the price drops. Or in other perspective, it is the sum of all the incremental pairs (buy in then immediately sell out).</span></span></span>

    /** * @param {number[]} prices * @return {number} */let maxProfit = function(prices) {  let max = 0  for (let i = 1; i < prices.length; i++) {    if (prices[i] > prices[i-1]) {      max += prices[i] - prices[i-1]    }  }  return max};

Best Time to Buy and Sell Stock III</span></span></a><span data-key="eeb70e9e17184c299f1b63baa0f1b85c"><span data-offset-key="eeb70e9e17184c299f1b63baa0f1b85c:0"><span data-slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span></span>

###

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH400-686c0942--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="51d6b43c350c49a08e585ce0076d0620"><span data-offset-key="51d6b43c350c49a08e585ce0076d0620:0">Problem:</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="54cb6f0db2c24c17b053922ab9043b96"><span data-offset-key="54cb6f0db2c24c17b053922ab9043b96:0">Say you have an array for which the </span><span data-offset-key="54cb6f0db2c24c17b053922ab9043b96:1">_i_</span><span data-offset-key="54cb6f0db2c24c17b053922ab9043b96:2">th element is the price of a given stock on day </span><span data-offset-key="54cb6f0db2c24c17b053922ab9043b96:3">_i_</span><span data-offset-key="54cb6f0db2c24c17b053922ab9043b96:4">.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="cca7ea11a0364a86b447e0a06e054efd"><span data-offset-key="cca7ea11a0364a86b447e0a06e054efd:0">Design an algorithm to find the maximum profit. You may complete at most </span><span data-offset-key="cca7ea11a0364a86b447e0a06e054efd:1">_two_</span><span data-offset-key="cca7ea11a0364a86b447e0a06e054efd:2"> transactions.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="eac4cfe868d6464f8d55afecd9f2b3d0"><span data-offset-key="eac4cfe868d6464f8d55afecd9f2b3d0:0">\*\*Note:\*\*You may not engage in multiple transactions at the same time (i.e., you must sell the stock before you buy again).</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="5190d999dba646daba195e69310fa9a5"><span data-offset-key="5190d999dba646daba195e69310fa9a5:0">**Example 1:**</span></span></span>

    Input: [3,3,5,0,0,3,1,4]Output: 6Explanation: Buy on day 4 (price = 0) and sell on day 6 (price = 3), profit = 3-0 = 3.             Then buy on day 7 (price = 1) and sell on day 8 (price = 4), profit = 4-1 = 3.

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="18b2da663ee146f7a899a3fa4c1c56cf"><span data-offset-key="18b2da663ee146f7a899a3fa4c1c56cf:0">**Example 2:**</span></span></span>

    Input: [1,2,3,4,5]Output: 4Explanation: Buy on day 1 (price = 1) and sell on day 5 (price = 5), profit = 5-1 = 4.             Note that you cannot buy on day 1, buy on day 2 and sell them later, as you are             engaging multiple transactions at the same time. You must sell before buying again.​

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="a17da7e8346d4c2fbafabe69c8d512b7"><span data-offset-key="a17da7e8346d4c2fbafabe69c8d512b7:0">**Example 3:**</span></span></span>

    Input: [7,6,4,3,1]Output: 0Explanation: In this case, no transaction is done, i.e. max profit = 0.

###

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH400-686c0942--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="a744aa875e9d49e49707e0299310b28c"><span data-offset-key="a744aa875e9d49e49707e0299310b28c:0">Solution:</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="5fc4c0a0b9034d22920402fde828e76a"><span data-offset-key="5fc4c0a0b9034d22920402fde828e76a:0">Multiple transactions may not be engaged in at the same time. That means if we view the days that involed in the same transaction as a group, there won't be any intersection. We may complete at most </span><span data-offset-key="5fc4c0a0b9034d22920402fde828e76a:1">_two_</span><span data-offset-key="5fc4c0a0b9034d22920402fde828e76a:2"> transactions, so divide the days into two groups, </span><span data-offset-key="5fc4c0a0b9034d22920402fde828e76a:3">`[0...k]`</span><span data-offset-key="5fc4c0a0b9034d22920402fde828e76a:4"> and </span><span data-offset-key="5fc4c0a0b9034d22920402fde828e76a:5">`[k...n-1]`</span><span data-offset-key="5fc4c0a0b9034d22920402fde828e76a:6">. Notice </span><span data-offset-key="5fc4c0a0b9034d22920402fde828e76a:7">`k`</span><span data-offset-key="5fc4c0a0b9034d22920402fde828e76a:8"> exists in both groups because technically we can sell out then immediately buy in at the same day.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="eb7391b811ad4cba89d3b4269a3e85e2"><span data-offset-key="eb7391b811ad4cba89d3b4269a3e85e2:0">Define </span><span data-offset-key="eb7391b811ad4cba89d3b4269a3e85e2:1">`p1(i)`</span><span data-offset-key="eb7391b811ad4cba89d3b4269a3e85e2:2"> to be the max profit of day </span><span data-offset-key="eb7391b811ad4cba89d3b4269a3e85e2:3">`[0...i]`</span><span data-offset-key="eb7391b811ad4cba89d3b4269a3e85e2:4">. This is just like the problem of </span></span><a href="file:///C:/MY-WEB-DEV/06-DS-ALGO-OUTTER/06-DS-ALGO/main/CONTENT/DS-n-Algos/SANDBOX/121.%20Best%20Time%20to%20Buy%20and%20Sell%20Stock.md" class="link-a079aa82--primary-53a25e66--link-faf6c434"><span data-key="f6301c19f41240aa9c2c55ed55b571ae"><span data-offset-key="f6301c19f41240aa9c2c55ed55b571ae:0">121. Best Time to Buy and Sell Stock</span></span></a><span data-key="df659605cdbc48a7b4f7cd4fbb106f21"><span data-offset-key="df659605cdbc48a7b4f7cd4fbb106f21:0">.</span></span></span>

    p1(0) = 0p1(i) = max( p1(i-1), prices[i] - min(prices[0], ..., prices[i-1]) ), 0 < i <= n-1

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="aaec9aa69ffb404bbf96040651c4d5a1"><span data-offset-key="aaec9aa69ffb404bbf96040651c4d5a1:0">Define </span><span data-offset-key="aaec9aa69ffb404bbf96040651c4d5a1:1">`p2(i)`</span><span data-offset-key="aaec9aa69ffb404bbf96040651c4d5a1:2"> to be the max profit of day </span><span data-offset-key="aaec9aa69ffb404bbf96040651c4d5a1:3">`[i...n-1]`</span><span data-offset-key="aaec9aa69ffb404bbf96040651c4d5a1:4">. This is the mirror of </span><span data-offset-key="aaec9aa69ffb404bbf96040651c4d5a1:5">`p1`</span><span data-offset-key="aaec9aa69ffb404bbf96040651c4d5a1:6">.</span></span></span>

    p2(n-1) = 0p2(i) = max( p2(i+1), max(prices[i], ..., prices[n-1]) - prices[i] ), n-1 > i >= 0

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="213bdcf8a8384a2e9c710dd0927e4078"><span data-offset-key="213bdcf8a8384a2e9c710dd0927e4078:0">Define </span><span data-offset-key="213bdcf8a8384a2e9c710dd0927e4078:1">`f(k)`</span><span data-offset-key="213bdcf8a8384a2e9c710dd0927e4078:2"> to be </span><span data-offset-key="213bdcf8a8384a2e9c710dd0927e4078:3">`p1(k) + p2(k)`</span><span data-offset-key="213bdcf8a8384a2e9c710dd0927e4078:4">. We need to get </span><span data-offset-key="213bdcf8a8384a2e9c710dd0927e4078:5">`max( f(0), ..., f(n-1) )`</span><span data-offset-key="213bdcf8a8384a2e9c710dd0927e4078:6">.</span></span></span>

    /** * @param {number[]} prices * @return {number} */let maxProfit = function(prices) {  const len = prices.length  if (len <= 1) { return 0 }​  const dp = [0]​  let min = prices[0]  for (let i = 1; i < len; i++) {    dp[i] = Math.max(dp[i-1], prices[i] - min)    min = Math.min(prices[i], min)  }​  let p2 = 0  let max = prices[len-1]  for (let i = len-2; i >= 0; i--) {    max = Math.max(prices[i], max)    p2 = Math.max(p2, max - prices[i])    dp[i] += p2  }​  return Math.max(...dp)};

Binary Tree Maximum Path Sum</span></span></a><span data-key="71ae753dddb84d979d755e0f0e5d78ef"><span data-offset-key="71ae753dddb84d979d755e0f0e5d78ef:0"><span data-slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span></span>

###

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH400-686c0942--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="dde7f453806e40c8978785b3949aa8a6"><span data-offset-key="dde7f453806e40c8978785b3949aa8a6:0">Problem:</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="a8b9094b88f6486a9927ce0718a263ad"><span data-offset-key="a8b9094b88f6486a9927ce0718a263ad:0">Given a </span><span data-offset-key="a8b9094b88f6486a9927ce0718a263ad:1">**non-empty**</span><span data-offset-key="a8b9094b88f6486a9927ce0718a263ad:2"> binary tree, find the maximum path sum.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="197f77fc613e4043a5d9c489fe161dd4"><span data-offset-key="197f77fc613e4043a5d9c489fe161dd4:0">For this problem, a path is defined as any sequence of nodes from some starting node to any node in the tree along the parent-child connections. The path must contain </span><span data-offset-key="197f77fc613e4043a5d9c489fe161dd4:1">**at least one node**</span><span data-offset-key="197f77fc613e4043a5d9c489fe161dd4:2"> and does not need to go through the root.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="17db9cd6c6474ce6b302500d54c5f516"><span data-offset-key="17db9cd6c6474ce6b302500d54c5f516:0">**Example 1:**</span></span></span>

    Input: [1,2,3]​       1      / \     2   3​Output: 6​

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="e3b3bd13aa2f47409d5e2def2c246e9b"><span data-offset-key="e3b3bd13aa2f47409d5e2def2c246e9b:0">**Example 2:**</span></span></span>

    Input: [-10,9,20,null,null,15,7]​   -10   / \  9  20    /  \   15   7​Output: 42​

###

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH400-686c0942--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="5ea5a8c187054ba1a9602fc117906a0c"><span data-offset-key="5ea5a8c187054ba1a9602fc117906a0c:0">Solution:</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="125dec7a590c4d4ca7b97bce25a001d5"><span data-offset-key="125dec7a590c4d4ca7b97bce25a001d5:0">For every </span><span data-offset-key="125dec7a590c4d4ca7b97bce25a001d5:1">`node`</span><span data-offset-key="125dec7a590c4d4ca7b97bce25a001d5:2">, there are six possible ways to get the max path sum:</span></span></span>

- <span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="e93f37ba4f3f4fbca1a1d30b603b70d5"><span data-offset-key="e93f37ba4f3f4fbca1a1d30b603b70d5:0">With </span><span data-offset-key="e93f37ba4f3f4fbca1a1d30b603b70d5:1">`node.val`</span></span></span>

  1.  <span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="152c3fbd260849b5b40f70b155e2e68f"><span data-offset-key="152c3fbd260849b5b40f70b155e2e68f:0">`node.val`</span><span data-offset-key="152c3fbd260849b5b40f70b155e2e68f:1"> plus the max sum of a path that ends with </span><span data-offset-key="152c3fbd260849b5b40f70b155e2e68f:2">`node.left`</span><span data-offset-key="152c3fbd260849b5b40f70b155e2e68f:3">.</span></span></span>

  2.  <span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="433462de81914c68a676b8a2712fd861"><span data-offset-key="433462de81914c68a676b8a2712fd861:0">`node.val`</span><span data-offset-key="433462de81914c68a676b8a2712fd861:1"> plus the max sum of a path that starts with </span><span data-offset-key="433462de81914c68a676b8a2712fd861:2">`node.right`</span><span data-offset-key="433462de81914c68a676b8a2712fd861:3">.</span></span></span>

  3.  <span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="258d32f1854445bbbdad409b2eb6301b"><span data-offset-key="258d32f1854445bbbdad409b2eb6301b:0">`node.val`</span><span data-offset-key="258d32f1854445bbbdad409b2eb6301b:1"> plus the max sum of both paths.</span></span></span>

  4.  <span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="0d0269d653964bbabc757164bc9fcf5d"><span data-offset-key="0d0269d653964bbabc757164bc9fcf5d:0">Just </span><span data-offset-key="0d0269d653964bbabc757164bc9fcf5d:1">`node.val`</span><span data-offset-key="0d0269d653964bbabc757164bc9fcf5d:2"> (the max sum of both paths are negative).</span></span></span>

- <span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="e5376f41460b430eae55965f79320f64"><span data-offset-key="e5376f41460b430eae55965f79320f64:0">Without</span><span data-offset-key="e5376f41460b430eae55965f79320f64:1">`node.val`</span><span data-offset-key="e5376f41460b430eae55965f79320f64:2"> (disconnected)</span></span></span>

  1.  <span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="63d755cbc3a6435cbef04649234a3975"><span data-offset-key="63d755cbc3a6435cbef04649234a3975:0">The max-sum path is somewhere under the </span><span data-offset-key="63d755cbc3a6435cbef04649234a3975:1">`node.left`</span><span data-offset-key="63d755cbc3a6435cbef04649234a3975:2"> subtree.</span></span></span>

  2.  <span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="197460de48054a7599df0efcf5da77db"><span data-offset-key="197460de48054a7599df0efcf5da77db:0">The max-sum path is somewhere under the </span><span data-offset-key="197460de48054a7599df0efcf5da77db:1">`node.right`</span><span data-offset-key="197460de48054a7599df0efcf5da77db:2"> subtree.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="4eb4711e413341ddb7f5a3aaf6d5c5b5"><span data-offset-key="4eb4711e413341ddb7f5a3aaf6d5c5b5:0">There are two ways to implement this.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="4edef78ba0e44535a8850fb90a20f2eb"><span data-offset-key="4edef78ba0e44535a8850fb90a20f2eb:0">**ONE**</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="f1afb694ba1741068419f2256ea6cadf"><span data-offset-key="f1afb694ba1741068419f2256ea6cadf:0">Define a function that returns two values. The max sum of a path that may or may not end with </span><span data-offset-key="f1afb694ba1741068419f2256ea6cadf:1">`root`</span><span data-offset-key="f1afb694ba1741068419f2256ea6cadf:2"> node, and the max sum of the path that ends with </span><span data-offset-key="f1afb694ba1741068419f2256ea6cadf:3">`root`</span><span data-offset-key="f1afb694ba1741068419f2256ea6cadf:4"> node.</span></span></span>

    /** * Definition for a binary tree node. * function TreeNode(val) { *     this.val = val; *     this.left = this.right = null; * } *//** * @param {TreeNode} root * @return {number} */let maxPathSum = function(root) {  return Math.max(..._maxPathSum(root))};​/** * @param {TreeNode} root * @return {number[]} */function _maxPathSum (root) {  if (!root) { return [-Infinity, -Infinity] }    const left = _maxPathSum(root.left)  const right = _maxPathSum(root.right)  return [    Math.max(left[0], right[0], root.val + Math.max(0, left[1], right[1], left[1] + right[1])),    Math.max(left[1], right[1], 0) + root.val  ]}

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="2030763ef1044cd68ef41ed4eec2c014"><span data-offset-key="2030763ef1044cd68ef41ed4eec2c014:0">**TWO**</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="aa6cd7ae52874ce0bf3064dc33f7a99f"><span data-offset-key="aa6cd7ae52874ce0bf3064dc33f7a99f:0">Just return the later (max sum of a path that ends with </span><span data-offset-key="aa6cd7ae52874ce0bf3064dc33f7a99f:1">`root`</span><span data-offset-key="aa6cd7ae52874ce0bf3064dc33f7a99f:2">). Maintain a global variable to store the disconnected max sum.</span></span></span>

    /** * Definition for a binary tree node. * function TreeNode(val) { *     this.val = val; *     this.left = this.right = null; * } *//** * @param {TreeNode} root * @return {number} */let maxPathSum = function(root) {  const global = { max: -Infinity }  _maxPathSum(root, global)  return global.max};​​/** * @param {TreeNode} root * @param {object} global * @param {number} global.max  * @return {number[]} */function _maxPathSum (root, global) {  if (!root) { return -Infinity }    const left = _maxPathSum(root.left, global)  const right = _maxPathSum(root.right, global)  const localMax = Math.max(left, right, 0) + root.val  global.max = Math.max(global.max, localMax, root.val + left + right)  return localMax}

Valid Palindrome</span></span></a><span data-key="67948060c9f94254b7630291e7f31f3a"><span data-offset-key="67948060c9f94254b7630291e7f31f3a:0"><span data-slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH400-686c0942--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="42df98d06259495da5ca7ec979bebc52"><span data-offset-key="42df98d06259495da5ca7ec979bebc52:0">Problem:</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="69ca1f6d7d3b48678e47edb65e04b68e"><span data-offset-key="69ca1f6d7d3b48678e47edb65e04b68e:0">Given a string, determine if it is a palindrome, considering only alphanumeric characters and ignoring cases.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="23237a50601d402d9e3d492a92133b9b"><span data-offset-key="23237a50601d402d9e3d492a92133b9b:0">**Note:**</span><span data-offset-key="23237a50601d402d9e3d492a92133b9b:1"> For the purpose of this problem, we define empty string as valid palindrome.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="1f06c86baad54d6e8a871d879c64c206"><span data-offset-key="1f06c86baad54d6e8a871d879c64c206:0">**Example 1:**</span></span></span>

    Input: "A man, a plan, a canal: Panama"Output: true​

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="28dc3ad6b9824df19ac7574813460bc3"><span data-offset-key="28dc3ad6b9824df19ac7574813460bc3:0">**Example 2:**</span></span></span>

    Input: "race a car"Output: false​

###

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH400-686c0942--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="041761004a8a49c79e8dbd552d51a20a"><span data-offset-key="041761004a8a49c79e8dbd552d51a20a:0">Solution:</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="9d0bb8aed3a54b458923d167e410b235"><span data-offset-key="9d0bb8aed3a54b458923d167e410b235:0">**ONE**</span></span></span>

    /** * @param {string} s * @return {boolean} */let isPalindrome = function(s) {  const clean = s.toLowerCase().split(/[^a-z0-9]*/)  return clean.join('') === clean.reverse().join('')};

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="01e170a9acb242d097c47a7b692142a1"><span data-offset-key="01e170a9acb242d097c47a7b692142a1:0">**TWO**</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="52ebe38dd0bb422e971716a66e2d9ad1"><span data-offset-key="52ebe38dd0bb422e971716a66e2d9ad1:0">Remove non-alphanumeric characters then compare.</span></span></span>

    /** * @param {string} s * @return {boolean} */let isPalindrome = function(s) {  const clean = s.replace(/[^a-zA-Z0-9]/g, '').toLowerCase()  for (let i = 0, j = clean.length - 1; i < j; i++, j--) {    if (clean[i] !== clean[j]) { return false }  }  return true};

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="5b9be688d21e4cb28c1c6eac100f9a42"><span data-offset-key="5b9be688d21e4cb28c1c6eac100f9a42:0">**THREE**</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="740293ce1230484898f14ac0a543b8f3"><span data-offset-key="740293ce1230484898f14ac0a543b8f3:0">Compare the char codes.</span></span></span>

    /** * @param {string} s * @return {boolean} */let isPalindrome = function(s) {  for (let i = 0, j = s.length - 1; i < j; i++, j--) {    let left = s.charCodeAt(i)    while (i < j && (left < 48 || left > 57 && left < 65 || left > 90 && left < 97 || left > 122)) {      left = s.charCodeAt(++i)    }    if (i >= j) { return true }    if (left >= 65 && left <= 90) {      left += 32    }        let right = s.charCodeAt(j)    while (i < j && (right < 48 || right > 57 && right < 65 || right > 90 && right < 97 || right > 122)) {      right = s.charCodeAt(--j)    }    if (i >= j) { return true }    if (right >= 65 && right <= 90) {      right += 32    }        if (left !== right) { return false }  }    return true};

2.  <span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="38bf40a9fd564503a7c329c3eaa2368b"><span data-offset-key="38bf40a9fd564503a7c329c3eaa2368b:0">Each transformed word must exist in the word list. Note that </span><span data-offset-key="38bf40a9fd564503a7c329c3eaa2368b:1">_beginWord_</span><span data-offset-key="38bf40a9fd564503a7c329c3eaa2368b:2"> is </span><span data-offset-key="38bf40a9fd564503a7c329c3eaa2368b:3">_not_</span><span data-offset-key="38bf40a9fd564503a7c329c3eaa2368b:4"> a transformed word.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH400-686c0942--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="6ef88358f4a7409cbfee1b7025d691b5"><span data-offset-key="6ef88358f4a7409cbfee1b7025d691b5:0">Solution:</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="8497c9ff6f6c46d7bb11e19fdee6aa95"><span data-offset-key="8497c9ff6f6c46d7bb11e19fdee6aa95:0">This is just like </span></span><a href="file:///C:/MY-WEB-DEV/06-DS-ALGO-OUTTER/06-DS-ALGO/main/CONTENT/DS-n-Algos/SANDBOX/127.%20Word%20Ladder" class="link-a079aa82--primary-53a25e66--link-faf6c434"><span data-key="e2a9e064328545389b31a705aa3633df"><span data-offset-key="e2a9e064328545389b31a705aa3633df:0">127. Word Ladder</span></span></a><span data-key="bea236acf7444119948613739373d3a4"><span data-offset-key="bea236acf7444119948613739373d3a4:0">.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="3b9cf6cdd8f342099bba6aa15e37fc82"><span data-offset-key="3b9cf6cdd8f342099bba6aa15e37fc82:0">The constrain still works, but instead of deleting the words right away, collect them and delete them all when a level ends, so that we can reuse the words (matching different parents in the same level).</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="1de2f5c3913c475c858a9e746add29ac"><span data-offset-key="1de2f5c3913c475c858a9e746add29ac:0">The items in the queue are not just words now. Parent nodes are also kept so that we can backtrack the path from the end.</span></span></span>

    /** * @param {string} beginWord * @param {string} endWord * @param {string[]} wordList * @return {string[][]} */function findLadders (beginWord, endWord, wordList) {  wordList = new Set(wordList)  if (!wordList.has(endWord)) { return [] }​  const ALPHABET = 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'​  const result = []  let isEndWordFound = false  const levelWords = new Set()  const queue = [[beginWord, null], null]  while (queue.length > 1) {    const node = queue.shift()​    if (node === null) {      if (isEndWordFound) {        break      }      levelWords.forEach(word => wordList.delete(word))      levelWords.clear()      queue.push(null)      continue    }​    const word = node[0]​    for (let i = word.length - 1; i >= 0; i--) {      const head = word.slice(0, i)      const tail = word.slice(i+1)​      for (let c = 0; c < 26; c++) {        if (ALPHABET[c] !== word[i]) {          const w = head + ALPHABET[c] + tail          if (w === endWord) {            const path = [endWord]            for (let n = node; n !== null; n = n[1]) {              path.unshift(n[0])            }            result.push(path)            isEndWordFound = true          }          if (wordList.has(w)) {            levelWords.add(w)            queue.push([w, node])          }        }      }    }  }​  return result};

- <span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="c0576f5f81a64501a287a81a50a8af7e"><span data-offset-key="c0576f5f81a64501a287a81a50a8af7e:0">All words contain only lowercase alphabetic characters.</span></span></span>

- <span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="1e7f5e0b74a542c3a44f5a4b92a4ef98"><span data-offset-key="1e7f5e0b74a542c3a44f5a4b92a4ef98:0">You may assume no duplicates in the word list.</span></span></span>

- <span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="4513e0b5a97b4d1887d7f8321fc6cf83"><span data-offset-key="4513e0b5a97b4d1887d7f8321fc6cf83:0">You may assume </span><span data-offset-key="4513e0b5a97b4d1887d7f8321fc6cf83:1">_beginWord_</span><span data-offset-key="4513e0b5a97b4d1887d7f8321fc6cf83:2"> and </span><span data-offset-key="4513e0b5a97b4d1887d7f8321fc6cf83:3">_endWord_</span><span data-offset-key="4513e0b5a97b4d1887d7f8321fc6cf83:4"> are non-empty and are not the same.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="d1c4305d45e340e88fc44718b8d78a0b"><span data-offset-key="d1c4305d45e340e88fc44718b8d78a0b:0">**Example 1:**</span></span></span>

    Input:beginWord = "hit",endWord = "cog",wordList = ["hot","dot","dog","lot","log","cog"]​Output: 5​Explanation: As one shortest transformation is "hit" -> "hot" -> "dot" -> "dog" -> "cog",return its length 5.​

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="c98df13bd99a4941a08db3d55511e311"><span data-offset-key="c98df13bd99a4941a08db3d55511e311:0">**Example 2:**</span></span></span>

    Input:beginWord = "hit"endWord = "cog"wordList = ["hot","dot","dog","lot","log"]​Output: 0​Explanation: The endWord "cog" is not in wordList, therefore no possible transformation.​

###

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH400-686c0942--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="1ea7fc301b2e4338826603a5e147026b"><span data-offset-key="1ea7fc301b2e4338826603a5e147026b:0">Solution:</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="4f8f2e4b6be74fbf8fdf6e6dd1811f8f"><span data-offset-key="4f8f2e4b6be74fbf8fdf6e6dd1811f8f:0">Think of it as building a tree, with </span><span data-offset-key="4f8f2e4b6be74fbf8fdf6e6dd1811f8f:1">`begineWord`</span><span data-offset-key="4f8f2e4b6be74fbf8fdf6e6dd1811f8f:2"> as root and </span><span data-offset-key="4f8f2e4b6be74fbf8fdf6e6dd1811f8f:3">`endWord`</span><span data-offset-key="4f8f2e4b6be74fbf8fdf6e6dd1811f8f:4"> as leaves.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="93cf76de0e3743feaadecf379f36032c"><span data-offset-key="93cf76de0e3743feaadecf379f36032c:0">The best way control the depth (length of the shortest transformations) while building the tree is level-order traversal (BFS).</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="c6b2826ce36b41398a641bd6b06747e1"><span data-offset-key="c6b2826ce36b41398a641bd6b06747e1:0">We do not actually build the tree because it is expensive (astronomical if the list is huge). In fact, we only need one shortest path. So just like Dijkstra's algorithm, we say that the first time (level </span><span data-offset-key="c6b2826ce36b41398a641bd6b06747e1:1">`i`</span><span data-offset-key="c6b2826ce36b41398a641bd6b06747e1:2">) we encounter a word that turns out to be in a shortest path, then level </span><span data-offset-key="c6b2826ce36b41398a641bd6b06747e1:3">`i`</span><span data-offset-key="c6b2826ce36b41398a641bd6b06747e1:4"> is the lowest level this word could ever get. We can safely remove it from the </span><span data-offset-key="c6b2826ce36b41398a641bd6b06747e1:5">`wordList`</span><span data-offset-key="c6b2826ce36b41398a641bd6b06747e1:6">.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="b3e165c1ee9540f0acd8b30885edfec2"><span data-offset-key="b3e165c1ee9540f0acd8b30885edfec2:0">To find all the next words, instead of filtering the </span><span data-offset-key="b3e165c1ee9540f0acd8b30885edfec2:1">`wordList`</span><span data-offset-key="b3e165c1ee9540f0acd8b30885edfec2:2">, enumerate all 25 possible words and check if in </span><span data-offset-key="b3e165c1ee9540f0acd8b30885edfec2:3">`wordList`</span><span data-offset-key="b3e165c1ee9540f0acd8b30885edfec2:4">.</span></span></span>

    /** * @param {string} beginWord * @param {string} endWord * @param {string[]} wordList * @return {number} */let ladderLength = function(beginWord, endWord, wordList) {  wordList = new Set(wordList)  if (!wordList.has(endWord)) { return 0 }​  const ALPHABET = 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz'​  let level = 1  const queue = [beginWord, null]  while (queue.length > 1) {    const word = queue.shift()​    if (word === null) {      level++      queue.push(null)      continue    }​    for (let i = word.length - 1; i >= 0; i--) {      const head = word.slice(0, i)      const tail = word.slice(i+1)​      for (let c = 0; c < 26; c++) {        if (ALPHABET[c] !== word[i]) {          const word = head + ALPHABET[c] + tail          if (word === endWord) {            return level + 1          }          if (wordList.delete(word)) {            queue.push(word)          }        }      }    }  }​  return 0};

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="6e53359666da446eaa9c2c0d05c0d207"><span data-offset-key="6e53359666da446eaa9c2c0d05c0d207:0">_Template generated via_ </span></span><a href="https://github.com/crimx/crx-leetmark" class="link-a079aa82--primary-53a25e66--link-faf6c434"><span data-key="8dd6a6fbddfb41dcb4c2b7f5e0c68eda"><span data-offset-key="8dd6a6fbddfb41dcb4c2b7f5e0c68eda:0"><em>Leetmark</em></span></span></a><span data-key="b9ba1a73c29947a0836ae1b80a50b02f"><span data-offset-key="b9ba1a73c29947a0836ae1b80a50b02f:0">_._</span></span></span>

Longest Consecutive Sequence</span></span></a><span data-key="2a21bde061bc48148436912ec0116090"><span data-offset-key="2a21bde061bc48148436912ec0116090:0"><span data-slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH400-686c0942--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="a0b346095e8945c1835b7c82cb5aff2b"><span data-offset-key="a0b346095e8945c1835b7c82cb5aff2b:0">Problem:</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="05882c00f48f41e4a0af2ae6c838cf76"><span data-offset-key="05882c00f48f41e4a0af2ae6c838cf76:0">Given an unsorted array of integers, find the length of the longest consecutive elements sequence.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="5f33e4487c9b44deaf1175aa3af0965a"><span data-offset-key="5f33e4487c9b44deaf1175aa3af0965a:0">Your algorithm should run in O(</span><span data-offset-key="5f33e4487c9b44deaf1175aa3af0965a:1">_n_</span><span data-offset-key="5f33e4487c9b44deaf1175aa3af0965a:2">) complexity.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="20139dfb5f9f416881e994a3659a09d6"><span data-offset-key="20139dfb5f9f416881e994a3659a09d6:0">**Example:**</span></span></span>

    Input: [100, 4, 200, 1, 3, 2]Output: 4Explanation: The longest consecutive elements sequence is [1, 2, 3, 4]. Therefore its length is 4.​

###

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH400-686c0942--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="aeabc78a70cb4003ad48c895098230a9"><span data-offset-key="aeabc78a70cb4003ad48c895098230a9:0">Solution:</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="463bcfd208a447188d36a15c08f3c593"><span data-offset-key="463bcfd208a447188d36a15c08f3c593:0">Build a Set from the list. Pick a number, find all it's adjacent numbers that are also in the Set. Count them and remove them all from the Set. Repeat until the Set is empty. Time complexity O(n + n) = O(n).</span></span></span>

    /** * @param {number[]} nums * @return {number} */let longestConsecutive = function(nums) {  const numSet = new Set(nums)  let maxCount = 0  while (numSet.size > 0) {    const num = numSet.values().next().value    numSet.delete(num)    let count = 1    for (let n = num + 1; numSet.delete(n); n++) {      count++    }    for (let n = num - 1; numSet.delete(n); n--) {      count++    }    if (count > maxCount) {      maxCount = count    }  }  return maxCount};

Sum Root to Leaf Numbers</span></span></a><span data-key="fd1bb9d2534f46a0ac527c895468d935"><span data-offset-key="fd1bb9d2534f46a0ac527c895468d935:0"><span data-slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH400-686c0942--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="e709a81db0084fe79022b272ee2ab13f"><span data-offset-key="e709a81db0084fe79022b272ee2ab13f:0">Problem:</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="f3a634ecd1aa4aab94fda69da5764614"><span data-offset-key="f3a634ecd1aa4aab94fda69da5764614:0">Given a binary tree containing digits from </span><span data-offset-key="f3a634ecd1aa4aab94fda69da5764614:1">`0-9`</span><span data-offset-key="f3a634ecd1aa4aab94fda69da5764614:2"> only, each root-to-leaf path could represent a number.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="1aaf8bcdeb77468f984f2bcc2ca406f8"><span data-offset-key="1aaf8bcdeb77468f984f2bcc2ca406f8:0">An example is the root-to-leaf path </span><span data-offset-key="1aaf8bcdeb77468f984f2bcc2ca406f8:1">`1->2->3`</span><span data-offset-key="1aaf8bcdeb77468f984f2bcc2ca406f8:2"> which represents the number </span><span data-offset-key="1aaf8bcdeb77468f984f2bcc2ca406f8:3">`123`</span><span data-offset-key="1aaf8bcdeb77468f984f2bcc2ca406f8:4">.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="d0c85961052a42d993d14a265fe4fd6d"><span data-offset-key="d0c85961052a42d993d14a265fe4fd6d:0">Find the total sum of all root-to-leaf numbers.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="7e9c652797af4290bbe48b4291203c93"><span data-offset-key="7e9c652797af4290bbe48b4291203c93:0">**Note:**</span><span data-offset-key="7e9c652797af4290bbe48b4291203c93:1"> A leaf is a node with no children.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="c499f80eb8694423897383c06bb1ae37"><span data-offset-key="c499f80eb8694423897383c06bb1ae37:0">**Example:**</span></span></span>

    Input: [1,2,3]    1   / \  2   3Output: 25Explanation:The root-to-leaf path 1->2 represents the number 12.The root-to-leaf path 1->3 represents the number 13.Therefore, sum = 12 + 13 = 25.

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="d3e704810a5b49068f3b7b20412cda59"><span data-offset-key="d3e704810a5b49068f3b7b20412cda59:0">**Example 2:**</span></span></span>

    Input: [4,9,0,5,1]    4   / \  9   0 / \5   1Output: 1026Explanation:The root-to-leaf path 4->9->5 represents the number 495.The root-to-leaf path 4->9->1 represents the number 491.The root-to-leaf path 4->0 represents the number 40.Therefore, sum = 495 + 491 + 40 = 1026.

###

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH400-686c0942--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="746c1b04cfb14d38a226dd0eb6a80d5c"><span data-offset-key="746c1b04cfb14d38a226dd0eb6a80d5c:0">Solution:</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="05d76c9b8d7d4615809f5eff322ef923"><span data-offset-key="05d76c9b8d7d4615809f5eff322ef923:0">To write a clean solution for this promblem, use </span><span data-offset-key="05d76c9b8d7d4615809f5eff322ef923:1">`0`</span><span data-offset-key="05d76c9b8d7d4615809f5eff322ef923:2"> as indicator of leaf node. If all the children get </span><span data-offset-key="05d76c9b8d7d4615809f5eff322ef923:3">`0`</span><span data-offset-key="05d76c9b8d7d4615809f5eff322ef923:4">, it is a leaf node, return the sum of current level.</span></span></span>

    /** * Definition for a binary tree node. * function TreeNode(val) { *     this.val = val; *     this.left = this.right = null; * } *//** * @param {TreeNode} root * @return {number} */let sumNumbers = function(root, sum = 0) {  if (!root) { return 0 }  sum = sum * 10 + root.val  return sumNumbers(root.left, sum) + sumNumbers(root.right, sum) || sum};
