Surrounded Regions</span></span></a><span data-key="82422e97e66347cb8de7c6db84fcb9ed"><span data-offset-key="82422e97e66347cb8de7c6db84fcb9ed:0"><span data-slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span></span>

###

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH400-686c0942--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="013e5a226f0d4cdb9d57e2a27f832f27"><span data-offset-key="013e5a226f0d4cdb9d57e2a27f832f27:0">Problem:</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="e351c0ebc90c44f19f017a9a188c3122"><span data-offset-key="e351c0ebc90c44f19f017a9a188c3122:0">Given a 2D board containing </span><span data-offset-key="e351c0ebc90c44f19f017a9a188c3122:1">`'X'`</span><span data-offset-key="e351c0ebc90c44f19f017a9a188c3122:2"> and </span><span data-offset-key="e351c0ebc90c44f19f017a9a188c3122:3">`'O'`</span><span data-offset-key="e351c0ebc90c44f19f017a9a188c3122:4"> (</span><span data-offset-key="e351c0ebc90c44f19f017a9a188c3122:5">**the letter O**</span><span data-offset-key="e351c0ebc90c44f19f017a9a188c3122:6">), capture all regions surrounded by </span><span data-offset-key="e351c0ebc90c44f19f017a9a188c3122:7">`'X'`</span><span data-offset-key="e351c0ebc90c44f19f017a9a188c3122:8">.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="a3370147876640b09cad725e9503f1fb"><span data-offset-key="a3370147876640b09cad725e9503f1fb:0">A region is captured by flipping all </span><span data-offset-key="a3370147876640b09cad725e9503f1fb:1">`'O'`</span><span data-offset-key="a3370147876640b09cad725e9503f1fb:2">s into </span><span data-offset-key="a3370147876640b09cad725e9503f1fb:3">`'X'`</span><span data-offset-key="a3370147876640b09cad725e9503f1fb:4">s in that surrounded region.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="d952583ad6854d2fbac7046114c25b95"><span data-offset-key="d952583ad6854d2fbac7046114c25b95:0">**Example:**</span></span></span>

    X X X XX O O XX X O XX O X X​

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="3c25d7e65ff04411a433ab7c53642762"><span data-offset-key="3c25d7e65ff04411a433ab7c53642762:0">After running your function, the board should be:</span></span></span>

    X X X XX X X XX X X XX O X X​

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="345b424cc3434519b4564a54f84312f1"><span data-offset-key="345b424cc3434519b4564a54f84312f1:0">**Explanation:**</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="76113d8a96a246a2a67d281a5bb0a5cf"><span data-offset-key="76113d8a96a246a2a67d281a5bb0a5cf:0">Surrounded regions shouldn't be on the border, which means that any </span><span data-offset-key="76113d8a96a246a2a67d281a5bb0a5cf:1">`'O'`</span><span data-offset-key="76113d8a96a246a2a67d281a5bb0a5cf:2"> on the border of the board are not flipped to </span><span data-offset-key="76113d8a96a246a2a67d281a5bb0a5cf:3">`'X'`</span><span data-offset-key="76113d8a96a246a2a67d281a5bb0a5cf:4">. Any </span><span data-offset-key="76113d8a96a246a2a67d281a5bb0a5cf:5">`'O'`</span><span data-offset-key="76113d8a96a246a2a67d281a5bb0a5cf:6"> that is not on the border and it is not connected to an </span><span data-offset-key="76113d8a96a246a2a67d281a5bb0a5cf:7">`'O'`</span><span data-offset-key="76113d8a96a246a2a67d281a5bb0a5cf:8"> on the border will be flipped to </span><span data-offset-key="76113d8a96a246a2a67d281a5bb0a5cf:9">`'X'`</span><span data-offset-key="76113d8a96a246a2a67d281a5bb0a5cf:10">. Two cells are connected if they are adjacent cells connected horizontally or vertically.</span></span></span>

###

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH400-686c0942--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="d33f5826ec5b432abe475033ac586407"><span data-offset-key="d33f5826ec5b432abe475033ac586407:0">Solution:</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="248f826d40824500bb1540ed36f2d773"><span data-offset-key="248f826d40824500bb1540ed36f2d773:0">Find all the </span><span data-offset-key="248f826d40824500bb1540ed36f2d773:1">`O`</span><span data-offset-key="248f826d40824500bb1540ed36f2d773:2">s that are connected to the </span><span data-offset-key="248f826d40824500bb1540ed36f2d773:3">`O`</span><span data-offset-key="248f826d40824500bb1540ed36f2d773:4">s on the border, change them to </span><span data-offset-key="248f826d40824500bb1540ed36f2d773:5">`#`</span><span data-offset-key="248f826d40824500bb1540ed36f2d773:6">. Then scan the board, change </span><span data-offset-key="248f826d40824500bb1540ed36f2d773:7">`O`</span><span data-offset-key="248f826d40824500bb1540ed36f2d773:8"> to </span><span data-offset-key="248f826d40824500bb1540ed36f2d773:9">`X`</span><span data-offset-key="248f826d40824500bb1540ed36f2d773:10"> and </span><span data-offset-key="248f826d40824500bb1540ed36f2d773:11">`#`</span><span data-offset-key="248f826d40824500bb1540ed36f2d773:12"> back to </span><span data-offset-key="248f826d40824500bb1540ed36f2d773:13">`O`</span><span data-offset-key="248f826d40824500bb1540ed36f2d773:14">.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="64d570d4cee14aee8df88b04d322d976"><span data-offset-key="64d570d4cee14aee8df88b04d322d976:0">The process of finding the connected </span><span data-offset-key="64d570d4cee14aee8df88b04d322d976:1">`O`</span><span data-offset-key="64d570d4cee14aee8df88b04d322d976:2">s is just like tree traversal. </span><span data-offset-key="64d570d4cee14aee8df88b04d322d976:3">`O`</span><span data-offset-key="64d570d4cee14aee8df88b04d322d976:4">s on the border are the same level. Their children are the second level. And so on.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="09fa047ffc0647e781a7db86afc4bb6f"><span data-offset-key="09fa047ffc0647e781a7db86afc4bb6f:0">So both BFS and DFS are good. I prefer BFS when pruning is not needed in favor of its readability.</span></span></span>

    /** * @param {character[][]} board * @return {void} Do not return anything, modify board in-place instead. */let solve = function(board) {  const height = board.length  if (height <= 1) { return }  const width = board[0].length  if (width <= 1) { return }​  const rowend = height - 1  const colend = width - 1​  const queue = []​  for (let row = 0; row < height; row++) {    if (board[row][0] === 'O') {      board[row][0] = '#'      queue.push(row, 0)    }    if (board[row][colend] === 'O') {      board[row][colend] = '#'      queue.push(row, colend)    }  }​  for (let col = 0; col < width; col++) {    if (board[0][col] === 'O') {      board[0][col] = '#'      queue.push(0, col)    }    if (board[rowend][col] === 'O') {      board[rowend][col] = '#'      queue.push(rowend, col)    }  }​  while (queue.length > 0) {    const row = queue.shift()    const col = queue.shift()    if (row < rowend && board[row + 1][col] === 'O') {      board[row + 1][col] = '#'      queue.push(row + 1, col)    }    if (row > 0 && board[row - 1][col] === 'O') {      board[row - 1][col] = '#'      queue.push(row - 1, col)    }    if (board[row][col + 1] === 'O') {      board[row][col + 1] = '#'      queue.push(row, col + 1)    }    if (board[row][col - 1] === 'O') {      board[row][col - 1] = '#'      queue.push(row, col - 1)    }  }​  for (let row = 0; row < height; row++) {    for (let col = 0; col < width; col++) {      if (board[row][col] === '#') {        board[row][col] = 'O'      } else if (board[row][col] === 'O') {        board[row][col] = 'X'      }    }  }};

Clone Graph</span></span></a><span data-key="a506e15dd16747778d74c3fc9a088aaa"><span data-offset-key="a506e15dd16747778d74c3fc9a088aaa:0"><span data-slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span></span>

###

<span class="text-4505230f--HeadingH400-686c0942--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="cd7840525ae8479498f9138de997cb93"><span data-offset-key="cd7840525ae8479498f9138de997cb93:0">Problem:</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="1f74a6b3ed064f85a6a9fed112e9c66e"><span data-offset-key="1f74a6b3ed064f85a6a9fed112e9c66e:0">Given the head of a graph, return a deep copy (clone) of the graph. Each node in the graph contains a </span><span data-offset-key="1f74a6b3ed064f85a6a9fed112e9c66e:1">`label`</span><span data-offset-key="1f74a6b3ed064f85a6a9fed112e9c66e:2"> (</span><span data-offset-key="1f74a6b3ed064f85a6a9fed112e9c66e:3">`int`</span><span data-offset-key="1f74a6b3ed064f85a6a9fed112e9c66e:4">) and a list (</span><span data-offset-key="1f74a6b3ed064f85a6a9fed112e9c66e:5">`List[UndirectedGraphNode]`</span><span data-offset-key="1f74a6b3ed064f85a6a9fed112e9c66e:6">) of its </span><span data-offset-key="1f74a6b3ed064f85a6a9fed112e9c66e:7">`neighbors`</span><span data-offset-key="1f74a6b3ed064f85a6a9fed112e9c66e:8">. There is an edge between the given node and each of the nodes in its neighbors.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="c612a4a24f8e4d13a878c103e38a6c0b"><span data-offset-key="c612a4a24f8e4d13a878c103e38a6c0b:0">OJ's undirected graph serialization (so you can understand error output):</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="7d8e713c836748eb9ea96e1689a9c700"><span data-offset-key="7d8e713c836748eb9ea96e1689a9c700:0">Nodes are labeled uniquely.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="ff71294ec0cb435c97ec25f9190942d6"><span data-offset-key="ff71294ec0cb435c97ec25f9190942d6:0">We use </span><span data-offset-key="ff71294ec0cb435c97ec25f9190942d6:1">`#`</span><span data-offset-key="ff71294ec0cb435c97ec25f9190942d6:2"> as a separator for each node, and </span><span data-offset-key="ff71294ec0cb435c97ec25f9190942d6:3">`,`</span><span data-offset-key="ff71294ec0cb435c97ec25f9190942d6:4"> as a separator for node label and each neighbor of the node.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="8981fba467ca4b68aa027e50e84fd702"><span data-offset-key="8981fba467ca4b68aa027e50e84fd702:0">As an example, consider the serialized graph </span><span data-offset-key="8981fba467ca4b68aa027e50e84fd702:1">`{0,1,2#1,2#2,2}`</span><span data-offset-key="8981fba467ca4b68aa027e50e84fd702:2">.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="0b9f78d128ad4f649d241c27b484d678"><span data-offset-key="0b9f78d128ad4f649d241c27b484d678:0">The graph has a total of three nodes, and therefore contains three parts as separated by </span><span data-offset-key="0b9f78d128ad4f649d241c27b484d678:1">`#`</span><span data-offset-key="0b9f78d128ad4f649d241c27b484d678:2">.</span></span></span>

1.  <span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="d2d8259a06d64f5c8071b71e45b86937"><span data-offset-key="d2d8259a06d64f5c8071b71e45b86937:0">First node is labeled as </span><span data-offset-key="d2d8259a06d64f5c8071b71e45b86937:1">`0`</span><span data-offset-key="d2d8259a06d64f5c8071b71e45b86937:2">. Connect node </span><span data-offset-key="d2d8259a06d64f5c8071b71e45b86937:3">`0`</span><span data-offset-key="d2d8259a06d64f5c8071b71e45b86937:4"> to both nodes </span><span data-offset-key="d2d8259a06d64f5c8071b71e45b86937:5">`1`</span><span data-offset-key="d2d8259a06d64f5c8071b71e45b86937:6"> and </span><span data-offset-key="d2d8259a06d64f5c8071b71e45b86937:7">`2`</span><span data-offset-key="d2d8259a06d64f5c8071b71e45b86937:8">.</span></span></span>

2.  <span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="c9c7026a765b4fab8c3a0d8c16884377"><span data-offset-key="c9c7026a765b4fab8c3a0d8c16884377:0">Second node is labeled as </span><span data-offset-key="c9c7026a765b4fab8c3a0d8c16884377:1">`1`</span><span data-offset-key="c9c7026a765b4fab8c3a0d8c16884377:2">. Connect node </span><span data-offset-key="c9c7026a765b4fab8c3a0d8c16884377:3">`1`</span><span data-offset-key="c9c7026a765b4fab8c3a0d8c16884377:4"> to node </span><span data-offset-key="c9c7026a765b4fab8c3a0d8c16884377:5">`2`</span><span data-offset-key="c9c7026a765b4fab8c3a0d8c16884377:6">.</span></span></span>

3.  <span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="cd387399a5fa466e8afa8cddbe1534f3"><span data-offset-key="cd387399a5fa466e8afa8cddbe1534f3:0">Third node is labeled as </span><span data-offset-key="cd387399a5fa466e8afa8cddbe1534f3:1">`2`</span><span data-offset-key="cd387399a5fa466e8afa8cddbe1534f3:2">. Connect node </span><span data-offset-key="cd387399a5fa466e8afa8cddbe1534f3:3">`2`</span><span data-offset-key="cd387399a5fa466e8afa8cddbe1534f3:4"> to node </span><span data-offset-key="cd387399a5fa466e8afa8cddbe1534f3:5">`2`</span><span data-offset-key="cd387399a5fa466e8afa8cddbe1534f3:6"> (itself), thus forming a self-cycle.</span></span></span>

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="c513105c2468470e87829dc14d3ebd37"><span data-offset-key="c513105c2468470e87829dc14d3ebd37:0">Visually, the graph looks like the following:</span></span></span>

           1      / \     /   \    0 --- 2         / \         \_/​

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="b6738bfcb3c04da881a75b46e7c79a56"><span data-offset-key="b6738bfcb3c04da881a75b46e7c79a56:0">**Note**</span><span data-offset-key="b6738bfcb3c04da881a75b46e7c79a56:1">: The information about the tree serialization is only meant so that you can understand error output if you get a wrong answer. <span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="36396a549c6341f788687fdcc5846e7b"><span data-offset-key="36396a549c6341f788687fdcc5846e7b:0">DFS. Cache the visited node before entering the next recursion.</span></span></span>

    /** * Definition for undirected graph. * function UndirectedGraphNode(label) { *     this.label = label; *     this.neighbors = [];   // Array of UndirectedGraphNode * } */​/** * @param {UndirectedGraphNode} graph * @return {UndirectedGraphNode} */let cloneGraph = function(graph) {  const cache = {}  return _clone(graph)​  function _clone (graph) {    if (!graph) { return graph }    const label = graph.label    if (!cache[label]) {      cache[label] = new UndirectedGraphNode(label)      cache[label].neighbors = graph.neighbors.map(_clone)    }    return cache[label]  }};

<span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1"><span data-key="c196cbadf3814fabb98a8f0796651f89"><span data-offset-key="c196cbadf3814fabb98a8f0796651f89:0">_Template generated via_ </span></span><a href="https://github.com/crimx/crx-leetmark" class="link-a079aa82--primary-53a25e66--link-faf6c434"><span data-key="d0bf65bc2d3b4c5abaf96021ef55a426"><span data-offset-key="d0bf65bc2d3b4c5abaf96021ef55a426:0"><em>Leetmark</em></span></span></a><span data-key="fd9cd9adfe0c4d53a663eecf413595d2"><span data-offset-key="fd9cd9adfe0c4d53a663eecf413595d2:0">_._</span></span></span>

<figure><embed src="http://127.0.0.1:5500/_RESOURCES/_DS-n-Algos/_MY_OPRIGINAL_DS/SANDBOX/leetMD/completeLEETCODE_files/binary-tree-upside-down.webp" class="image-52799b3c" /><figcaption><span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1" style="max-width: 100%">alt text</span></figcaption></figure>

    /** * Definition for a binary tree node. * function TreeNode(val) { *     this.val = val; *     this.left = this.right = null; * } *//** * @param {TreeNode} root * @return {TreeNode} */const upsideDownBinaryTree = function(root) {  let curr = root  let next = null  let temp = null  let prev = null  while (curr !== null) {    next = curr.left    curr.left = temp    temp = curr.right    curr.right = prev    prev = curr    curr = next  }  return prev}​// another​const upsideDownBinaryTree = function(root) {  if (root == null || root.left == null) {    return root  }  const newRoot = upsideDownBinaryTree(root.left)  root.left.left = root.right  root.left.right = root  root.left = null  root.right = null  return newRoot}

<figure><img src="http://127.0.0.1:5500/_RESOURCES/_DS-n-Algos/_MY_OPRIGINAL_DS/SANDBOX/leetMD/completeLEETCODE_files/maximum-sum-circular-subarray.png" alt="alt text" class="image-52799b3c" /><figcaption><span class="text-4505230f--TextH400-3033861f--textContentFamily-49a318e1" style="max-width: 100%">alt text</span></figcaption></figure>

    /** * @param {number[]} A * @return {number} */const maxSubarraySumCircular = function(A) {  let minSum = Infinity, sum = 0, maxSum = -Infinity, curMax = 0, curMin = 0  for(let a of A) {    sum += a    curMax = Math.max(curMax + a, a);    maxSum = Math.max(maxSum, curMax);    curMin = Math.min(curMin + a, a);    minSum = Math.min(minSum, curMin);  }  return  maxSum > 0 ? Math.max(maxSum, sum - minSum) : maxSum;};

    /** * @param {number[][]} intervals * @return {number} */const minMeetingRooms = function(intervals) {  const len = intervals.length  const starts = new Array(len)  const ends = new Array(len)  for (let i = 0; i < len; i++) {    starts[i] = intervals[i][0]    ends[i] = intervals[i][1]  }  starts.sort((a, b) => a - b)  ends.sort((a, b) => a - b)  let rooms = 0  let endsIdx = 0  for (let i = 0; i < len; i++) {    if (starts[i] < ends[endsIdx]) rooms++    else endsIdx++  }  return rooms}
